doc: urban flood risk mapping using the GARP and QUEST model : A comparative study of machine learning technique .
flood risk mapping and modeling is important to prevent urban flood damage .

in this study , a flood risk map was produced with limited hydrological and hydraulic data using two state-of-the-art machine learning model : Genetic Algorithm Rule-Set Production ( GARP ) and Quick Unbiased Efficient Statistical Tree ( QUEST ) .
the flood conditioning factor used in modeling were : precipitation , slope , curve number , distance to river , distance to channel , depth to groundwater , land use , and elevation .
based on available report and field survey for Sari city ( Iran ) , 113 point were identified as flooded area ( with each flooded zone assigned a value of 1 ) .

different conditioning factor , including urban density , quality of building , age of building , population density , and socio-economic condition , were taken into account to analyze flood vulnerability .
in addition , the weight of these conditioning factor was determined based on expert knowledge and Fuzzy Analytical Network Process ( FANP ) .
an urban flood risk map was then produced using flood hazard and flood vulnerability map .
the area under the receiver-operator characteristic curve ( AUC-ROC ) and Kappa statistic were applied to evaluate model performance .
the result demonstrated that the GARP model ( AUC-ROC = 93.5 % , Kappa = 0.86 ) had higher performance accuracy than the QUEST model ( AUC-ROC = 89.2 % , Kappa = 0.79 ) .

the result also indicated that distance to channel , land use , and elevation played major role in flood hazard determination , whereas population density , quality of building , and urban density were the most important factor in term of vulnerability .
these finding demonstrate that machine learning model can help in flood risk mapping , especially in area where detailed hydraulic and hydrological data are not available .
urban land use and land cover classification using remotely sensed sar data through deep belief network .
land use and land cover ( LULC ) mapping in urban area is one of the core application in remote sensing , and it plays an important role in modern urban planning and management .
deep learning is springing up in the field of machine learning recently .
by mimicking the hierarchical structure of the human brain , deep learning can gradually extract feature from lower level to higher level .
the Deep Belief Networks ( DBN ) model is a widely investigated and deployed deep learning architecture .
it combines the advantage of unsupervised and supervised learning and can archive good classification performance .
this study proposes a classification approach based on the DBN model for detailed urban mapping using polarimetric synthetic aperture radar ( PolSAR ) data .
through the DBN model , effective contextual mapping feature can be automatically extracted from the PolSAR data to improve the classification performance .
two-date high-resolution RADARSAT-2 PolSAR data over the Great Toronto Area were used for evaluation .

comparison with the support vector machine ( SVM ) , conventional neural network ( NN ) , and stochastic Expectation-Maximization ( SEM ) were conducted to assess the potential of the DBN-based classification approach .
experimental result show that the DBN-based method outperform three other approach and produces homogenous mapping result with preserved shape detail .
exploring the optimal integration level between SAR and optical data for better urban land cover mapping in the Pearl River Delta .
integrating synthetic aperture radar ( SAR ) and optical data to improve urban land cover classification has been identified as a promising approach .
however , which integration level is the most suitable remain unclear but important to many researcher and engineer .
this study aimed to compare different integration level for providing a scientific reference for a wide range of study using optical and SAR data .

sar data from TerraSAR-X and ENVISAT ASAR in both WSM and IMP mode were used to be combined with optical data at pixel level , feature level and decision level using four typical machine learning method .

the experimental result indicated that : 1 ) feature level that used both the original image and extracted feature achieved a significant improvement of up to 10 % compared to that using optical data alone ; 2 ) different level of fusion required different suitable method depending on the data distribution and data resolution .
for instance , support vector machine was the most stable at both the feature and decision level , while random forest was suitable at the pixel level but not suitable at the decision level .
3 ) By examining the distribution of SAR feature , some feature ( e.g.
, homogeneity ) exhibited a close-to-normal distribution , explaining the improvement from the maximum likelihood method at the feature and decision level .
this indicated the benefit of using texture feature from SAR data when being combined with optical data for land cover classification .

additionally , the research also shown that combining optical and SAR data does not guarantee improvement compared with using single data source for urban land cover classification , depending on the selection of appropriate fusion level and fusion method .
urban water resource management for sustainable environment planning using artificial intelligence technique .
in the current era , water is a significant resource for socio-economic growth and the protection of healthy environment .
properly controlled water resource are considered a vital part of development , which reduces poverty and equity .
conventional Water system Management maximizes the existing water flows available to satisfy all competing demand , including on-site water and groundwater .
therefore , Climatic change would intensify the specific challenge in water resource management by contributing to uncertainty .
sustainable water resource management is an essential process for ensuring the earth 's life and the future .
nonlinear effect , stochastic dynamic , and hydraulic constraint are challenging in ecological planning for sustainable water development .
in this paper , Adaptive Intelligent Dynamic Water Resource Planning ( AIDWRP ) has been proposed to sustain the urban area ' water environment .
here , an adaptive intelligent approach is a subset of the Artificial Intelligence ( AI ) technique in which environmental planning for sustainable water development has been modeled effectively .

artificial intelligence modeling improve water efficiency by transforming information into a leaner process , improving decision-making based on data-driven by combining numeric AI tool and human intellectual skill .

in AIDWRP , Markov Decision Process ( MDP ) discusses the dynamic water resource management issue with annual use and released locational constraint that develop sensitivity-driven method to optimize several efficient environmental planning and management policy .

consequently , there is a specific relief from the engagement of supply and demand for water resource , and substantial improvement in local economic efficiency have been simulated with numerical outcome .
mapping urban form and function at city block level using spatial metric .

this paper focuses on the potential of urban metric describing the presence and the configuration of built-up and open space area for mapping distinct type of urban form and function at city block level .

next to traditional , patch-based metric used in landscape ecology , alternative metric are proposed , measuring the presence and the spatial arrangement of built-up and open space area along a set of radial transect , along contour parallel to the urban block boundary and along the block 's perimeter , as well as metric describing the internal composition of the built-up area .
use of the proposed metric for identifying different type of urban form and function was tested on the Brussels Capital Region .
large-scale vector data was used to define built-up structure and to analyse the morphological property of the built-up area at block level .

decision tree classification was applied in conjunction with bootstrap aggregation to gain insight in the distinctive character of the defined metric , and the robustness of land use and urban form classification based on these metric .

our study point out the shortcoming of traditional landscape ecological metric for mapping urban form and emphasizes the need for alternative approach for analysing urban landscape , more explicitly describing the morphological characteristic of the urban fabric .
streetvizor : Visual Exploration of Human-Scale Urban Forms Based on Street Views .
urban form at human-scale , i.e.
, urban environment that individual can sense ( e.g.
, sight , smell , and touch ) in their daily live , can provide unprecedented insight on a variety of application , such as urban planning and environment auditing .
the analysis of urban form can help planner develop high-quality urban space through evidence-based design .
however , such analysis is complex because of the involvement of spatial , multi-scale ( i.e.
, city , region , and street ) , and multivariate ( e.g.
, greenery and sky ratio ) nature of urban form .
in addition , current method either lack quantitative measurement or are limited to a small area .

the primary contribution of this work is the design of StreetVizor , an interactive visual analytic system that helps planner leverage their domain knowledge in exploring human-scale urban form based on street view image .

our system presents two-stage visual exploration : 1 ) an AOI Explorer for the visual comparison of spatial distribution and quantitative measurement in two areas-of-interest ( AOIs ) at city- and region-scale ; 2 ) and a Street Explorer with a novel parallel coordinate plot for the exploration of the fine-grained detail of the urban form at the street-scale .
we integrate visualization technique with machine learning model to facilitate the detection of street view pattern .
we illustrate the applicability of our approach with case study on the real-world dataset of four city , i.e.
, Hong Kong , Singapore , Greater London and New York City .
interview with domain expert demonstrate the effectiveness of our system in facilitating various analytical task .
land Classification Using Remotely Sensed Data : Going Multilabel .
obtaining an up-to-date high-resolution description of land cover is a challenging task due to the high cost and labor-intensive process of human annotation through field study .

this work introduces a radically novel approach for achieving this goal by exploiting the proliferation of remote sensing satellite imagery , allowing for the up-to-date generation of global-scale land cover map .

we propose the application of multilabel classification , a powerful framework in machine learning , for inferring the complex relationship between the acquired satellite image and the spectral profile of different type of surface material .

introducing a drastically different approach compared to unsupervised spectral unmixing , we employ contemporary ground-collected data from the European Environment Agency to generate the label set and multispectral image from the MODIS sensor to generate the spectral feature , under a supervised classification framework .

to validate the merit of our approach , we present result using several state-of-the-art multilabel learning classifier and evaluate their predictive performance with respect to the number of annotated training example , as well as their capability to exploit example from neighboring region or different time instance .
we also demonstrate the application of our method on hyperspectral data from the Hyperion sensor for the urban land cover estimation of New York City .

experimental result suggest that the proposed framework can achieve excellent prediction accuracy , even from a limited number of diverse training example , surpassing state-of-the-art spectral unmixing method .
microsite condition dominate habitat selection of the red mason bee ( Osmia bicornis , Hymenoptera : Megachilidae ) in an urban environment : A case study from Leipzig , Germany .
the red mason bee ( Osmia bicornis L. ) is a common wild bee in urban environment which contributes to early-season pollination .
we know only little about how any specie of wild bee in city respond to resource distribution or landscape structure and the urban habitat ( s ) that they prefer .
we employed a citizen science approach to investigate driver behind the spatial distribution of this solitary bee in the urban region of Leipzig ( Germany ) .
volunteer hung trap nest at different location and collected information on eight local , microsite condition ( such as sun exposure , attachment position , local flower availability ) .
we derived 14 landscape factor from a digital GIS biotope data map ( e.g .
distance to flower site and urban matrix property such as size and edge length of patch ) .
both occurrence and abundance of O. bicornis were then analyzed using a combination of machine learning and multiple ( logistic ) regression .
the result indicate that the red mason bee is ubiquitous in urban area but clearly profit from nearby floral resource .
although we expected a balanced influence of landscape factor and microsite condition , we found that hang location of the trap nest was most important , followed by sun exposure .

city with many fine-scaled floral resource ( such as private garden but not park ) and an open housing structure with higher sun exposure between building provide a good environment for cavity-nesting bee such as O. bicornis .
in Place without suitable nesting opportunity , artificial nest can support the bee .
spatial prediction of landslide susceptibility using GIS-based statistical and machine learning model in Wanzhou County , Three Gorges Reservoir , China .
landslide susceptibility mapping is vital for landslide risk management and urban planning .

in this study , we used three statistical model [ frequency ratio , certainty factor and index of entropy ( IOE ) ] and a machine learning model [ random forest ( RF ) ] for landslide susceptibility mapping in Wanzhou County , China .
first , a landslide inventory map was prepared using earlier geotechnical investigation report , aerial image , and field survey .
then , the redundant factor were excluded from the initial fourteen landslide causal factor via factor correlation analysis .
to determine the most effective causal factor , landslide susceptibility evaluation were performed based on four case with different combination of factor ( “ case ” ) .
in the analysis , 465 ( 70 % ) landslide location were randomly selected for model training , and 200 ( 30 % ) landslide location were selected for verification .
the result showed that case 3 produced the best performance for the statistical model and that case 2 produced the best performance for the RF model .
finally , the receiver operating characteristic ( ROC ) curve was used to verify the accuracy of each model ’ s result for its respective optimal case .

the ROC curve analysis showed that the machine learning model performed better than the other three model , and among the three statistical model , the IOE model with weight coefficient was superior .
identification of low-carbon travel block based on GIS hotspot analysis using spatial distribution learning algorithm .
in the future , big data will become an efficient and useful mean for improving urban planning , and machine learning can take city as a simplified and efficient system .
we take full advantage of the benefit of new technology , but also clarify that city is not a machine , also can not fully mechanically control the urban development .
this study presents a methodology for identifying low-carbon travel block , which can be used to identify the built environment conducive to resident ’ low-carbon travel .
we chose the four element of traffic survey—travel mode , travel time , travel purpose and travel frequency—as the framework to evaluate travel carbon emission .

using the index data collected from “ WeChat , ” a popular social-media platform in China and questionnaire survey , we conducted hotspot analysis of the spatial distribution of travel carbon emission in GIS .
we obtained a comprehensive carbon emission and its spatial distribution through the superposition of hotspot density surface of different indexe .
the result show that E block within the research area has the lowest travel carbon emission .

these result suggest some planning implication from three aspects—land use mode , road network and public service facility : In the old urban district of Pucheng , the ratio of residential building area and other type ’ building area should be “ 4:1–3:1 ” ; and we should develop the travel model of bicycle , and the interval of bicycle Lane should be 350–450 m ; The ratio of walking road to total road area should be 15–20 % , and the width of road should be restricted .

coverage of transit site buffered for the radius of 150 m is 40–50 % , coverage of shopping service buffered for the radius of 50 m is 45–60 % , and coverage of recreational facility buffered for the radius of 100 m is 50–70 % .
the result confirm that “ functional mixing ” and “ dense road network ” are beneficial to resident ’ low-carbon travel proposed by the predecessor .
at the same time , we found that not the higher volume rate is , the more favorable for low-carbon travel .
small city have limited number of population and scattered distribution of professional post , which are not suitable for the traditional mode of improving the volume ratio and the bus system .

it is not that the higher the bus station coverage is , the better for resident to travel as low-carbon , and the high popularity of public transportation in small city will increase the carbon emission of resident .
the study provides a new way to evaluate the carbon emission assessment of block and provides a basis for block planning with low-carbon concept .
understanding city with machine eye : A review of deep computer vision in urban analytic .
modelling urban system has interested planner and modeller for decade .
different model have been achieved relying on mathematic , cellular automation , complexity , and scaling .

while most of these model tend to be a simplification of reality , today within the paradigm shift of artificial intelligence across the different Field of science , the application of computer vision show promising potential in understanding the realistic dynamic of city .
while city are complex by nature , computer vision shows progress in tackling a variety of complex physical and non-physical visual task .
in this article , we review the task and algorithms of computer vision and their application in understanding city .
we attempt to subdivide computer vision algorithms into task , and city into layer to show evidence of where computer vision is intensively applied and where further research is needed .

we focus on highlighting the potential role of computer vision in understanding urban system related to the built environment , natural environment , human interaction , transportation , and infrastructure .

after showing the diversity of computer vision algorithms and application , the challenge that remain in understanding the integration between these different layer of city and their interaction with one another relying on deep learning and computer vision .
we also show recommendation for practice and policy-making toward reaching AI-generated urban policy .
multiscale road centerline extraction from high-resolution aerial imagery .
accurate road extraction from high-resolution aerial imagery has many application such as urban planning and vehicle navigation system .
the common road extraction method are based on classification algorithm , which needs to design robust handcrafted feature for road .
however , designing such feature is difficult .
for the road centerlines extraction problem , the existing algorithms have some limitation , such as spur , time consuming .

to address the above issue to some extent , we introduce the feature learning based on deep learning to extract robust feature automatically , and present a method to extract road centerline based on multiscale Gabor filter and multiple directional non-maximum suppression .
the proposed algorithm consists of the following four step .
firstly , the aerial imagery is classified by a pixel-wise classifier based on convolutional neural network ( CNN ) .
specifically , CNN is used to learn feature from raw data automatically , especially the structural feature .
then , edge-preserving filtering is conducted on the resulting classification map , with the original imagery serving as the guidance image .
it is exploited to preserve the edge and the detail of the road .
after that , we do some post-processing based on shape feature to extract more reliable Road .
finally , multiscale Gabor filter and multiple directional non-maximum suppression are integrated to get a complete and accurate road network .
experimental result show that the proposed method can achieve comparable or higher quantitative result , as well as more satisfactory visual performance .
progressively Expanded Neural Network ( PEN Net ) for hyperspectral image classification : A new neural network paradigm for remote sensing image analysis .
hyperspectral image ( HSI ) has been used for a wide range of application including forestry , urban planning , and precision agriculture .
in recent year , machine learning based algorithms , such as support vector machine , decision tree , ensemble learning , and their variation have shown promising result in HSI analysis .
such methodology , nevertheless , can lead to insufficient information abstraction in interpreting hyperspectral pixel .

in this paper , we propose a novel neural network based classification algorithm , named Progressively Expanded Neural Network ( PEN Net ) , that can effectively interpret hyperspectral pixel in nonlinear feature space and then determine their category .
furthermore , a spectral-spatial HSI classification framework is also introduced to test the generality and robustness of the PEN Net .

experimental result on four standard hyperspectral dataset illustrate that : ( 1 ) PEN Net classifier yield better accuracy and competitive processing speed in HSI classification task compared to the state-of-the-art method ; ( 2 ) Multi-hidden layer based PEN Net generally provides better performance than single hidden layer one ; ( 3 ) Combination of spectral and spatial feature in the PEN Net classifier can significantly improve the classification accuracy by 6–15 % compared to the spectral only based HSI classification .
this study implies that the proposed neural network architecture opens a new window for future research and the potential for remote sensing image analysis .
urban traffic flow analysis based on deep learning car detection from cctv image series .
traffic flow analysis is fundamental for urban planning and management of road traffic infrastructure .
automatic number plate recognition ( ANPR ) system are conventional method for vehicle detection and travel time estimation .
however , such system are specifically focused on car plate , providing a limited extent of road user .

the advance of open-source deep learning convolutional neural network ( CNN ) in combination with freely-available closed-circuit television ( CCTV ) dataset have offered the opportunity for detection and classification of various road user .

the research , presented here , aims to analyse traffic flow pattern through fine-tuning pre-trained CNN model on domain-specific low quality imagery , as captured in various weather condition and season of the year 2018 .
such imagery is collected from the North East Combined Authority ( NECA ) Travel and Transport Data , Newcastle upon Tyne , UK .

result show that the fine-tuned MobileNet model with 98.2 % precision , 58.5 % recall and 73.4 % harmonic mean could potentially be used for a real time traffic monitoring application with big data , due to its fast performance .

compared to MobileNet , the fine-tuned Faster region proposal R-CNN model , providing a better harmonic mean ( 80.4 % ) , recall ( 68.8 % ) and more accurate estimation of car unit , could be used for traffic analysis application that demand higher accuracy than speed .
this research ultimately exploits machine learning alogrithms for a wider understanding of traffic congestion and disruption under social event and extreme weather condition .
deprivation pocket through the len of convolutional neural network .
machine learning technique have been frequently applied to map urban deprivation ( commonly referred to as slum ) in very high-resolution satellite image .
among these , Deep Convolutional Neural Networks have shown exceptional efficiency in automated deprivation mapping at the local scale .
yet these network have never been used to map very small heterogeneous deprivation area ( pocket ) at large scale .
this study proposes and evaluates a U-Net-Compound model to map deprivation pocket in Bangalore , India .
the model only relies on RGB satellite image with a resolution of 2 m as these are more commonly accessible to local urban planning department .
the experiment assumes a practical situation where only limited reference data is available for the model to learn the spatial morphology of deprivation pocket .
it tests whether an updated map of deprivation pocket can be obtained with limited information .
the model performance to map a large number of deprivation pocket is examined by incrementally changing the model architecture and the amount of training data .
result show that the proposed model is sensitive to the amount of spatial information contained in the training data .

once sufficient spatial information is learnt through a few sample , the city scale mapping accuracy outperform existing model in mapping small deprivation pocket , achieving a Jaccard Index of 54 % .

this study demonstrated that a well-designed convolutional neural network can map the existence , extent , as well as distribution pattern of deprivation pocket at the city scale with limited training data , which is essential for upscaling research output to provide important information for the formulation of pro-poor policy .
structure and information in spatial segregation .
ethnoracial residential segregation is a complex , multiscalar phenomenon with immense moral and economic cost .
modeling the structure and dynamic of segregation is a pressing problem for sociology and urban planning , but existing method have limitation .
in this paper , we develop a suite of method , grounded in information theory , for studying the spatial structure of segregation .

we first advance existing profile and decomposition method by posing two related regionalization method , which allow for profile curve with nonconstant spatial scale and decomposition analysis with nonarbitrary areal unit .
we then formulate a measure of local spatial scale , which may be used for both detailed , within-city analysis and intercity comparison .
these method highlight detailed insight in the structure and dynamic of urban segregation that would be otherwise easy to miss or difficult to quantify .
they are computationally efficient , applicable to a broad range of study question , and freely available in open source software .
landslide susceptibility assessment of wildfire burnt area through earth-observation technique and a machine learning-based approach .
climate change has increased the likelihood of the occurrence of disaster like wildfire , flood , storm , and landslide worldwide in the last year .
weather condition change continuously and rapidly , and wildfire are occurring repeatedly and diffusing with higher intensity .

the burnt catchment are known , in many part of the world , as one of the main sensitive area to debris flow characterized by different trigger mechanism ( runoff-initiated and debris slide-initiated debris flow ) .

the large number of study produced in recent decade has shown how the response of a watershed to precipitation can be extremely variable , depending on several on-site condition , as well as the characteristic of precipitation duration and intensity .

moreover , the availability of satellite data has significantly improved the ability to identify the area affected by wildfire , and , even more importantly , to carry out post-fire assessment of burnt area .

many difficulty have to be faced in attempting to assess landslide risk in burnt area , which present a higher likelihood of occurrence ; in densely populated neighbourhood , human activity can be the cause of the origin of the fire .
the latter is , in fact , one of the main operation used by man to remove vegetation along slope in an attempt to claim new land for pasture or construction purpose .
regarding the study area , the Camaldoli and Agnano hill ( Naples , Italy ) fires seem to act as a predisposing factor , while the triggering factor is usually represented by precipitation .
eleven predisposing factor were chosen and estimated according to previous knowledge of the territory and a database consisting of 400 landslide was adopted .

the present work aimed to expand the knowledge of the relationship existing between the triggering of landslide and burnt area through the following phase : ( 1 ) Processing of the thematic map of the burnt area through band composition of satellite image ; and ( 2 ) landslide susceptibility assessment through the application of a new statistical approach ( machine learning technique ) .
the analysis has the scope to support decision maker and local agency in urban planning and safety monitoring of the environment .
allocation of emergency response centre in response to pluvial flooding-prone demand point using integrated multiple layer perceptron and maximum coverage location problem model .

the increase in the frequency and intensity of rainfall event due to global climate change and the development of additional pavement , Road and water storage site due to population growth have enhanced the probability of pluvial flooding ( PF ) in urban area .
the estimation of urban pluvial flood vulnerability and prompt emergency response are crucial step toward urban planning and risk mitigation .
however , uncertainty exist in the optimal allocation of emergency response centre ( ERCs ) .
this study assessed the current situation of ERCs in term of PF-prone demand point .
in this study , fire and police station , hospital and military camp were defined as ERCs , and residential building , where people spend most of their time , were considered demand point .
our study area was Damansara City in Peninsular Malaysia , which is frequently affected by PF .

we combined an optimised PF probability model with ideal location allocation method on a geographic information system platform to construct the proposed model for achieving accurate ERC spatial planning .
firstly , PF-prone urban area were identified using a recent machine learning multiple layer perceptron ( MLP ) model .
then , a Taguchi method was used to calibrate the MLP variable , namely , seed , momentum , learning rate , hidden layer attribute and class .
fourteen important PF contributing parameter were weighted on the basis of historical flood event .
the predicted PF-prone area were validated by comparing the prediction with the data from meteorological station and observed inventory event .
in addition , the current location of ERCs were utilised in the location allocation model to assess the ideal time for providing essential service to element at risk .
minimum impedance and maximum coverage location problem model were implemented to assess the current allocated location of ERCs and multiple scenario .
the coverage of existing ERCs was calculated , and their suitable and optimal location were projected for vulnerable inhabitant with either redundant or late emergency response .
result showed that area near downtown have high PF probability but are not covered by ERCs within the standard 5 km radius .
the proposed model can conserve time , reduce cost and save human live by ensuring that vulnerable people in the Damansara River basin are covered by the nearest ERC .
smart mobile crowdsensing with urban vehicle : A deep reinforcement learning perspective .
mobile crowdsensing ( MCS ) is a promising sensing paradigm based on the mobile node which provides the solution with cost-effectiveness to perform urban data collection .
to monitor the urban environment and facilitate the municipal administration , more and more application adopt vehicle as participant to carry out MCS task .
the performance of the application highly depends on the sensing data which is influenced by the recruiting strategy on vehicle .
in this paper , we propose a novel vehicle selection algorithm to maximize the sensing range with limited cost while the vehicle selection problem was proved to be NP-complete .

specifically , we modeled the interaction between MCS server and candidate vehicle as a Markov decision process and formulated the maximum spatial temporal coverage ( STC ) optimization as a deep reinforcement learning process .
the performance of our deep reinforcement learning-based vehicle selection ( i.e.
, DRLVS ) algorithm is evaluated with real trajectory dataset .
the numerical result indicates that the proposed algorithm achieves an optimal solution and maximizes the STC .
using abstraction to solve opportunistic crime security game at scale .
in this paper , we aim to deter urban crime by recommending optimal police patrol strategy against opportunistic criminal in large scale urban problem .
while previous work has tried to learn criminal ' behavior from real world data and generate patrol strategy against opportunistic crime , it can not scale up to large-scale urban problem .
our first contribution is a game abstraction framework that can handle opportunistic crime in large-scale urban area .
in this game abstraction framework , we model the interaction between Officer and opportunistic criminal as a game with discrete target .
by merging similar target , we obtain an abstract game with fewer total target .
we use real world data to learn and plan against opportunistic criminal in this abstract game , and then propagate the result of this abstract game back to the original game .
our second contribution is the layer-generating algorithm used to merge target as described in the framework above .
this algorithm applies a mixed integer linear program ( MILP ) to merge similar and geographically neighboring target in the large scale problem .
as our third contribution , we propose a planning algorithm that recommends a mixed strategy against opportunistic criminal .
finally , our fourth contribution is a heuristic propagation model to handle the problem of limited data we occasionally encounter in large-scale problem .
as part of our collaboration with local police department , we apply our model in two large scale urban problem : a university campus and a city .
our approach provides high prediction accuracy in the real dataset ; furthermore , we project significant crime rate reduction using our planning strategy compared to current police strategy .
the conceptual basis of water-energy-food nexus governance : systematic literature review using network and discourse analysis .
in the last decade , the debate on the governance of water , energy , and food ( WEF ) has intensified , spurring the emergence of the term “ nexus governance.
” In general , the reduction of trade-off and construction of synergy between WEF have been placed on the scientific , political , and economic agenda .
however , although increasingly used , it is difficult to find a clear meaning and definition of what the term represents .

based on a systematic literature review ( SLR ) , using text-mining and machine learning algorithms , this article investigates what are the conceptual basis of the nexus governance debate , and attempt to clarify the main theme , network , and gap within this literature .
the analysis is based on quantitative and qualitative method , combining social network analysis ( SNA ) and discourse analysis ( DA ) .

the result highlighted that twenty-four governance-related concept support this literature , breaking down into eight group : water and basin governance ; environmental and system governance ; risk and resource security governance ; economic governance ; global governance ; urban governance ; integrative and cooperative governance ; and “ epistemic ” and transdisciplinary governance .
published by Informa UK Limited , trading as Taylor & Francis Group .
comparison of random forest model and frequency ratio model for landslide susceptibility mapping ( LSM ) in Yunyang county ( Chongqing , China ) .

to compare the random forest ( RF ) model and the frequency ratio ( FR ) model for landslide susceptibility mapping ( LSM ) , this research selected Yunyang Country as the study area for its frequent natural disaster ; especially landslides .
a landslide inventory was built by historical record ; satellite image ; and extensive field survey .
subsequently ; a geospatial database was established based on 987 historical landslide in the study area .
then ; all the landslide were randomly divided into two dataset : 70 % of them were used as the training dataset and 30 % as the test dataset .
furthermore ; under five primary conditioning factor ( i.e.

, topography factor ; geological factor ; environmental factor ; human engineering activity ; and triggering factor ) , 22 secondary conditioning factor were selected to form an evaluation factor library for analyzing the landslide susceptibility .

on this basis ; the RF model training and the FR model mathematical analysis were performed ; and the established model were used for the landslide susceptibility simulation in the entire area of Yunyang County .
next ; based on the analysis result ; the susceptibility map were divided into five class : very low ; low ; medium ; high ; and very high .
in addition ; the importance of conditioning factor was ranked and the influence of landslide was explored by using the RF model .

the area under the curve ( AUC ) value of receiver operating characteristic ( ROC ) curve ; precision ; accuracy ; and recall ratio were used to analyze the predictive ability of the above two LSM model .
the result indicated a difference in the performance between the two model .
the RF model ( AUC = 0.988 ) performed better than the FR model ( AUC = 0.716 ) .

moreover ; compared with the FR model ; the RF model showed a higher coincidence degree between the area in the high and the very low susceptibility class ; on the one hand ; and the geographical spatial distribution of historical landslide ; on the other hand .

therefore ; it was concluded that the RF model was more suitable for landslide susceptibility evaluation in Yunyang County ; because of its significant model performance ; reliability ; and stability .
the outcome also provided a theoretical basis for application of machine learning technique ( e.g.

, RF ) in landslide prevention ; mitigation ; and urban planning ; so as to deliver an adequate response to the increasing demand for effective and low-cost tool in landslide susceptibility assessment .
a deep learning architecture for semantic address matching .
address matching is a crucial step in geocoding , which plays an important role in urban planning and management .
to date , the unprecedented development of location-based service has generated a large amount of unstructured address data .
traditional address matching method mainly focus on the literal similarity of address record and are therefore not applicable to the unstructured address data .
in this study , we introduce an address matching method based on deep learning to identify the semantic similarity between address record .
first , we train the word2vec model to transform the address record into their corresponding vector representation .
next , we apply the enhanced sequential inference model ( ESIM ) , a deep text-matching model , to make local and global inference to determine if two address match .

to evaluate the accuracy of the proposed method , we fine-tune the model with real-world address data from the Shenzhen Address Database and compare the output with those of several popular address matching method .
the result indicate that the proposed method achieves a higher matching accuracy for unstructured address record , with its precision , recall , and F1 score ( i.e.
, the harmonic mean of precision and recall ) reaching 0.97 on the test set .
multivariate relationship between campus design parameter and energy performance using reinforcement learning and parametric modeling .
for the past two decade , extensive research has been conducted to evaluate the performance of urban form scenario such as sky view factor , solar radiation , or energy performance .
the relationship between urban design parameter and multiple performance should be stipulated to evaluate scenario for supporting timely and reliable design decision .

however , there are three major challenge : ( 1 ) only a few design alternative are devised , ( 2 ) the multiple performance has not been provided synthetically , and ( 3 ) the relationship between design parameter and performance are difficult to be determined because they are multivariate relationship .

this research proposes a new methodology applying a generative design approach using a reinforcement learning algorithm , a parametric performance modeling , and a multivariate adaptive regression spline approach to identify relationship between design parameter and urban performance .
this research aims to support decision-making of urban design to achieve an energy efficient and visually qualified urban environment .

a data-driven urban design approach is proposed to generate possible design alternative using reinforcement learning , and a design-driven analysis is conducted to evaluate multiple performance of urban building using parametric modeling .
the multivariate analysis presented relationship between urban geometric form and performance criterion by using 30 sample .
the finding show that to maintain optimal solar potential , the building coverage ratio is recommended to be bigger than 0.17 .
to maintain the optimal energy balance , the threshold for sky view factor is recommended as 54.17 % .
these relationship contribute to deriving design strategy and guideline for designing a sustainable campus .
generative design and performance modeling for relationship between urban built form , sky opening , solar radiation and energy .
for the past two decade , extensive research has been conducted to evaluate the performance of urban form scenario such as sky view factor , solar radiation , or energy performance .
simulation-based performance analysis has been applied for optimizing urban design using multiple performance criterion of energy demand , daylighting , or radiance .

two major limitation exist in the performance evaluation method of urban design : 1 ) the number of urban design alternative or scenario has been limited , and 2 ) various performance criterion and metric have not been assessed synthetically .
in this respect , we aim to generate all possible alternative under constraint such as a city policy or development requirement .
this paper addresses the integration of generative design and multi-criteria performance analysis for urban design decision making .
the relationship between geometric urban form and multiple performance criterion are identified .

the proposed methodology incorporates the reinforcement learning algorithm , an advanced machine learning technique , along with parametric modeling technique , to enhance urban design decision based on various performance criterion .
this methodology was tested on the design of an international campus of the Georgia Institute of Technology , located in Shenzhen , China .
an algorithm generates numerous geometrical alternative of campus design under site constraint and development requirement of the campus .
those alternative are then evaluated based on performance criterion of sky opening , solar radiation , or energy consumption synthetically .
the method enables an integrated performance analysis for all possible design under constraint .
the paper proposes a data driven urban design approach that connect generative design and multi-criteria performance analysis .
the relationship between urban geometric form and performance criterion function derive guideline for a sustainable and green campus .
in future conduct multivariate analysis to examine the relationship between geometric element and performance measurement metric .
