ultra-light aircraft-based hyperspectral and colour-infrared imaging to identify deciduous tree specie in an urban environment .
one may consider the application of remote sensing as a trade-off between the imaging platform , sensor , and data gathering and processing technique .

this study addresses the potential of hyperspectral imaging using ultra-light aircraft for vegetation specie mapping in an urban environment , exploring both the engineering and scientific aspect related to imaging platform design and image classification method .

an imaging system based on simultaneous use of Rikola frame format hyperspectral and Nikon D800E adopted colour infrared camera installed onboard a Bekas X32 manned ultra-light aircraft is introduced .
two test imaging flight mission were conducted in July of 2015 and September of 2016 over a 4000 ha area in Kaunas City , Lithuania .
sixteen and 64 spectral band in 2015 and 2016 , respectively , in a spectral range of 500-900 nm were recorded with colour infrared image .

three research question were explored assessing the identification of six deciduous tree specie : ( 1 ) Pre-treatment of spectral feature for classification , ( 2 ) testing five conventional machine learning classifier , and ( 3 ) fusion of hyperspectral and colour infrared image .
classification performance was assessed by applying leave-one-out cross-validation at the individual crown level and using as a reference at least 100 field inventoried tree for each specie .
the best-performing classification algorithm-multilayer perceptron , using all spectral property extracted from the hyperspectral images-resulted in a moderate classification accuracy .
the overall classification accuracy was 63 % , Cohen 's Kappa was 0.54 , and the species-specific classification accuracy were in the range of 51-72 % .

hyperspectral image resulted in significantly better tree specie classification ability than the colour infrared image and simultaneous use of spectral property extracted from hyperspectral and colour infrared image improved slightly the accuracy over the 2015 image .
even though classification using hyperspectral data cube of 64 band resulted in relatively larger accuracy than with 16 band , classification error matrice were not statistically different .

alternative imaging platform ( like an unmanned aerial vehicle and a Cessna 172 aircraft ) and setting of the Flight were discussed using simulated imaging project assuming the same study area and field of application .

ultra-light aircraft-based hyperspectral and colour-infrared imaging was considered to be a technically and economically sound solution for urban green space inventory to facilitate tree mapping , characterization , and monitoring .
urban pluvial flooding prediction by machine learning approach – a case study of Shenzhen city , China .
urban pluvial flooding is a threatening natural hazard in urban area all over the world , especially in recent year given its increasing frequency of occurrence .

in order to prevent flood occurrence and mitigate the subsequent aftermath , urban water manager aim to predict precipitation characteristic , including peak intensity , arrival time and duration , so that they can further warn inhabitant in risky area and take emergency action when forecasting a pluvial flood .
previous study that dealt with the prediction of urban pluvial flooding are mainly based on hydrological or hydraulic model , requiring a large volume of data for simulation accuracy .
these method are computationally expensive .
using a rainfall threshold to predict flooding based on a data-driven approach can decrease the computational complexity to a great extent .

in order to prepare city for frequent pluvial flood event – especially in the future climate – this paper uses a rainfall threshold for classifying flood vs. non-flood event , based on machine learning ( ML ) approaches , applied to a case study of Shenzhen city in China .
in doing so , ML model can determine several rainfall threshold line projected in a plane spanned by two principal component , which provides a binary result ( flood or no flood ) .

compared to the conventional critical rainfall curve , the proposed model , especially the subspace discriminant analysis , can classify flooding and non-flooding by different combination of multiple-resolution rainfall intensity , greatly raising the accuracy to 96.5 % and lowering the false alert rate to 25 % .
compared to the conventional model , the critical indice of accuracy and true positive rate ( TPR ) were 5 % -15 % higher in ML model .
such model are applicable to other urban catchment as well .
the result are expected to be used to assist early warning system and provide rational information for contingency and emergency planning .
urban Data Mining using emergent SOM .
the term of Urban Data-Mining is defined to describe a methodological approach that discovers logical or mathematical and partly complex description of urban pattern and regularity inside the data .
the concept of data mining in connection with knowledge discovery technique plays an important role for the empirical examination of high dimensional data in the field of urban research .
the procedure on the basis of knowledge discovery system are currently not exactly scrutinised for a meaningful integration into the regional and urban planning and development process .
in this study ESOM is used to examine community in Germany .
the data deal with the question of dynamic process ( e.g .
shrinking and growing of city ) .
in the future it might be possible to establish an instrument that defines objective criterion for the benchmark process about urban phenomenon .
the use of GIS supplements the process of knowledge conversion and communication .
rainfall-induced shallow landslide detachment , transit and runout susceptibility mapping by integrating machine learning technique and gis-based approach .
rainfall-induced shallow landslide represent a serious threat in hilly and mountain area around the world .

the mountainous landscape of the Cinque Terre ( eastern Liguria , Italy ) is increasingly popular for both Italian and foreign tourist , most of which visit this outstanding terraced coastal landscape to enjoy a beach holiday and to practice hiking .
however , this area is characterized by a high level of landslide hazard due to intense rainfall that periodically affect its rugged and steep territory .
one of the most severe event occurred on 25 October 2011 , causing several fatality and damage for million of euros .
to adequately address the issue related to shallow landslide risk , it is essential to develop landslide susceptibility model as reliable as possible .
regrettably , most of the current land-use and urban planning approach only consider the susceptibility to landslide detachment , neglecting transit and runout process .
in this study , the adoption of a combined approach allowed to estimate shallow landslide susceptibility to both detachment and potential runout .
at first , landslide triggering susceptibility was assessed using Machine Learning technique and applying the Ensemble approach .
nine predisposing factor were chosen , while a database of about 300 rainfall-induced shallow landslide was used as input .
then , a Geographical Information System ( GIS ) -based procedure was applied to estimate the potential landslide runout using the “ reach angle ” method .
information from such analysis was combined to obtain a susceptibility map describing detachment , transit , and runout .

the obtained susceptibility map will be helpful for land planning , as well as for decision maker and stakeholder , to predict area where rainfall-induced shallow landslide are likely to occur in the future and to identify area where hazard mitigation measure are needed .
comparison of approach for urban functional zone classification based on multi-source geospatial data : A case study in Yuzhong District , Chongqing , China .

accurate and timely classification and monitoring of urban functional zone prove to be significant in rapidly developing city , to better understand the real and varying urban function of city to support urban planning and management .
many effort have been undertaken to identify urban functional zone using various classification approach and multi-source geospatial dataset .

the complexity of this category of classification pose tremendous challenge to these study especially in term of classification accuracy , but on the opposite , the rapid development of machine learning technology provides us with new opportunity .

in this study , a set of commonly used urban functional zone classification approach , including Multinomial Logistic Regression , K-Nearest Neighbors , Decision Tree , Support Vector Machine ( SVM ) , and Random Forest , are examined and compared with the newly developed eXtreme Gradient Boosting ( XGBoost ) model , using the case study of Yuzhong District , Chongqing , China .
the investigation is based on multi-variate geospatial data , including night-time imagery , geotagged Weibo data , point of interest ( POI ) from Gaode , and Baidu Heat Map .
this study is the first endeavor of implementing the XGBoost model in the field of urban functional zone classification .
the result suggest that the XGBoost classification model performed the best and was able to achieve an accuracy of 88.05 % , which is significantly higher than the other commonly used approach .

in addition , the integration of night-time imagery , geotagged Weibo data , POI from Gaode , and Baidu Heat Map has also demonstrated their value for the classification of urban functional zone in this case study .
deep highway unit network for land cover type classification with GF-3 SAR imagery .

the fully polarized synthetic aperture radar ( SAR ) is an advanced earth observation system with day and night imaging capability , which can obtain rich information of terrain and has a wide range of application in environmental protection , urban planning and resource investigation .
as the first selfdeveloped C-band multi-polarized SAR image , the acquisition of massive data and operational operation of Chinese SAR remote sensing has entered the era of big data .
under the era of remote sensing large data , however , SAR image interpretation is a great challenge for scientific application .
at present , big data-based intelligent method such as computer vision technology have achieved great success .
deep learning such as deep highway unit network has revolutionized the computer vision area .

however , due to the characteristic of SAR microwave band imaging and phase coherence processing , SAR image are very different from ordinary optical image in term of band , projection direction , data composition and so on .
therefore , deep learning can not be directly used for quad-pol SAR image classification .
in this paper , deep learning is applied to land cover type classification with GF-3 quad-pol SAR imagery .
a deep highway unit network is employed to automatically extract a hierarchic feature representation from the data , based on which the land cover type classification can be conducted .

our classification model is trained on limited training data from forest resource inventory and planning data , and tested on a Radarsat-2 quad-pol image , which is the image of the same area acquired at different time .
we also employ the machine learning such as SVM , Random Forest on the same sample for comparison .
the deep highway unit network trained by the GF-3 image , which can reduce speckle , fully excavate the regularity of SAR image in time and space .
a machine learning-based classification system for urban built-up area using multiple classifier and data source .
information about urban built-up area is important for urban planning and management .
however , obtaining accurate information about urban built-up area is a challenge .
this study developed a general-purpose built-up area intelligent classification ( BAIC ) system that supports various type of data and classifier .
all of the step in the BAIC were implemented using Python module including Numpy , Pandas , matplotlib , and scikit-learn .

we used the BAIC to conduct a classification experiment that involved seven type of input data ; namely , Point of Interest ( POI ) , Road Network ( RN ) , nighttime light ( NTL ) , a combination of POI and RN data ( POI_RN ) , a combination of POI and NTL data ( POI_NTL ) , a combination of RN and NTL data ( RN_NTL ) , and a combination of POI , RN , and NTL data ( POI_RN_NTL ) , and five classifier , namely , Logistic Regression ( LR ) , Decision Tree ( DT ) , Random Forests ( RF ) , Gradient Boosted Decision Trees ( GBDT ) , and AdaBoost .

the result show the following : ( 1 ) among the 35 combination of the five classifier and seven type of input data , the overall accuracy ( OA ) ranged from 76 to 89 % , F1 value ranged from 0.73 to 0.86 , and the area under the receiver operating characteristic ( ROC ) curve ( AUC ) ranged from 0.83 to 0.95 .

the largest F1 value and OA were obtained using the POI_RN_NTL data and AdaBoost , while the largest AUC was obtained using POI_RN_NTL and POI_NTL data against AdaBoost , LR , and RF ; and ( 2 ) the advantage of the BAIC include its support for multi-source input data , its objective accuracy assessment , and its robust classifier .

the BAIC can quickly and efficiently realize the automatic classification of urban built-up area at a reasonably low cost and can be readily applied to other urban area in the world where any kind of POI , RN , or NTL data coverage is available .

the result of this study are expected to provide timely and effective reference information for urban planning and urban management department , and could also potentially be used to develop large-scale map of urban built-up area in the future .
building Energy Information : Demand and Consumption Prediction with Machine Learning Models for Sustainable and Smart Cities .
building energy consumption plays an essential role in urban sustainability .
the prediction of the energy demand is also of particular importance for developing smart city and urban planning .
machine learning has recently contributed to the advancement of method and technology to predict demand and consumption for building energy system .
this paper presents a state of the art of machine learning model and evaluates the performance of these model .
through a systematic review and a comprehensive taxonomy , the advance of machine learning are carefully investigated and promising model are introduced .
visual gaze analysis of robotic pedestrian moving in urban space .

this study is founded on the idea that an analysis of the visual gaze dynamic of pedestrian can increase our understanding of how important architectural feature in urban environment are perceived by pedestrian .
the result of such an analysis can lead to improvement in urban design .
however , a technical challenge arise when trying to determine the gaze direction of pedestrian recorded on video .
high noise level and the subtlety of human gaze dynamic hamper precise calculation .

however , as robot can be programmed and analysed more efficiently than human , this study uses them for developing and training a gaze analysis system with the aim to later apply it to human video data using the machine learning technique of manifold alignment .
for this study , a laboratory was set up to become a model street scene in which autonomous humanoid robot of approximately 55cm in height simulate the behaviour of human pedestrian .
the experiment compare the input from several camera as the robot walks down the model street and changes its behaviour upon encountering visually attractive object .
overhead recording and the robot 's internal joint signal are analysed after filtering to provide true data against which the recorded data can be compared for accuracy testing .

a central component of the research is the calculation of a torus-like manifold that represents all the different three-dimensional ( 3D ) head direction of a robot head and allows the ordering of extracted 3D gaze vector obtained from video sequence .
we briefly describe how the obtained multidimensional trajectory data can be analysed by using a temporal behaviour analysis technique based on support vector machine that was developed separately .
the cooperative conceptualization of urban space in ai-assisted environmental planning .
the literature on spatial environment concern many discipline , and the present study aim at broadly contributing from an urban-planning view .
indoor and outdoor townscape , because of their dynamic complexity , seem to offer ill-structured holds to the typical spatial behaviour of an agent .
therefore , a question arises about the 'fundamental ' of spacescape from the point of view of the need of living and moving agent .
following this thread , the paper deal with the diagnosis and the control of a structured simple space , a minimum arc of a graph .

condition , situation , element , behaviour are explored in their spatial-temporal dimension , subsequently aiming at setting up a system architecture to let spatial agent control their de-structuring impact .

text analysis and interpretation are applied to a questionnaire survey , exploring low level ( movement orientation ) and high level ( memory and fantasy ) behaviours in human interaction with a space .
the experiment is developed in a large class of student from the Technical University of Bari , daily using a long and apparently amorphous corridor to reach Professor ' office for explanation .
comparing machine learning classification scheme - A GIS approach .
this project examines the effectiveness of two classification schema : Support Vector Machines ( SVM ) , and Artificial Neural Networks ( NN ) when applied to geographic ( i.e .
spatial ) data .
the context for this study is to examine pattern of urbanization in Mahoning County , OH in relation to several independent driving variable of urban development .
these independent variable were constructed using Geographic Information Systems ( CIS ) and were compared to the dependent variable of the spatial location of urban area in Mahoning County .
the classification technique were used in conjunction with the GIS-created variable to predict the location of urban area within Mahoning County .
a comparison of the accuracy of the technique is presented and conclusion drawn concerning which of the variable are the most influential on urban pattern in the region .
lastly , a spatial analysis of the prediction error is performed for each method .
disentangling the comparative role of multilevel built environment on body mass index : Evidence from China .
one common goal of urban planning is to promote health , where the built environment ( BE ) is believed to play an essential role .
this study provides new evidence for the link between body mass index ( BMI ) and the BE at different geographic scale in a unified framework .

based on a sample of 10,962 individual across 95 city in China , this study explores the collective effect of the BE attributes at neighborhood and city level on BMI using a gradient boosting decision tree ( GBDT ) approach .
moreover , whether the relationship between the city-level BE attribute and BMI vary across social group is revealed .
the result indicate that the city-level BE attribute have larger collective effect on BMI than the neighborhood-level BE attributes .
specifically , population size is the greatest contributor to predicting BMI , with a relative importance of 13.92 % among all influential factor .
moreover , it is found that the effect of city-level BE attributes vary across different social group .

these finding suggest it is of vital importance for urban planner to coordinate both neighborhood- and city-level BE planning to deter the risk of obesity , and urban planning can be more effective if it is implemented considering local socio-demographic characteristic .
gis-based emotional computing : A review of quantitative approach to measure the emotion layer of human–environment relationship .

in recent year , with the growing accessibility of abundant contextual emotion information , which is benefited by the numerous georeferenced user-generated content and the maturity of artificial intelligence ( AI ) -based emotional computing technic , the emotion layer of human–environment relationship is proposed for enriching traditional method of various related discipline such as urban planning .
this paper proposes the geographic information system ( GIS ) -based emotional computing concept , which is a novel framework for applying GIS method to collective human emotion .

the methodology presented in this paper consists of three key step : ( 1 ) collecting georeferenced data containing emotion and environment information such as social media and official site , ( 2 ) detecting emotion using AI-based emotional computing technic such as natural language processing ( NLP ) and computer vision ( CV ) , and ( 3 ) visualizing and analyzing the spatiotemporal pattern with GIS tool .
this methodology is a great synergy of multidisciplinary cutting-edge technique , such as GIScience , sociology , and computer science .
moreover , it can effectively and deeply explore the connection between people and their surrounding with the help of GIS method .

generally , the framework provides a standard workflow to calculate and analyze the new information layer for researcher , in which a measured human-centric perspective onto the environment is possible .
high-resolution spatiotemporal measurement of air and environmental noise pollution in Sub-Saharan African city : Pathway to Equitable Health Cities Study protocol for Accra , Ghana .
introduction Air and noise pollution are emerging environmental health hazard in African city , with potentially complex spatial and temporal pattern .
limited local data are a barrier to the formulation and evaluation of policy to reduce air and noise pollution .

method and analysis We designed a year-long measurement campaign to characterise air and noise pollution and their source at high-resolution within the Greater Accra Metropolitan Area ( GAMA ) , Ghana .

our design uses a combination of fixed ( year-long , n=10 ) and rotating ( week-long , n =∼130 ) sites , selected to represent a range of land use and source influence ( eg , background , road traffic , commercial , industrial and residential area , and various neighbourhood socioeconomic class ) .
we will collect data on fine particulate matter ( PM 2.5 ) , nitrogen oxide ( NO x ) , weather variable , sound ( noise level and audio ) along with street-level time-lapse image .
we deploy low-cost , low-power , lightweight monitoring device that are robust , socially unobtrusive , and able to function in Sub-Saharan African ( SSA ) climate .

we will use state-of-the-art method , including spatial statistic , deep/machine learning , and processed-based emission modelling , to capture highly resolved temporal and spatial variation in pollution level across the GAMA and to identify their potential source .
this protocol can serve as a prototype for other SSA city .

ethic and dissemination This environmental study was deemed exempt from full ethic review at Imperial College London and the University of Massachusetts Amherst ; it was approved by the University of Ghana Ethics Committee ( ECH 149/18-19 ) .
this protocol is designed to be implementable in SSA city to map environmental pollution to inform urban planning decision to reduce health harming exposure to air and noise pollution .
it will be disseminated through local stakeholder engagement ( public and private sector ) , peer-reviewed publication , contribution to policy document , media , and conference presentation .
automatic identification of the social function of area of interest ( AOIS ) using the standard hour-day-spectrum approach .

the social function of area of interest ( AOIs ) is crucial to the identification of urban functional zoning and land use classification , which has been a hot topic in various Field such as urban planning and smart city Field .

most existing study on urban functional zoning and land use classification either largely rely on low-frequency remote sensing image , which are constrained to the block level due to their spatial scale limitation , or suffer from low accuracy and high uncertainty when using dynamic data , such as social media and traffic data .

this paper proposes an hour-day-spectrum ( HDS ) approach for generating six type of distribution waveform of taxi pick-up and drop-off point which serve as interpretation indicator of the social function of AOIs .
to achieve this goal , we first performed fine-grained cleaning of the drop-off point to eliminate the spatial error caused by taxi driver .
next , buffer and spatial clustering were integrated to explore the association between travel behavior and AOIs .
third , the identification of AOI type was made by using the standard HDS method combined with the k-nearest neighbor ( KNN ) algorithm .
finally , some matching test were carried out by similarity indexe of a standard HDS and sample HDS , i.e.
, the Gaussian kernel function and Pearson coefficient , to ensure matching accuracy .
the experiment was conducted in the Chongchuan and Gangzha Districts , Nantong , Jiangsu Province , China .
by training 50 AOI sample , six type of standard HDS of residential district , school , hospital , and shopping mall were obtained .
then , 108 AOI sample were tested , and the overall accuracy was found to be 90.74 % .
this approach generates value-added service of the taxi trajectory and provides a continuous update and fine-grained supplementary method for the identification of land use type .
in addition , the approach is object-oriented and based on AOIs , and can be combined with image interpretation and other method to improve the identification effect .
comparison of Regression Tools for Regional Electric Load Forecasting .
urban area electrical load forecasting is important for power generation capacity planning and also to integrate environment friendly energy source at district level .
load prediction will help in developing demand side management in coordination with renewable power generation .
urban area load is influenced by meteorological condition therefore it is important to include weather parameter for load prediction .
machine Learning algorithm can effectively contribute for electrical load prediction .
the most commonly used algorithm for load prediction is Artificial Neural Network ( ANN ) , which is a complex predictor that utilizes a big amount of training data .

k-nearest Neighbour ( kNN ) has proven to be efficient by the introduction of binary dummy variable for categorisation and it can be used for short term ( 30 min ) and long term ( 24 hour ) load forecasting .
this paper explores the use of regression tool for regional electric load forecasting by correlating lower distinctive categorical level ( season and day of the week ) and weather parameter .
the historical electrical load dataset with meteorological parameter are available for the Sydney region and they have been used to test the regression tool .
data correlation over seasonal change have been argued by mean of improving Mean Absolute Percentage Error ( MAPE ) .
by examining the structure of various regressor they are compared for the lowest MAPE .
the regressor show good MAPE for short term ( 30 min ) prediction and Random Forest Regressor scores best in the range of 1-2 % MAPE .
classification of urban scene from georeferenced image in urban street-view context .
this paper addresses the challenging problem of scene classification in street-view georeferenced image of urban environment .
more precisely , the goal of this task is semantic image classification , consisting in predicting in a given image , the presence or absence of a pre-defined class ( e.g .
shop , vegetation , etc . )

the approach is based on the BOSSA representation , which enriches the Bag of Words ( BoW ) model , in conjunction with the Spatial Pyramid Matching scheme and kernel-based machine learning technique .

the proposed method handles problem that arise in large scale urban environment due to acquisition condition ( static and dynamic objects/pedestrian ) combined with the continuous acquisition of data along the vehicle direction , the varying light condition and strong occlusion ( due to the presence of tree , traffic sign , car , etc . )
giving rise to high intra-class variability .
experiment were conducted on a large dataset of high resolution image collected from two main Avenue from the 12th district in Paris and the approach shows promising result .
effective task scheduling algorithm with deep learning for Internet of Health Things ( IoHT ) in sustainable smart city .
in the recent year , important key factor for urban planning is to analyze the sustainability and its functionality towards smart city .

presently , many researcher employ the conservative machine learning based analysis but those are not appropriate for IoT based health data analysis because of their physical feature extraction and low accuracy .
in this paper , we propose remote health monitoring and data analysis by integrating IoT and deep learning concept .

we proposed novel IoT based FoG assisted cloud network architecture that accumulates real-time health care data from patient via several medical IoT sensor network , these data are analyzed using a deep learning algorithm deployed at Fog based Healthcare Platform .
furthermore , the proposed methodology is applied to the sustainable smart city to evaluate the process for real-time .
the proposed framework not only analyses the healthcare data but also provides immediate relief measure to the patient facing critical condition and need immediate consultancy of doctor .
performance is measure in term of accuracy , precision and sensitivity of the proposed DHNN with task scheduling algorithm and it is obtained 97.6 % , 97.9 % , and 94.9 % .
while accuracy , precision and sensitivity for deep CNN is 96.5 % , 97.5 % and 94 % and for Deep auto-encoder is 92 % , 91 % , and 82.5 % .
urban Water Demand Modeling Using Machine Learning Technique : Case Study of Fortaleza , Brazil .

despite recent effort to apply machine learning ( ML ) for water demand modeling , overcoming the black-box nature of these technique to extract practical information remains a challenge , especially in developing countrie .

this study integrated random forest ( RF ) , self-organizing map ( SOM ) , and artificial neural network ( ANN ) techniques to assess water demand pattern and to develop a predictive model for the city of Fortaleza , Brazil .
we performed the analysis at two spatial scale , with different level of information : census tract ( CTs ) at the fine scale , and census block ( CBs ) at the coarse scale .
at the CB scale , demand was modeled with socioeconomic , demographic , and household characteristic .
the RF technique was applied to rank these variable , and the most relevant were used to cluster census block with SOMs .
rfs and ANNs were used in an iterative approach to define the input variable for the predictive model with minimum redundancy .
at the CT scale , demand was modeled using HDI and per capita income .
variable which assess the education level and economic aspect of household demonstrated a direct relationship with water demand .
the analysis at the coarse scale provided more insight into the relationship between the variable ; however , the predictive model performed better at the fine scale .

this study demonstrates how data-driven model can be helpful for water management , especially in environment with strong socioeconomic inequality , where urban planning decision should be integrated and inclusive .
estimating quality of life dimension from urban spatial pattern metric .
the spatial structure of urban area plays a major role in the daily life of dweller .
the current policy framework to ensure the quality of life of inhabitant leaving no one behind , leads decision-maker to seek better-informed choice for the sustainable planning of urban area .
thus , a better understanding between the spatial structure of city and their socio-economic level is of crucial relevance .
accordingly , the purpose of this paper is to quantify this two-way relationship .
therefore , we measured spatial pattern of 31 city in North Rhine-Westphalia , Germany .
we rely on spatial pattern metric derived from a Local Climate Zone classification obtained by fusing remote sensing and open GIS data with a machine learning approach .

based upon the data , we quantified the relationship between spatial pattern metric and socio-economic variable related to ‘ education ’ , ‘ health ’ , ‘ living condition ’ , ‘ labor ’ , and ‘ transport ’ by mean of multiple linear regression model , explaining the variability of the socio-economic variable from 43 % up to 82 % .

additionally , we grouped city according to their level of ‘ quality of life ’ using the socio-economic variable , and found that the spatial pattern of low-dense built-up type was different among socio-economic group .
the proposed methodology described in this paper is transferable to other dataset , level , and region .
this is of great potential , due to the growing availability of open statistical and satellite data and derived product .
moreover , we discuss the limitation and needed consideration when conducting such study .
deep neural network analysis of water quality time series associated with water sensitive urban design ( WSUD ) feature .

the ability of Long short-term memory ( LSTM ) , Gated recurrent unit ( GRU ) , Adaptive-network-based fuzzy inference system ( ANFIS ) , Artificial neural network ( ANN ) , and Group method of data handling ( GMDH ) in predicting water quality time series associated with a cleansing biotope were evaluated .
we examined continuous monitoring time series of chlorophyll-a , turbidity , and specific conductivity using YSI EXO datasondes at the Inlet and Outlet .

based on Root Mean Square Errors , Mean Absolute Percentage Errors , Mean Absolute Errors , Correlation Coefficients , and Theil ’ s U , the GRU generally was the most efficient model in predicting the Outlet water quality .
ai model should find increasing implementation the area of ‘ smart environment ’ .

way forward for enhancing AI model performance were suggested to better consider data periodicity and explore a transfer function approach in which the water quality timeserie of one parameter is forecast based on an ensemble of other parameter .
machine learning-based and 3d kinematic model for rockfall hazard assessment using LiDAR Data and GIS .
rockfall is one of the most hazardous phenomenon in mountainous and hilly region with high and steep terrain .
such incident can cause massive damage to people , property , and infrastructure .
therefore , proper rockfall hazard assessment method are required to save live and provide a guide for the development of an area .
the aim of this research is to develop a method for rockfall hazard assessment at two different scale ( regional and local ) .

a high-resolution airborne laser scanning ( ALS ) technique was utilized to derive an accurate digital terrain model ( DTM ) ; next , a terrestrial laser scanner ( TLS ) was used to capture the topography of the two most critical area within the study area .

a staking machine-learning model based on different classifier , namely logistic regression ( LR ) , random forest ( RF ) , artificial neural network ( ANN ) , support vector machine ( SVM ) , and k-nearest neighbor ( KNN ) , was optimized and employed to determine rockfall probability by utilizing various rockfall conditioning factor .
a developed 3D rockfall kinematic model was used to obtain rockfall trajectory , velocity , frequency , bouncing height , kinetic energy , and impact location .

next , a spatial model combined with a fuzzy analytical hierarchy process ( fuzzy-AHP ) integrated in the Geographic Information System ( GIS ) was developed to assess rockfall hazard in two different area in Ipoh , Malaysia .
additionally , mitigation process were suggested and assessed to provide a comprehensive information for urban planning management .

the result show that , the stacking random forest-k-nearest neighbor ( RF-KNN ) model is the best hybrid model compared to other tested model with an accuracy of 89 % , 86 % , and 87 % based on training , validation , and cross-validation dataset , respectively .
the three-dimension rockfall kinematic model was calibrated with an accuracy of 93 % and 95 % for the two study area and subsequently the rockfall trajectory and their characteristic were derived .
the assessment of the suggested mitigation processes proves that the proposed method can reduce or eliminate rockfall hazard in these area .
according to the result , the proposed method can be generalized and applied in other geographical Place to provide decision-maker with a comprehensive rockfall hazard assessment .
people counting with image retrieval using compressed sensing .
the estimation of the number of people present in an image has many application such as intelligent transportation , urban planning and crowd surveillance .
rather than conventional counting by detection or regression/machine-learning method , we propose an image retrieval approach , which uses an image descriptor to estimate the people count .
we review the performance of several image descriptor .
in addition , we propose a straightforward global image descriptor for image retrieval based on compressed sensing theory .

extensive evaluation on existing crowd analysis benchmark dataset demonstrate the effectiveness of our image retrieval-based approach compared to state-of-the-art regression-based people counting method .
comparison of machine learning technique for the automatic recognition of soundscape .
rather than recognising single environmental sound source , research on soundscape recognition aims at identifying general unstructured auditory scene composed of multiple simultaneous sound source .

nowaday , soundscape recognition has multiple application , such as : i ) contextawareness for mobile robot and portable device , so as to provide information about the surrounding acoustic environment , enabling the automatic reaction of the device without human intervention ; ii ) background noise identification for speech recognition system , so as to improve the robustness of such system by facilitating their adaptability to any indoor or outdoor environment ; iii ) support tool in urban planning and noise annoyance assessment .
in this paper , pattern recognition technique specially designed to automatically recognise soundscape are implemented .
specifically , the study focuses on finding the most appropriated learning paradigm .

a set of machine learning technique , commonly employed in similar sound recognition task , are considered : decision tree , K-Nearest Neighbours algorithm , Gaussian Mixture Models and Neural Networks .
extensive experiment are carried out so as to empirically test and compare the performance attained by the different learning technique .
the experiment are performed employing an audio data corpus composed of 15 different soundscene , such as park , traffic street , restaurant or stadium .
predicting stream water quality under different urban development pattern scenario with an interpretable machine learning approach .
urban development pattern significantly impacts stream water quality by influencing pollutant generation , build-up , and wash-off process .
it is thus necessary to understand and predict stream water quality in accordance with different urban development pattern to effectively advise urban growth planning and policy .
to do so , we collected pollutant concentration data on nitrate ( NO3−-N ) , total phosphate ( TP ) , and Escherichia coli ( E. coli ) from 1047 sampling station in the Texas Gulf Region .
we utilized a Random Forest ( RF ) machine learning model to predict stream water quality under four planning scenario with different urban density and configuration .
shapley Additive exPlanation ( SHAP ) was used to prove the importance of urban development pattern in influencing stream water quality .
the spatial variation of the impact of these pattern were explored with Geographically Weighted Regression ( GWR ) .

shap result indicated that Largest Patch Index ( LPI ) , Patch Cohesion Index ( COHESION ) , Splitting Index ( SPLIT ) , and Landscape Division Index ( DIVISION ) were the most important urban development pattern metric affecting stream water quality .
the spatial variation of such pattern were shown to impact stream water quality depending on pollutant , seasonality , climate , and urbanization level .

rf prediction result suggested that high density aggregated development was more effective in reducing TP and NO3−-N concentration than the current sprawl development , but had the potential risk of increasing E. coli pollution in the wet season .
the result of this study provide empirical evidence and a potential mechanistic explanation that stream water quality degradation is a consequence of urban sprawl .
lastly , machine learning is a powerful tool for scenario prediction in land use planning to forecast environmental impact under different urban development pattern scenario .
systematizing and upscaling urban climate change mitigation .
the question of what city can contribute to mitigation and adapting to climate change is gaining traction among researcher and policy maker alike .
however , while the field is rich with case study , method that provide rich data across municipality and potentially at global scale remain underdeveloped , and comparative insight remain scarce .
here we summarize contribution to the focus issue on 'Systematizing and Upscaling Urban Climate Solutions ' , also drawing from presentation given at an accompanying conference in 2018 .
we highlight four core area for systematizing and upscaling urban climate mitigation solution .
first , with more and better ( big ) data and associated machine learning method , there is increasing potential to compare type of city and leverage collective understanding .

second , while urban climate assessment have mostly emphasized urban planning , demand-side action as related to both behavioral change and modified social practice relevant to urban space deserve more academic attention and integration across a diverse set of social science .

third , climate mitigation would be intangible as a single objective at the urban scale , and measure and solution that coordinate mitigation coherently with adaptation and broader sustainable development goal require explicit conceptualization and systematization .
forth , all insight should come together to develop governance framework that translate scientific exercise into concrete , realistic and organized action plan on the ground , for all city .

identifying the Structure of Citie by Clustering Using a New Similarity Measure Based on Smart Card Data .
identifying the structure of city has long been studied in urban planning and traffic modeling .
this study presents a reliable method that reveals the structure of city mainly based on clustering analysis using a new similarity measure .

several previous study have used well-known clustering algorithms in machine learning Field , such as k-mean clustering based on temporal mobility pattern of region , whereas other study have applied community detection algorithms on network that depict traffic flows .
however , the former does not reflect spatial interaction among Place or area , and the latter group ' Place or area with different land uses into the same cluster .
to address these issue in existing approach , this study proposes a new similarity method that considers not only temporal mobility pattern of area but also spatial interaction with other area .

moreover , the study combines spectral clustering repeated several time with hierarchical clustering to obtain a reliable structure that keeps the contiguity of cluster and determine the hierarchy of different areal unit .
the application of the proposed method to the data for Seoul , South Korea , reveals that the proposed clustering process divides a city into relatively homogeneous area in term of land use .
the flow map based on the clustering result also revealed the spatial interaction between different area and identify the polycentric structure of Seoul .
machine Learning Assisted Urban Filling .
when drawing urban scale plan , designer should always define the position and the shape of each building .
this process usually costs much time in the early design stage when the condition of a city has not been finally determined .
thus the designer spend a lot of time working forward and backward drawing sketch for different characteristic of city .
meanwhile , machine learning , as a decision-making tool , has been widely used in many Field .
generative Adversarial Network ( GAN ) is a model frame in machine learning , specially designed to learn and generate image data .
therefore , this research aims to apply GAN in creating urban design plan , helping designer automatically generate the predicted detail of building configuration with a given condition of city .
through the machine learning of image pair , the result shows the relationship between the site condition ( Road , green land , and river ) and the configuration of building .
this automatic design tool can help release the heavy load of urban designer in the early design stage , quickly providing a preview of design solution for urban design task .
the analysis of different machine learning model trained by the data from different city inspires urban designer with design strategy and feature in distinct condition .
mapping poverty and slum using multiple methodology in Accra , Ghana .

providing housing to slum dweller , protecting them from natural disaster and disease , and connecting them to job and service through improved infrastructure are urgent policy issue in many Sub-Saharan African city .
identifying the location and living condition of slum is a critical step toward designing effective urban policy .

by combining household survey data and census data with high spatial resolution satellite imagery and other geospatial data using multiple methodology , including machine learning , we attempt to define slum quantitatively within the city of Accra .
within these defined slum area , the pattern of monetary poverty are assessed .
poverty rate are estimated at the neighborhood level and indicate that living in slum is strongly correlated with higher monetary poverty .
poverty is more prevalent in community in area of lower elevation , which in Accra are generally flood-prone area .
however , the result also suggest that not all people living in slum are living in monetary poverty .
these result have important policy implication and are crucial to how economic opportunity are generated in slum so that effective urban policy can be designed .
structural health monitoring installation scheme using utility computing model .

in view of intensified disaster and fatality caused by natural phenomenon , there is a pressing need for an efficient environment logging that provides structural information to administrator for a better management and urban planning .
this paper proposes a novel utility model for structural health monitoring that would enable early detection of risk factor and mitigation of loss .
the proposed utility computing model takes the input data in term of 'number of occupant ' in a building ( i.e .
mac , International Mobile Equipment Identifier address and biometric attendance system installed ) and SHM system data ( i.e .
sensor reading ) .

it give visual representation of all the data for utility manager and expert to decide better location of SHM and number of SHM needed per zone depending on high disturbance created due to higher occupancy and number of structure per zone .
denser area with higher structure and higher population will require more precise and accurate SHM system compared to rural area .
it also analyzes the data from SHM system and using simple machine learning algorithm give expert ' suggestion for type of SHM needed at an area .
it make it possible for the data of each and every device of SHM system over several zone to be accessible by specific authority that can be used to predict as well as forecast any natural disaster .
the Structural Health Monitoring utility model is unique in term of its heterogeneity of resource management in realizing the utility processes .
finally , a case study of Qatar University is looked at where node are distributed in zone along with occupant measuring is used over each building .
the data was taken over simulated occupation model and mathematical model from literature for occupation and zone calculation using ideal SHM system data .

it can be inferred from the data that real-time analysis data will act similar to simulated and proposed Utility Computing System will give visual data and analyze the zone as can be seen in the result .

therefore , SHM Utility Computing model is efficient and most effective system that save cost as well as prepare authority for maintenance of a structure or crisis management due to external surrounding .
urban multisensory laboratory , an approach to model urban space human perception .
an urban sensory lab ( USL or LUS an acronym in Spanish ) is a new and avant-garde approach for studying and analyzing a city .
the construction of this approach allows the development of new methodology to identify the emotional response of public space user .
the laboratory combine qualitative analysis proposed by urbanist and quantitative measure managed by data analysis application .
usl is a new approach to go beyond the border of urban knowledge .
the design thinking strategy allows us to implement method to understand the result provided by our technique .
in this first approach , the interpretation is made by hand .
however , our goal is to combine design thinking and machine learning in order to analyze the qualitative and quantitative data automatically .
now , the result are being used by student from the Urbanism and Architecture course in order to get a better understanding of public space in Puebla , Mexico and its interaction with people .

optimization and evaluation of the human fall detection system .
fall are the most critical health problem for elderly people , which are often , cause significant injury .

to tackle a serious risk that made by the fall , we develop an automatic wearable fall detection system utilizing two device ( mobile phone and wireless sensor ) based on three axe accelerometer signal .
the goal of this study is to find an effective machine learning method that distinguish fall from activity of daily living ( ADL ) using only a single triaxial accelerometer .

in addition , comparing the performance result for wearable sensor and mobile device data.The proposed model detects the fall by using seven different classifier and the significant performance is demonstrated using accuracy , recall , precision and F-measure .
our model obtained accuracy over 99 % on wearable device data and over 97 % on mobile phone data .
automated planning for urban traffic control : Strategic vehicle routing to respect air quality limitation .
the global growth in urbanisation increases the demand for service including road transport infrastructure , presenting challenge in term of mobility .
these trend are occurring in the context of concern around environmental issue of poor air quality and transport related carbon dioxide emission .
one out of several way to help meet these challenge is in the intelligent routing of road traffic through congested urban area .
our goal is to show the feasibility of using automated planning to perform this routing , taking into account a knowledge of vehicle type , vehicle emission , route map , air quality zone , etc .

specifically focusing on air quality concern , in this paper we investigate the problem where the goal are to minimise overall vehicle delay while utilising network capacity fully , and respecting air quality limit .
we introduce an automated planning approach for the routing of traffic to address these area .
the approach has been evaluated on micro-simulation model that use real-world data supplied by our industrial partner .
result show the feasibility of using AI planning technology to deliver efficient route for vehicle that avoid the breaking of air quality limit , and that balance traffic flow through the network .
the automated vacuum waste collection optimization problem .
one of the most challenging problem on modern urban planning and one of the goal to be solved for smart city design is that of urban waste disposal .

given urban population growth , and that the amount of waste generated by each of us citizen is also growing , the total amount of waste to be collected and treated is growing dramatically ( EPA 2011 ) , becoming one sensitive issue for local government .
a modern technique for waste collection that is steadily being adopted is automated vacuum waste collection .

this technology uses air suction on a closed network of underground pipe to move waste from the collection point to the processing station , reducing greenhouse gas emission as well as inconvenience to citizen ( odor , noise , ... ) and allowing better waste reuse and recycling .
this technique is open to optimize energy consumption because moving huge amount of waste by air impulsion requires a lot of electric power .

the described problem challenge here is , precisely , that of organizing and scheduling waste collection to minimize the amount of energy per ton of collected waste in such a system via the use of Artificial Intelligence technique .
this kind of problem are an inviting opportunity to showcase the possibility that AI for Computational Sustainability offers .
research on urban anti-terrorism intelligence perception system from the perspective of Internet of thing application .

objective/significance : Based on the urgent need of the status quo of urban anti-terrorism , combining the present situation of intelligent city construction , we carry out the research on the key problem such as the collection and analysis of counter-terrorism information for urban environment .

this paper puts forward a kind of city anti-terrorism information perception system based on the Internet of thing , and realizes to improve the level of surveillance and early warning of terrorist activity facing the urban environment .

method/process : The system collect and merges the heterogeneous information of terrorism , which is based on the information perception layer , the intelligence identification layer and the intelligence inference layer , which is based on the city 's focal area .

to filter suspicious information by constructing a semantic database of terrorist action signal Combined with complex event processing and machine learning technology , real-time monitoring and mining prediction of mass event flow , using the comparison between historical data of terrorist attack and real-time data , increased the area of counter-terrorism intelligence .
results/conclusion : We hope to provide a better model and an exploratory study on the construction of the counter-terrorism early warning for the urban environment .
geosilhouette : Geographical measure of cluster fit .
regionalization , under various guise and description , is a longstanding and pervasive interest of urban study .

with an increasingly large number of study on urban place detection in language , behavior , pricing , and demography , recent critique of longstanding regional science perspective on place detection have focused on the arbitrariness and non-geographical nature of measure of best fit .
in this paper , we develop new explicitly geographical measure of cluster fit .
these hybrid spatial–social measure , called geosilhouette , are demonstrated to capture the “ core ” of geographical cluster in racial data on census block in Brooklyn neighborhood .
these new geosilhouette are also useful in a variety of boundary analysis and outlier detection problem .
in this paper , the thinking behind geosilhouette is presented , their mathematical form is defined , they are demonstrated , and new direction of research are discussed .
gcn2cdd : A Commercial District Discovery Framework via Embedding Space Clustering on Graph Convolution Networks .
modern enterprises attach much attention to the selection of commercial location .
with the rapid development of urban data and machine learning , we can discover the pattern of human mobility with these data and technology to guide commercial district discovery .

in this paper , we propose an unsupervised commercial district discovery framework via embedding space clustering on graph convolution network ( GCN2CDD ) to solve the problem of commercial district discovery .
specifically , the proposed framework aggregates human mobility feature according to geographic similarity by graph convolution network .
based on the graph convolution network embedding space , we apply hierarchical clustering to mine the latent functional region hidden in different human pattern .
then with the kernel density estimation , we can obtain the semantic label for the clustering result to discover commercial district .
finally , we analyze the multi-source data of the Xiaoshan District and Chengdu City and experiment verify the effectiveness of our framework .

planning the Future of Smart Cities with Swarms of Fully Autonomous Unmanned Aerial Vehicles Using a Novel Framework .

the autonomy of unmanned aerial vehicle ( UAVs ) - self-governing in the aerospace discipline has been a remarkable research area with the development of the advanced bespoke microcontroller embedded with advanced AI technique for the last several decade .
the road forward about the operational environment is certain about the swarm of fully automated UAVs ( FAUAVs ) , that is , urban area .

fauavs with self-learning and self-decision-making ability by executing non-trivial sequence of event with decimetre-level accuracy based on a set of rule , control loop and constraint using dynamic flight plan and trajectory are taking their indispensable part within smart city ( SCs ) .
therefore , their integration with the SC component using real-time data analytic is urgent .

this is mainly required to establish a better swarm intelligence along with a safer and optimised harmonious smart ecosystem that enables cooperative FAUAV-SC automation system with collaborative automated intelligence engaging in the concept of Internet of Everything ( IoE ) and Automation of Everything ( AoE ) .

planning the future of city with swarm of FAUAVs is explored in this paper to optimise the use of FAUAVs with a diverse range of application and a contemporary methodology is proposed using a holistic framework - FAUAVinSCF equipped with various effective and efficient technique along with a novel FAUAV routing technique customisable to the constraint of FAUAVs and urban area .

with the methodology , the component of SC and FAUAVs involving recent and impending technological advancement are moulded together to make this inevitable transformation a harmonious part of the inhabitant contributing to the city ' liveability and sustainability .

the framework consists of a decentralized agent-based control architecture that monitor and controls the swarm of resource-constraint FAUAVs for their real-time requirement in optimising their urban use .

the outcome of the methodology suggest that the constraint of FAUAVs can be mitigated significantly in urban area and consequently , their efficacy can be increased in realising their diverse range of mission .
learning from urban form to predict building height .
understanding city as complex system , sustainable urban planning depend on reliable high-resolution data , for example of the building stock to upscale region-wide retrofit policy .
for some city and region , these data exist in detailed 3D model based on real-world measurement .
however , they are still expensive to build and maintain , a significant challenge , especially for small and medium-sized city that are home to the majority of the European population .
new method are needed to estimate relevant building stock characteristic reliably and cost-effectively .
here , we present a machine learning based method for predicting building height , which is based only on open-access geospatial data on urban form , such as building footprint and street network .
the method allows to predict building height for region where no dedicated 3D model exist currently .

we train our model using building data from four European countrie ( France , Italy , the Netherlands , and Germany ) and find that the morphology of the urban fabric surrounding a given building is highly predictive of the height of the building .

a test on the German state of Brandenburg shows that our model predicts building height with an average error well below the typical floor height ( about 2.5 m ) , without having access to training data from Germany .
furthermore , we show that even a small amount of local height data obtained by citizen substantially improves the prediction accuracy .

our result illustrate the possibility of predicting missing data on urban infrastructure ; they also underline the value of open government data and volunteered geographic information for scientific application , such as contextual but scalable strategy to mitigate climate change .

the shape of segregation : The role of urban form in immigrant assimilation .
the built environment can mediate or constrain the opportunity for social interaction , essential to the formation of social tie .

this study uses the large inflow of immigrant in Barcelona between 1998 and 2008 to study whether the configuration of building and open urban area in a block is associated with the residential segregation of immigrants—a proxy for social interaction .
based on a rich set of shape metric , I use machine learning technique to classify each block in Barcelona into one of eight typology , which provide a summary measure of their built environment .
i then combine these data with measure of residential segregation constructed at the building level using data on the exact address of each resident of Barcelona .

the finding show that some feature of the built environment of a block—as measured by the typologies—are systematically associated with reduced residential segregation of Spaniards and newly arrived immigrant in that block .
learning geo-contextual embedding for commuting flow prediction .
predicting commuting flow based on infrastructure and land-use information is critical for urban planning and public policy development .
however , it is a challenging task given the complex pattern of commuting flow .
conventional model , such as gravity model , are mainly derived from physic principle and limited by their predictive power in real-world scenario where many factor need to be considered .
meanwhile , most existing machine learning-based method ignore the spatial correlation and fail to model the influence of nearby region .

to address these issue , we propose Geocontextual Multitask Embedding Learner ( GMEL ) , a model that captures the spatial correlation from geographic contextual information for commuting flow prediction .
specifically , we first construct a geo-adjacency network containing the geographic contextual information .

then , an attention mechanism is proposed based on the framework of graph attention network ( GAT ) to capture the spatial correlation and encode geographic contextual information to embedding space .
two separate GATs are used to model supply and demand characteristic .

to enhance the effectiveness of the embedding representation , a multitask learning framework is used to introduce stronger restriction , forcing the embedding to encapsulate effective representation for flow prediction .
finally , a gradient boosting machine is trained based on the learned embedding to predict commuting flow .
we evaluate our model using real-world dataset from New York City and the experimental result demonstrate the effectiveness of our proposed method against the state of the art .
investigating adoption pattern of residential low impact development ( LID ) using classification tree .
local government are under pressure to improve storm water management and often time must comply with consent decree with the Federal Government .

decentralizing a portion of the storm water management by integrating private landowner into localized retention and infiltration effort , that is , low impact development ( LID ) or green infrastructure project , is becoming increasingly popular .
some wastewater system have considered incentivizing private land owner to make improvement aimed at retaining storm water or slowing the conveyance to grey infrastructure .
this study examines potential opportunity for incentivizing private residential land owner in Washington DC to install LID project .
this study maps LID configuration to a set of adoption strategy and category .
the C4.5 algorithm is then applied to identify a high performance decision tree for classifying parcel by adoption strategy or adoption category based on property-level attribute .
a Survey of Recent Advances in Crowd Density Estimation using Image Processing .
crowd analysis is an essential topic of research in artificial intelligence .
there are several application on crowd analysis , such as , environmental management , urban planning and public safety .
this paper presents review of different methodology those have been implemented for estimating crowd .
this paper covers several method of crowd density estimation , such as , image processing technique , machine learning and deep learning based technique , and smartphone based technique .
rapid and automated urban modeling technique for UAS application .
urban model for testing UAV path-planning algorithms commonly apply simple representation using cuboid or cylinderical shape which may not capture the characteristic of a urban environment .
to address this limitation of existing urban model , this paper presents two urban modeling technique for an unmanned aircraft flight simulation in an urban environment .

the first proposed urban modeling technique is an airborne LiDAR source-based approach that incorporates machine learning algorithm to identify the number of building and characterize them from the LiDAR information .

the second proposed urban modeling technique is an artificial urban modeling technique without any airborne LiDAR resource that applies an adaptive spacing method , an iterative algorithm to define an artificial urban environment .

unlike the LiDAR source-based approach that creates an approximated urban model , the adaptive spacing-based urban modeling algorithm generates an artificial urban environment that is visually different from a reference city , but has similar the characteristic to it .
to demonstrate the two proposed urban modeling technique , numerical simulation are conducted using open-source dataset to construct several realistic urban model .
using Random Forest on Real-World City Data for Urban Planning in a Visual Semantic Decision Support System .

the constantly increasing amount and availability of urban data derived from varying source leads to an assortment of challenge that include , among other , the consolidation , visualization , and maximal exploitation prospect of the aforementioned data .

a preeminent problem affecting urban planning is the appropriate choice of location to host a particular activity ( either commercial or common welfare service ) or the correct use of an existing building or empty space .
in this paper , we propose an approach to address these challenge availed with machine learning technique .

the proposed system combine , fuse , and merges various type of data from different source , encodes them using a novel semantic model that can capture and utilize both low-level geometric information and higher level semantic information and subsequently feeds them to the random forests classifier , as well as other supervised machine learning model for comparison .

our experimental evaluation on multiple real-world data set comparing the performance of several classifier ( including Feedforward Neural Networks , Support Vector Machines , Bag of Decision Trees , k-Nearest Neighbor and Naïve Bayes ) , indicated the superiority of Random Forests in term of the examined performance metric ( Accuracy , Specificity , Precision , Recall , F-measure and G-mean ) .
predicting safe parking space : A machine learning approach to geospatial urban and crime data .
this research aims to identify spatial and time pattern of theft in Manhattan , NY , to reveal urban factor that contribute to theft from motor vehicle and to build a prediction model for theft .

method include time series and hot spot analysis , linear regression , elastic-net , Support vector machine SVM with radial and linear kernel , decision tree , bagged CART , random forest , and stochastic gradient boosting .

machine learning method reveal that linear model perform better on our data ( linear regression , elastic-net ) , specifying that a higher number of subway entrance , graffiti , and restaurant on Street contribute to higher theft rate from motor vehicle .

although the prediction model for theft meet almost all assumption ( five of six ) , its accuracy is 77 % , suggesting that there are other undiscovered factor making a contribution to the generation of theft .
as an output demonstrating final result , the application prototype for searching safer parking in Manhattan , NY based on the prediction model , has been developed .
an AI Approach to Collecting and Analyzing Human Interactions with Urban Environment .

thank to advance in Internet of Things and crowd-sensing , it is possible to collect vast amount of urban data , to better understand how citizen interact with city and , in turn , improve human well-being in urban environment .
this is a scientifically challenging proposition , as it requires new method to fuse objective ( heterogeneous ) data ( e.g .
people location trail and sensor data ) with subjective ( perceptual ) data ( e.g .
the citizen ' quality of experience collected through feedback form ) .
when it comes to vast urban area , collecting statistically significant data is a daunting task ; thus new data-collection method are required too .

in this work , we turn to artificial intelligence ( AI ) to address these challenge , introducing a method whereby the objective , sensor data is analyzed in real-time to scope down the test matrix of the subjective questionnaire .
in turn , subjective response are parsed through AI model to extract further objective information .
the outcome is an interactive data analysis framework for urban environment , which we put to test in the context of a citizen ' well-being project .
in our pilot study , each new entry ( objective or subjective ) is parsed through the AI engine to determine which action maximizes the information gain .
this translates into a particular question being fired at a specific moment and place , to a specific person .
with our AI data collection method , we can reach statistical significance much faster , achieving ( in our city-wide pilot study ) a 41 % acceleration factor and a 75 % reduction in intrusiveness .
our study opens new Avenue in urban science , with potential application in urban planning , citizen 's well-being project , and sociology , to mention but a few case .
a multiscale clustering of the urban morphology for use in quantitative model .

geo-spatial data available to researcher and practitioner has increased substantially over the last decade , offering new opportunity for analyzing and characterizing location and their spatial environment in an objective way .

various study in the field of urban planning and design have given recommendation on “ good urban form ” , suggesting that especially characteristic of the urban morphology inform the quality of location and additionally influence spatial behavior .

while we find a growing number of quantitative spatial model such as hedonic price model , location choice model , or applied machine learning algorithm , characteristic describing the urban morphology are still rarely reported in these .
one reason can be found in the limited knowledge on how to characterize the urban morphology best .
in this chapter , we address this deficit and define attribute that are suitable to characterize the urban morphology in quantitative mean at different scale .
we show how these can be processed from a data model that is simple enough to allow for reproducibility in most study area and process them for the case study of Switzerland .
finally , we use the attribute to define urban typology through clustering method .
these are compared on their outcome , their consistency , and interpretation .
risk management system must provide automatic decision according to crisis computable algebra .

is is nowadays our responsibility to convince our contemporary citizen that AI device as UGVs ( Unmanned Ground Vehicles ) and UAVs ( Unmanned Aerial Vehicles ) are crucial actor of today 's life in a dual domain , both civilian and military .

in particular , the decision process is the main component of every military operation and is of high interest because of two main reason : it is necessary designed to cope with conflict issue and it requires a very complex planning process to be successful .

the difficulty to find a good plan is worse in urban area because of the high uncertainty due to the topology of these area , the presence of civilian , who can be hostile or friendly , and the unpredictable nature of enemy .
the idea in that paper is to qualify what can be a valid computed plan in that context , i.e .
well-designed for recovering of peace , rescue operation after a bombing event , hostage salvage , non-combatant evacuation operation , civil-military co-operation , .
, in urban area .

this planning process leads to associate actually four component , the representation of the tactical scheme , the implementation of the tactical scheme as the behaviour of special force , military unit or emergency squad , the proof process or the explanation process , and finally the handling of external factor depending on the current environment or the current context in which the operation takes place .

this paper uses a quaternary representation called the epistemological quadriptych , in order to highlight that the integration of UGVs or UAVs device requires actually to understand the role of knowledge and behaviour and to provide secure and valid action plan , i.e .
which can be explained and justified .
big data analytic for identifying electricity theft using machine learning approach in microgrid for smart community .
electricity theft ( ET ) causes major revenue loss in power utility .
it reduces the quality of supply , raises production cost , causes legal consumer to pay the higher cost , and impacts the economy as a whole .
in this article , we use the State Grid Corporation of China ( SGCC ) dataset , which contains electricity consumption data of 1035 day for two class : normal and fraudulent .
in this work , ET detection model is proposed that consists of four step : interpolation , data balancing , feature extraction , and classification .
first , missing value of the dataset are recovered using the interpolation method .
second , resampling technique is implemented .
et consumer are 9 % in the SGCC dataset that make the model inefficient to correctly classify both class ( normal and theft ) .
a hybrid resampling technique is proposed , named synthetic minority oversampling technique with near miss .
third , residual network extracts the latent features from the SGCC dataset .
fourth , three tree based classifier , such as decision tree ( DT ) , random forest ( RF ) , and adaptive boosting ( AdaBoost ) are applied to train the encoded feature vector for classification .
besides , search for good hyperparameter is a challenging task , which is usually done manually and takes a considerable amount of time .
to resolve this problem , Bayesian optimizer is used to simplify the tuning process of DT , RF , and AdaBoost .
finally , the result indicate that RF outperforms DT and AdaBoost .
gis-based comparative study of Bayes network , Hoeffding tree and logistic model tree for landslide susceptibility modeling .
landslide , one of the most common hazard around the world , have brought about severe damage to life and property of human .
to prevent and mitigate landslide , various model have been introduced to assess landslide susceptibility .
in this paper , Hoeffding Tree ( HT ) , a prevailing data stream mining algorithm , was employed to predict landslide susceptibility in Muchuan County , China for the first time .
meanwhile , Logistic Model Tree ( LMT ) and Bayes Network ( BN ) were applied to produce landslide susceptibility map for comparison .
the model performance were evaluated by Receiver Operating Characteristic ( ROC ) curve and area under the curve ( AUC ) .
to obtain landslide inventory map , 279 landslide data was collected , and training and validation dataset were randomly divided with a proportion of 70 % to 30 % .

furthermore , twelve conditioning factor ( altitude , slope angle , profile curvature , plan curvature , slope aspect , distance to roads , distance to river , TWI , NDVI , soil , land use and lithology ) were selected to construct landslide susceptibility model .
moreover , correlation between conditioning factor and landslide were analyzed using Frequency Ratio ( FR ) .
the result showed landslide are prone to occur in area where human activity concentrate , and all three model exhibited satisfying performance .
concretely , for training dataset , LMT model showed the highest AUC ( 0.854 ) , followed by HT ( 0.726 ) and BN ( 0.709 ) .
however , for validation dataset , LMT and BN model generated similar AUC value ( 0.761 and 0.764 respectively ) , and the highest AUC value belonged to HT ( 0.802 ) .

the distribution of landslide susceptibility zone revealed that the interior of county town is mainly seated in low and very low susceptibility zone , whereas region close to the border suffer high and very high landslide risk .
the result acquired in this paper are significant to landslide prevention and urban planning in Muchuan , China .
additionally , this study proved that HT model is a promising classifier for landslide susceptibility modeling .
an ensemble energy consumption forecasting model based on spatial-temporal clustering analysis in residential building .
