due to the availability of smart metering infrastructure , high-resolution electric consumption data is readily available to study the dynamic of residential electric consumption at finely resolved spatial and temporal scale .
analyzing the electric consumption data enables the policymak-er and building owner to understand consumer ’ s demand-consumption behavior .

furthermore , analysis and accurate forecasting of electric consumption are substantial for consumer involvement in time-of-use tariff , critical peak pricing , and consumer-specific demand response initiative .

along-side its vast economic and sustainability implication , such as energy wastage and decarbonization of the energy sector , accurate consumption forecasting facilitates power system planning and stable grid operation .

energy consumption forecasting is an active research area ; despite the abundance of devised model , electric consumption forecasting in residential building remains challenging due to high occupant energy use behavior variability .
hence the search for an appropriate model for accurate electric consumption forecasting is ever continuing .
to this aim , this paper presents a spatial and temporal ensemble forecasting model for short-term electric consumption forecasting .
the proposed work involves exploring electric consumption profile at the apartment level through cluster analysis based on the k-mean algorithm .
the ensemble forecasting model consists of two deep learning model ; Long Short-Term Memory Unit ( LSTM ) and Gated Recurrent Unit ( GRU ) .
first , the apartment-level historical electric consumption data is clustered .
later the cluster are aggregated based on consumption profile of consumer .
at the building and floor level , the ensemble model are trained using aggregated electric consumption data .
the proposed ensemble model forecasts the electric consumption at three spatial scale apartment , building , and floor level for hourly , daily , and weekly forecasting horizon .
furthermore , the impact of spatial-temporal granularity and cluster analysis on the prediction accuracy is analyzed .
the dataset used in this study comprises high-resolution electric consumption data acquired through smart meter recorded on an hourly basis over the period of one year .
the consumption data belong to four multifamily residential building situated in an urban area of South Korea .
to prove the effectiveness of our proposed forecasting model , we compared our model with widely known machine learning model and deep learning variant .

the result achieved by our proposed ensemble scheme verify that model has learned the sequential behavior of electric consumption by producing superior performance with the lowest MAPE of 4.182 and 4.54 at building and floor level prediction , respectively .
the experimental finding suggest that the model has efficiently captured the dynamic electric consumption characteristic to exploit ensemble model diversity and achieved lower forecasting error .
the proposed ensemble forecasting scheme is well suited for predictive modeling and short-term load forecasting .
shanghai ’ s regenerated industrial waterfront : Urban lab for sustainability transition ?
in China , Shanghai often serves as a place to introduce and try out new idea .
this is certainly the case with experimental urban planning and design solution and sustainability transition .
this article identifie and evaluates the role of pilot project and demonstration zone along the Huangpu River .
these cluster and zone are supposed to guide the urban regeneration of the former industrial waterfront and to accelerate innovative development in Shanghai and the wider Yangtze Delta Region .

the Huangpu River as a whole is considered an urban lab and a showcase of ecological civilisation policy , with a strong ‘ people oriented ’ focus on improving the overall quality and attractiveness of urban life .
following three decade of rapid urban expansion , Shanghai ’ s urban development model is shifting toward one that emphasizes den-sification and the reuse of existing element .
the motto of Shanghai ’ s latest master plan is “ Striving for an Excellent Global City.
” One of the pathway to realize this expectation is the creation of thematic cluster for creative industry , financial institutes , AI , and technology , media and telecommunication industry .
these cluster are high‐density investment project meant to support and accelerate the transformation of Shanghai into a service economy .
there are important sim-ilaritie between these project in Shanghai and the role of urban lab in theory of sustainability transition .

drawing on these theory and those of ecological civilization , this article examines how these so‐called ‘ experimental ’ urban megapro-ject along the river contribute to Shanghai ’ s effort to take the lead in developing sustainable urban transition .
water Distribution-Transportation Interface Connectivity Responding to Urban Geospatial Morphology .
water distribution and transportation system are geospatially colocated , forming a network of connection .
this network of connection is referred to as an interface network .
investigation of interface network connectivity can help understand and minimize failure propagation from water to transportation system .
water distribution-transportation interface network consist of node , which can be either pipes or roads , and edge , which represent the geospatial colocation of a pipe and road .

the purpose of this study is twofold : to topologically represent geospatial colocation by characterizing the connectivity of water distribution-transportation interface network for multiple city , and to identify the nodal attributes that are most predictive of a given connectivity profile .
a total of forty interface network from eight city of varying geospatial morphology are extracted and analyzed using network analysis and machine learning .
using network analysis , we investigate whether the topological connectivity between water and transportation is consistent across different city .
then we use a random forest model to ascertain which nodal attribute may have predictive power to identify the connectivity cluster of the city to which a node belongs .

the result indicate that city of different geospatial morphology may vary in their interface network connectivity , and the average shortest path length of a given node is the major nodal feature contributing to a given city 's interface network connectivity .
these finding hold implication for urban planning and water distribution design to mitigate potential cascading failure .
access and form of urbanity in public space : Transit urban design beyond the global north .
there has been an emerging interest in the study of urban design dimension associated with Transit-Oriented Development ( TODs ) .
however , addressing the question of how TOD principles laid out in the international literature can be explored in the context of the global South remains in an incipient stage .

in this paper , we investigate the nexus between station walkable catchment and form of urbanity around transit node by adopting an assemblage approach to cut across any separation of sociality and spatiality .

drawing on empirical research from two case study in Tehran , this paper contributes to study on transit urban design by developing two measure of accessibility-the Catchment of Accessible Public Spaces ( CAPS ) and Accessible Interface ( AI ) .

we found that the combination of high CAPS and high AI within a given time can enable streetlife intensity , which is also linked to a synergistic effect of a larger assemblage , including the number of entry and diversity of function .
we argue that a focus on both measure is critical to understand the performance and potential transformation of street network in a TOD .
intrusion Detection System as Audit in IoT Infrastructure using Ensemble Learning and SMOTE Method .
with the industrial revolution 4.0 , the use of IoT-based system is increasing , both in the field of health manufacturing , urban planning , housing , and even automotive .
therefore , the security of the IoT system needs to be considered , this is related to data integrity , privacy , service stability .
through intrusion detection , activity on the IoT system will be able to be analyzed whether there are suspicious activity that can interfere with or threaten IoT service .
in several previous study in the literature , the approach used to detect intrusion in the IoT system has a high false alarm rate .

this research proposes an approach through machine learning , specifically the ensemble learning approach and the synthetic minority over-sampling technique ( SMOTE ) method as a method of detecting intrusion in the IoT system which is expected to produce better performance .
the result of this study indicate that the proposed approach is able to detect intrusion and classify into five type of intrusion including normal intrusion , probe , dos , r2l , u2r .

based on the evaluation result , the proposed approach can improve the performance of intrusion detection in term of accuracy to 97.02 % , detection rate of 97 % , false alarm rate 0.16 % , compared to base learning and approach in previous study used as intrusion detection method , but in processing time performance have not shown satisfying result .
accelerated exploration for long-term urban water infrastructure planning through machine learning .

in this study , the neural network method ( Multi-Layer Perceptron , MLP ) was integrated with an explorative model , to study the feasibility of using machine learning to reduce the exploration time but providing the same support in long-term water system adaptation planning .
the specific network structure and training pattern were determined through a comprehensive statistical trial-and-error ( considering the distribution of error ) .
the network was applied to the case study in Scotchman 's Creek , Melbourne .
the network was trained with the first 10 % of the exploration data , validated with the following 5 % and tested on the rest .

the overall root-mean-square-error between the entire observed data and the predicted data is 10.5722 , slightly higher than the validation result ( 9.7961 ) , suggesting that the proposed trial-and-error method is reliable .
the designed MLP showed good performance dealing with spatial randomness from decentralized strategy .
the adoption of MLP-supported planning may overestimate the performance of candidate urban water system .

by adopting the safety coefficient , a multiplicator or exponent calculated by observed data and predicted data in the validation process , the overestimation problem can be controlled in an acceptable range and have few impact on final decision making .
toward a deep learning powered query engine for urban planning .
urban planning is crucial to sustainable growth .
in order for the planner to make informed decision , data from multiple source have to be retrieved and cross-referenced efficiently .

we discuss the implementation of a query engine which accepts natural language as input , using machine learning and NLP technique namely word embedding , CNN , rule-based system and NER to produce accurate output enriched with geographical insight to facilitate the planning process .
the query engine classifies the query into one of the planning domain , as well as determine the category , location and the size of buffer .
processed result are presented on the ePlanner , which is a map service on the GIS implemented by the Urban Redevelopment Authority ( URA ) of Singapore .
machine learning for real-time urban metric and design recommendation .
city are growing , becoming more complex , and changing rapidly .
currently , community engagement for urban decision-making is often ineffective , uninformed , and only occurs in project ’ later stage .
to facilitate a more collaborative and evidence-based urban decision-making process for both expert and non-expert , real-time feedback and optimized suggestion are essential .
however , most of the current tool for urban planning are neither capable of performing complex simulation in real-time nor of providing guidance for better urban performance .
citymatrix was introduced to address these challenge .
machine learning technique were applied to achieve real-time prediction of multiple urban simulation , and thousand of city configuration were simulated .
the simulation result were used to train a convolutional neural network ( CNN ) to predict the traffic and solar performance of unseen city configuration .
the prediction with the CNN is thousand of time faster than the original simulation and maintains a high-quality representation of the result .
this machine learning approach was applied as a versatile , quick , accurate , and computationally efficient method not only for real-time feedback , but also for optimized design recommendation .
user involved in the evaluation of this project had a better understanding of the embodied trade-off of the city and achieved their goal in an efficient manner .
artificial Neural Networks as an Architectural Design Tool-Generating New Detail Forms Based on the Roman Corinthian Order Capital .

the following paper presents the result of the research in the field of the machine learning , investigating the scope of application of the artificial neural network algorithms as a tool in architectural design .

the computational experiment was held using the backward propagation of error method of training the artificial neural network , which was trained based on the geometry of the detail of the Roman Corinthian order capital .

during the experiment , as an input training data set , five local geometry parameter combined has given the best result : Theta , Pi , Rho in spherical coordinate system based on the capital volume centroid , followed by Z value of the Cartesian coordinate system and a distance from vertical plane created based on the capital symmetry .
additionally during the experiment , artificial neural network hidden layer optimal count and structure was found , giving result of the error below 0.2 % for the mentioned before input parameter .
once successfully trained artificial network , was able to mimic the detail composition on any other geometry type given .
despite of calculating the transformed geometry locally and separately for each of the thousand of surface point , system could create visually attractive and diverse , complex pattern .
designed tool , based on the supervised learning method of machine learning , gives possibility of generating new architectural forms- free of the designer 's imagination bound .

implementing the infinitely broad computational method of machine learning , or Artificial Intelligence in general , not only could accelerate and simplify the design process , but give an opportunity to explore never seen before , unpredictable form or everyday architectural practice solution .
analysis of relationship between road traffic noise and urban form indicator through machine learning method .
as the urban area overcrowded , volume of urban road traffic is increasing .
it could affect adverse effect on the urban resident 's life quality and health .
however , road traffic noise is being managed after it has affected urban resident , because it could not managed at urban planning stage .
therefore , reactive-management of road traffic noise , such as noise barrier is chosen as noise control plan , but it is costly than proactive-management .
when road traffic noise could be considered as urban planning factor , the cost will be reduced .
machine learning method , such as regression analysis , decision tree and artificial neural network , could be used to analyze the relationship between variable .
this method was used to analyze relationship between road traffic noise and urban form indicator .
predicted noise level of road traffic noise at building facade was used as output variable , and urban form indicator are used as input variable .
applicable urban form indicator could be divided into population-related , building-related , traffic-related and land-use-related .
building-related indicator include building coverage ratio , floor area ratio , and traffic-related indicator include traffic volume , speed and percentage of heavy vehicle .
explanation power of the prediction model derived through machine learning method could verified through correlation , coefficient of determination and k-fold cross validation .
applicability of support vector machine in landslide susceptibility mapping .
landslide in Slovakia are followed by great economic loss and threat to human life .
therefore , implementation of landslide susceptibility model is essential in urban planning .
the main purpose of this study is to investigate the possible applicability of Support Vector Machines ( SVMs ) in landslides susceptibility prediction .
we have built a classification problem with two class , landslide and stable area , and applied SVMs algorithms in the district Bytča , Kysucké Nové Mesto and Žilina .
a spatial database of landslide area and geologically stable area from the State Geological Institute of Dionýz Štúr were used to fit SVMs model .
four environmental input parameter , land use , lithology , aspect and slope were used to train support vector machine model .
during the training phase , the primal objective was to find optimal set of kernel parameter by grid search .
the linear , polynomial and radial basis function kernel were computed .
together 534 model were trained and tested with LIBLINEAR and LIBSVM library .
model were evaluated by Accuracy parameter .
then the Receiver Operating Characteristic ( ROC ) and landslides susceptibility map were produced for the best model for every kernel .
the best predictive performance was gained by radial basis function kernel .
this kernel has also the best generalization ability .
the result showed that SVMs employed in the presented study gave promising result with more than 0.90 ( the area under the ROC curve ( AUC ) prediction performance .
systematic data mining into land consumption in Germany .
this paper presents a systematic approach for discovering comprehensible , valid , potentially innovative and useful structure in multivariate municipality data .
technique from statistic , machine learning and data mining are applied in logical consecutive step .
this allows the validation after each step and the generation of important result during the investigation .
in particular , the approach does not end with a clustering of the data .
if a structure has been identified , then the question is posed : what does the cluster mean ?
symbolic machine learning method are used to produce an understandable description of the cluster in form of classification rule .
the approach is demonstrated on a data set of nine variable concerning land consumption of all municipality in Germany .
selected result demonstrate the capacity of the method .
a comparison among various classification algorithms for travel mode detection using sensor ' data collected by smartphone .
nowaday , machine learning is used widely for the purpose of detecting the mode of transportation from data collected by sensor embedded in smartphone like GPS , accelerometer and gyroscope .
a lot of different classification algorithm are applied for this purpose .
this study provides a comprehensive comparison among various classification algorithms on the basis of accuracy of result and computational time .
the data used was collected in Kobe city , Japan using smartphone and cover seven transport mode .
after feature extraction , the data was applied to algo-rithms namely Support Vector Ma-chine , Neural Network , Decision Tree , Boosted Decision Tree , Random Forest and Naïve Bayes .
result indicat-ed that boosted decision tree gives highest accuracy but random forest is much quicker with accuracy slightly lower than that of boosted decision tree .
therefore , for the purpose of travel mode detection , random forest is most suitable .
a reasoning approach for modelling and predicting terroristic attack in urban environment .
during the last decade the world has witnessed a number of terroristic attack and security incident exposing numerous vulnerability of the urban environment .

hence the ability to proactively detect and even predict potential threat related to terrorist attack is crucial for supporting government agency in order to timely react ( pro-act ) to potentially alarming terrorist attack .

the work described in this paper is part of an overall larger effort in developing a framework for early identification and prediction of terrorist action ( the PROACTIVE project-http : //www.fp7-proactive.eu/ ) .
the paper focuses on a near real-time reasoning layer designed around a number of reasoning capability for transforming raw and symbolic event into meaningful alert .
the reasoning layer was designed to process information source at different abstraction level ( e.g .
sensor information , police patrol input , external semantic crafted data source ) and simulates various expert user role indicated as crucial in the intelligence analyst work flow ( i.e .
operational , tactical and strategic user role ) .

additionally a special focus was given to support functional requirement of the overall terrorist attack prediction system , as producing near real-time detection of threat event by relying on reliable model regarding terrorist action and predicting sensitive threat event .
hence the overall designed build on top of approach as event driven architecture , complex event processing system , and machine learning technique .
a prototype implementation of layer is presented in a simulated validation scenario .

the prototype allows an expert user to monitor threat probability for different physical environment , and influence the sensitivity of these environment in real-time as well as and provide feedback for adapting the machine learning model .
metroped : A tool for supporting crowds of pedestrian AI 's in urban environment .
metroped is a tool for supporting AI behaviour in real-time virtual city environment .

given information about the basic geometry of the environment being modelled , it allows a designer to annotate and mark-up element of relevance to AI character , providing support for appropriate autonomous AI behaviour in a manner consistent with the visual representation of the environment .

we describe the tool and mark-up process , providing insight into the importance of AI tool and principled approach when attempting to create large number of AI controlled character for use in real-time application situated in urban environment .
we also describe how we have been using the tool in novel way to research viewer perception of crowd behaviour .
road traffic safety management strategy for the Western Cape Province .
in 2004 , the Western Cape Department of Community Safety decided to revise the existing traffic safety strategy for the Western Cape Province .

existing strategy and practice within the traditional road traffic safety portfolio were identified , and recommendation for improvement were made in order to maximise the impact of these practice on road traffic safety .

there was also a need to draw in role player outside the traditional safety sphere to commit time and fund towards the improvement of road traffic safety in the Province The methodology followed to develop the strategy consisted of a review of relevant documentation , an assessment of information system and collection of data , interview and discussion with role player on provincial , metropolitan and local level within all related discipline .

the development of a Road Traffic Safety Management Strategy required a comprehensive analysis of the current road traffic safety situation in the Western Cape , as well as an assessment of the current approach to provincial management .

the vision of the Western Cape Traffic Safety Management Strategy `` A Safer Road Environment for AI '' embraces the provincial vision for `` A Home for AII '' , and the vision adopted by the Department of Community Safety , which is `` A Safer Home For AII '' .
the Strategy furthermore embraces the concept of Holistic Governance , with its pillar of Integrated , Co-operative and Responsive Governance .
specific thematic issue emanating from the analysis are addressed in the Strategy .
they are : law enforcement ; education and communication ; engineering and land development ; public transport ; and health and emergency service .
operational objective at regional level are defined .
the role of Regional Centres and the Partnership Manager to be appointed at each Regional Centre are defined .
a Performance Management system with clearly defined Key Result Areas for each official is recommended .
automated classification of building structure for urban built environment identification using machine learning .

the urban environment , especially building with different structure type , is difficult to identify automatically due to variation in urban function and form and to building ’ relatively tacit structural attribute .
to enable automated classification of building structure in complex urban environment , this study developed a machine learning ( ML ) -based method .
twenty-nine ML feature were defined , and twelve popular ML algorithms were tested .
the method was tested by classifying over 3700 building in Beijing , China into five common structure .
of the 12 ML algorithms , the Gradient Boosted Decision Tree delivered the highest overall performance , and its classification was verified as effective , i.e.
, achieving approximately 91.7 % , 90.6 % , and 91.1 % of average recall , precision and F1 , respectively , on testing data .

this study 's classification method helps establish a nexus among urban form , building structure , and material and resource requirement , thus contributing to the advance of sustainable urban study , such as urban metabolism and ecological planning .
a generative architectural and urban design method through artificial neural network .
machine learning , as a computational tool for finding mapping between the input and output data , has been widely used in engineering Field .
researcher have applied machine learning model to generate 2D drawing with pixel or 3D model with voxel , but the pixelization reduces the precision of the geometry .

therefore , in order to learn and generate 3D geometry as vectorized model with higher precision and faster computation speed , we develop a specific artificial neural network , learning and generating design feature for the form of building .

a customized data structure with feature parameter is constructed , meeting the requirement of the neural network by rebuilding surface with controlling point and appending additional input neuron as quantified vector to describe the property of the design .
the neural network is first trained with generated design data and then tested by adjusting the feature parameter .
the prediction of the generated data shows the basic generative ability of the neural network .

furthermore , trained with design data collected from existing building , the neural network learn and infer the geometric design feature of architectural design with different feature parameter , providing a data-driven method for designer to generate and analyze architectural form .
dengue disease dynamic are modulated by the combined influence of precipitation and landscape : A machine learning approach .
background : Dengue is an endemic vector-borne disease influenced by environmental factor such as landscape and climate .
previous study separately assessed the effect of landscape and climate factor on mosquito occurrence and dengue incidence .
however , both factor concurrently coexist in time and space and can interact , affecting mosquito development and dengue disease transmission .
for example , egg laid in a suitable environment can hatch after being submerged in rain water .
it has been difficult for conventional statistical modeling approach to demonstrate these combined influence due to mathematical constraint .
objective : To investigate the combined influence of landscape and climate factor on mosquito occurrence and dengue incidence .

method : Entomological , epidemiological , and landscape data from the rainy season ( July–December ) were obtained from respective government agency in Metropolitan Manila , Philippines , from 2012 to 2014 .
temperature , precipitation and vegetation data were obtained through remote sensing .
a random forest algorithm was used to select the landscape and climate variable .

afterward , using the identified key variable , a model-based ( MOB ) recursive partitioning was implemented to test the combined influence of landscape and climate factor on ovitrap index ( vector mosquito occurrence ) and dengue incidence .

result : The MOB recursive partitioning for ovitrap index indicated a high sensitivity of vector mosquito occurrence on environmental condition generated by a combination of high residential density area with low precipitation .
moreover , the MOB recursive partitioning indicated high sensitivity of dengue incidence to the effect of precipitation in area with high proportion of residential density and commercial area .
conclusion : Dengue dynamic are not solely influenced by individual effect of either climate or landscape , but rather by their synergistic or combined effect .

the presented finding have the potential to target vector surveillance in area identified as suitable for mosquito occurrence under specific climatic condition and may be relevant as part of urban planning strategy to control dengue .
geospatial simulation of urban neighbourhood densification potential .

although densification of urban area is being proposed as a sustainable urbanisation strategy , framework for detailed large-scale analysis of densification potential and their evaluation are lacking .
a geospatial simulation framework is presented to assess and evaluate densification potential at the neighbourhood level of already built-up residential area .
the focus is on post-war neighbourhood , which are particularly promising for sustainable densification .
neighbourhood are localised using geospatial analysis and based on literature and architectural design , potential are estimated for different neighbourhood archetype and densification strategy .
potential are simulated at a national scale using supervised archetype classification .
the embeddedness into current mobility infrastructure is used as a proxy for evaluating the sustainability of neighbourhood densification .
the developed framework is tested for Switzerland .
depending on the densification strategy , the simulated additional inhabitant for populating post-war urban neighbourhood range between 4–15 % of the current population .
more than half of this potential is located in central area and is well connected by public transportation .
the presented approach is suitable for assessing spatially explicit densification potential and for prioritising densification location .
we show that in countrie with a high number of post-war neighbourhood in well-connected location , considerable densification opportunity could be realised in already built-up residential area .
meta-regression framework for energy consumption prediction in a smart city : A case study of Songdo in South Korea .
nowadays the concept of smart city has gained in popularity in urban study .
a smart city collects diverse information to monitor and analyze urban system , such as energy management .
it is crucial for smart city to monitor energy efficiency to be sustainable .
in this study , we search to expose the possibility offered by the energy data of Songdo , a South Korean smart city .
first , we have highlighted the ability of Songdo to generate energy data .
second , we used those data to predict its evolution .
as a result , we develop a short-term stacking ensemble model for energy consumption in Songdo , focusing on a three-months-ahead prediction problem .

to obtain this result , first we design a baseline regressor for the prediction , second , we apply a three-combination of each best model of the base regressor , and finally , a weighted meta-regression model was applied using meta-XGBoost .
we call the resulting model stacking ensemble model .
the proposed stacking ensemble model combines the best ensemble network to improve performance prediction , yielding an R2 value of 97.89 % .
the result support the effectiveness of the ensemble network , which use Artificial Neural Networks ( ANN ) , CatBoost and Gradient Boosting .
this study also shows that the weighted meta model outperforms several machine learning model in term of R2 , MAE and RSME .
demystifying uncertainty in PM10 susceptibility mapping using variable drop-off in extreme-gradient boosting ( XGB ) and random forest ( RF ) algorithms .

this study investigates uncertainty in machine learning that can occur when there is significant variance in the prediction importance level of the independent variable , especially when the ROC fails to reflect the unbalanced effect of prediction variable .
a variable drop-off loop function , based on the concept of early termination for reduction of model capacity , regularization , and generalization control , was tested .

a susceptibility index for airborne particulate matter of less than 10 μm diameter ( PM10 ) was modeled using monthly maximum value and spectral band and indice from Landsat 8 imagery , and Open Street Maps were used to prepare a range of independent variable .
probability and classification index map were prepared using extreme-gradient boosting ( XGBOOST ) and random forest ( RF ) algorithms .

these were assessed against utility criterion such as a confusion matrix of overall accuracy , quantity of variable , processing delay , degree of overfitting , importance distribution , and area under the receiver operating characteristic curve ( ROC ) .
graphical abstract : [ Figure not available : see fulltext . ]
intelligent control system in urban planning conflict : Social media user ’ perception .
the relevance of this study is determined by the need to develop technology for effective urban system management and resolution of urban planning conflict .
the paper presents an algorithm for analyzing urban planning conflict .

the material for the study was data from social network , microblogging , blog , instant messaging , forum , review , video hosting service , thematic portal , online media , print media and TV related to the construction of the North-Eastern Chord ( NEC ) in Moscow ( RF ) .
to analyze the content of social media , a multimodal approach was used .

the paper presents the result of research on the development of method and approach for constructing mathematical and neural network model for analyzing the social media user ’ perception based on their digital footprint .
artificial neural network , differential equation , and mathematical statistic were involved in building the model .
differential equation of dynamic system were based on observation enabled by machine learning .
mathematical model were developed to quickly detect , prevent , and address conflict in urban planning in order to manage urban system efficiently .

in combination with mathematical and neural network model the developed approach , made it possible to draw a conclusion about the tense situation around the construction of the NEC , identify complaint of resident to constructor and city authority , and propose recommendation to resolve and prevent conflict .
research data could be of use in solving similar problem in sociology , ecology , and economic .
neural Network Based Algorithm for Multi-UAV Coverage Path Planning .
this paper proposes a method to tackle the Coverage Path Planning ( CPP ) problem for a fleet of AI-driven UAVs while accounting for congestion , collision avoidance , and efficiency of the path .
the algorithm relie on a mixed-use of decentralized Artificial Neural Networks ( ANN ) and the A pathfinder .
each UAV has elementary cognitive skill to sense information about the nearby environment which are then fed as an input to the network .
the neural network creates a correlation between the current state of a UAV and the best action to take at each time step .

the exploration strategy is stored in a labeled database for the single-UAV case ; the neural network learn and replicates it in the multi-UAV case , being able to generalize the acquired skill over new map not contained in the database .
the training session imitates human prior in a multi-class classification , which completely bypasses common drawback such as the need for large database or high computational resource .
the case study focuses on complex urban area , for which the grid resolution of the traditional approach ca n't model the problem with sufficient accuracy .
learning with self-attention for rental market spatial dynamic in the Atlanta metropolitan area .
the rental housing market plays a critical role in the United States real estate market .
prior study have used various approach to model housing rent , such as interpolation , hedonic modeling , and machine learning .
however , only a few study have modeled rental price based on textual data , which provides rich and contextual information about rental property .
in addition , many model , especially deep learning model , use an end-to-end black box for prediction , which hides the decision process .
such model are difficult to interpret and explain the driving factor .
this study builds on our previous work , aiming to develop and evaluate rental market spatial dynamic model combining Long Short-Term Memory ( LSTM ) network and self-attention mechanism .
we compare the performance of the proposed model with our previous model on predicting rental price in Atlanta , Georgia , USA .
we also use technique from saliency map to explain the generated model .
result show that the self-attention-based model outperforms our previous model .
the saliency map technique reveal how the model attends to a different part of the textual information .
the predicted result reflect the spatial variation of textual information .
such a model offers practical pricing reference for homeowner and renter , and spatial pattern for urban planner and stakeholder .
predictive model using “ cheap and easy ” field measurement : Can they fill a gap in planning , monitoring , and implementing fecal sludge management solution ?
the characteristic of fecal sludge delivered to treatment plant are highly variable .
adapting treatment process operation accordingly is challenging due to a lack of analytical capacity for characterization and monitoring at many treatment plant .
cost-efficient and simple field measurement such as photographs and probe reading could be proxy for process control parameter that normally require laboratory analysis .
to investigate this , we evaluated questionnaire data , expert assessment , and simple analytical measurement for fecal sludge collected from 421 onsite containment .
this data served as input to model of varying complexity .

random forest and linear regression model were able to predict physical-chemical characteristic including total solid ( TS ) and ammonium ( NH4+-N ) concentration , and solid-liquid separation performance including settling efficiency and filtration time ( R2 from 0.51-0.66 ) based on image analysis of photographs ( sludge color , supernatant color , and texture ) and probe reading ( conductivity ( EC ) and pH ) .
supernatant color was the best predictor of settling efficiency and filtration time , EC was the best predictor of NH4+-N , and texture was the best predictor of TS .
predictive model have the potential to be applied for real-time monitoring and process control if a database of measurement is developed and model are validated in other city .
simple decision tree model based on the single classifier of containment type can also be used to make prediction about citywide planning , where a lower degree of accuracy is required .
local and application-specific geodemographic for data-led urban decision making .
this work seeks to introduce improvement to the traditional variable selection procedure employed in the development of geodemographic classification .
it presents a proposal for shifting from a traditional approach for generating general-purpose one-size-fits-all geodemographic classification to application-specific classification .

this proposal addresses the recent scepticism towards the utility of general-purpose application by employing supervised machine learning technique in order to identify contextually relevant input variable from which to develop geodemographic classification with increased discriminatory power .

a framework introducing such technique in the variable selection phase of geodemographic classification development is presented via a practical use-case that is focused on generating a geodemographic classification with an increased capacity for discriminating the propensity for Library use in the UK city of Leeds .

two local classification are generated for the city , one a general-purpose classification , and the other , an application-specific classification incorporating supervised Feature Selection method in the selection of input variable .

the discriminatory power of each classification is evaluated and compared , with the result successfully demonstrating the capacity for the application-specific approach to generate a more contextually relevant result , and thus underpin increasingly targeted public policy decision making , particularly in the context of urban planning .
a machine learning approach to the simulation of intercity corporate network in mainland China .
this paper explores the potential of machine learning algorithms ( MLAs ) for the simulation of intercity network .
to this end , we implement the random forest MLA to simulate the intercity corporate network created by Fortune China 500 firm in mainland China .
the random forest MLA does not require a predefined model but detect patterns directly from the data to automatically build model .
the city-dyad connectivitie were computed using an interlocking network model and treated as target variable .
city factor and geographical factor were treated as feature .
the model was trained using a 2010 training set and subsequently validated using 2010 and 2017 test set .
the result are promising , with the pseudo R2 of the model coupled with different test data ranging from 0.861 to 0.940 .
nonetheless , the random forest MLA also faces some challenge in the context of the simulation of intercity network .

we conclude that MLAs are potentially useful for specific application such as the analysis of network big data , scenario simulation in regional planning , and the detection of driving force in exploratory research .
review of machine learning technique for mosquito control in urban environment .
machine learning ( ML ) techniques excel at forecasting , clustering , and classification task , making them valuable for various aspect of mosquito control .
in this literature review , we selected 120 paper relevant to the current state of ML for mosquito control in urban setting .
the reviewed work covers several different methodology , objective , and evaluation criterion from various environmental contexts .
we first divided the existing paper into geospatial , visual , or audio category .
for each category , we analyzed the machine learning pipeline , from dataset creation to model performance .
we conclude with a discussion of the challenge and opportunity for further research .

while the reviewed ML method in mosquito control are promising , we recommend a ) increased use of crowdsourced and citizen science data , b ) a standardized and open ML pipeline for reproducible result , and c ) research that incorporates advance in ML .
with these suggestion , ML technique could lead to effective mosquito control in urban environment .
4d building reconstruction with machine learning and historical map .
the increasing importance of three-dimensional ( 3D ) city modelling is linked to these data ’ s different application and advantage in many domain .
image and Light Detection and Ranging ( LiDAR ) data availability are now an evident and unavoidable prerequisite , not always verified for past scenario .
indeed , historical map are often the only source of information when dealing with historical scenario or multi-temporal ( 4D ) digital representation .
the paper presents a methodology to derive 4D building model in the level of detail 1 ( LoD1 ) , inferring missing height information through machine learning technique .
the aim is to realise 4D LoD1 building for geospatial analysis and visualisation , valorising historical data , and urban study .
several machine learning regression technique are analysed and employed for deriving missing height data from digitised multi-temporal map .
the implemented method relie on geometric , neighbour , and categorical attribute for height prediction .
derived elevation data are then used for 4D building reconstruction , offering multitemporal version of the considered urban scenario .
various evaluation metric are also presented for tackling the common issue of lack of ground-truth information within historical data .
machine Learning Predictors for Sustainable Urban Planning .
while essential for economic reason , rapid urbanization has had many negative impact on the environment and the social wellbeing of humanity .
heavy traffic , unexpected geohazard are some of the effect of uncontrollable development .

this situation points its fingerto urban planning and design ; there are numerous automation tool to help urban planner assess and forecast , yet unplanned development still occurs , impeding sustainability .
automation tool use machine learning classification model to analyze spatial data and various trend view before planning a new urban development .

although there are many sophisticated tool and massive dataset , big city with colossal migration still witness traffic jam , pollution , and environmental degradation affecting urban dweller ’ quality .
this study will analyze the current predictor in urban planning machine learning model and identify the suitable predictor to support sustainable urban planning .
a correct set of predictor could improve the efficiency of the urban development classification model and help urban planner to enhance the quality of life in big city .
visual Analytics of Urban Informality and Infrastructure Planning with Tableau for Sustainable Urban Design Research Strategies in Lagos Metropolis .
urban informality and infrastructure planning ( UIIP ) are global phenomena .
study in urban informality are nearing 50 year with diverse research strategy to resolve the threat of infrastructure availability and quality to urban development .

information technology and artificial intelligence in humanitie , social science and environmental science research are described as the current paradigm shift for contextualising and resolving complex urban challenge such as UIIP .
this study assessed urban development factor with visual analytic technique to understand the issue of UIIP for sustainable urban design research strategy in Lagos metropolis .
it adopts case study method with triangulation technique , mixed method of data collection with SPSS and Tableau software for visual presentation analysis .

the finding revealed the descriptive statistical relationship between socioeconomic , environmental , and infrastructural factor of sustainable urban development toward UIIP in Lagos metropolis and suggests an inclusive research design strategy with integrated urban design research strategy .
planning Support Systems for Long-Term Climate Resilience : A Critical Review .
as climate change is becoming a reality , there is an increasing demand to improve urban resilience .
planning Support Systems ( PSS ) enable climate-informed planning .
however , previous research confirms difficulty in the uptake of PSS due to their resource-intensive nature and lack of awareness of their usefulness .
this chapter aims to make a headway in understanding research priority and gap that need to be addressed for PSS to address climate resilience in the long run .

to this end , we review the emerging body of knowledge in academia and practice , by conducting a text-mining analysis of academic ( n = 36,405 ) and non-academic ( practice ) ( n = 86 ) literature on urban planning and climate resilience .
we extract trend on climate pressure , infrastructure driver , and planning response .
a key finding from academic literature is that long-term planning continues to be limited to a few fixed scenario and places a strong focus on single sector strategy .
practice document continue to be designed to inform high-level policy , but not spatial plan that require integrated thinking .

our analysis concludes with a research agenda for improving PSS to ( 1 ) identify and integrate the full range of variable in the long-term ; ( 2 ) support selection of appropriate planning response across multiple infrastructure system ; and ( 3 ) improve flexibility in planning by a deeper understanding of temporal aspect such as planning timeframe .
frontier topic in italian regional science in its fortie : The increasing role of heterogeneity in theory , policy and planning .
this paper introduces the second volume of the special issue edited to celebrate the 40th Anniversary of AISRe .

it presents different contribution ranging from the analysis of knowledge spillover , the use of microdata in the spatial context , the application of machine learning tool for regional policy evaluation study , the assessment of smart specialization and inner area strategy , the role of the evolutionary approach in regional planning and that of urban planning instrument in land rent measurement .
the common denominator of the different essay may be found in the increasing diffusion of approach dealing with heterogeneity of firm , geographical space and territory in modern regional science .
development of a novel hybrid multi-boosting neural network model for spatial prediction of urban flood .
in this study , a new hybridized machine learning algorithm for urban flood susceptibility mapping , named MultiB-MLPNN , was developed using a multi-boosting technique and MLPNN .
the model was tested in Amol City , Iran , a data-scarce city in an ungauged area which is prone to severe flood inundation event and currently lacks flood prevention infrastructure .
performance of the hybridized model was compared with that of a standalone MLPNN model , random forest and boosted regression tree .
area under the curve , efficiency , true skill statistic , Matthews correlation coefficient , misclassification rate , sensitivity and specificity were used to evaluate model performance .
in validation , the MultiB-MLPNN model showed the best predictive performance .
the hybridized MultiB-MLPNN model is thus useful for generating realistic flood susceptibility map for data-scarce urban area .

the map can be used to develop risk-reduction measure to protect urban area from devastating flood , particularly where available data are insufficient to support physically based hydrological or hydraulic model .
published by Informa UK Limited , trading as Taylor & Francis Group .
toward Participatory Design of City Soundscapes .
sonic environment of fast-growing urban area are an integral part of the quality of our everyday living in city .
due to the individual nature of the sonic experience , collecting and analyzing such experience need method for gathering accurate and useful data about them .
this paper describes how to incorporate the concept of soundscape into city planning process .
to achieve this , we propose creating participatory method for gathering data from the citizen so that the data would be useful and relevant for the city planning professional .

since the participatory planning process aim at in evolving the citizen , we suggest method that utilize crowdsourcing , mobile technology and machine learning for presenting , workshopping , and designing soundscape in the city context .
method and Guideline for Incorporating Human Factors Requirements in Automated Vehicles Development .
automated vehicle ( AV ) are transforming the future of the transportation and improving the quality of life .
however , due to their societal impact in urban environment , AV development challenges the current development process .
particularly , it is unclear how human factor requirement can be communicated to developer of AI-based AV .
it is quite challenging especially in agile development , where the focus is on continuous deployment and rapid release cycle with short lead-Time .

due to the importance of human factor and its impact on trust , acceptance , and safety of AV in urban environment , my work aim at providing a suitable requirement engineering perspective and method .
measuring sustainability and urban data operationalization : An integrated computational framework to evaluate and interpret the performance of the urban form .
with rapid urbanization , the necessity for sustainable development has skyrocketed , and sustainable urban development is a must .
recent advance in computing performance of urban layout in real-time allow for new paradigms of performance-driven design .
as beneficial as utilizing multiple layer of urban data may be , it can also create a challenge in interpreting and operationalizing data .

this paper presents an integrated computational framework to measure sustainability , operationalize and interpret the urban form 's performance data using generative design method , novel performance simulation , and machine learning prediction .

the performance data is clustered into three pillar of sustainability : social , environmental , and economical , and it is followed with the performance space exploration , which assists in extracting knowledge and actionable rule of thumb .
a significant advantage of the framework is that it can be used as a discussion table in participatory planning processes since it could be easily adapted to interactive environment .
virtual design of urban planning based on GIS big data and machine learning .

in order to build a virtual urban planning model and improve the effect of urban planning , this paper builds a virtual urban planning design model based on GIS big data technology and machine learning algorithms , and proposes a solution that combines multiple feature .

with the development of polarized SAR in the direction of high resolution , a single feature often can not fully express the detailed information of ground object , resulting in poor classification result and low accuracy .
the combination of multiple feature can express feature information well .

in addition , this paper uses the ELM method to plan SAR ground object classification , uses an extreme learning machine classification algorithm with fast learning speed and good classification effect , and uses ELM as a classifier .
finally , this paper designs experiment to explore the performance of the model constructed in this paper from two aspect : detection accuracy and planning score .
the research result show that the model constructed in this paper meets the expected goal .
modeling Urban Future : Data-Driven Scenario of Climate Change and Vulnerability in Cities .
city are complex system where social , ecological , and technological process are deeply coupled .
this coupling complicate urban planning and land use development , as changing one facet of the urban fabric will likely impact the other .
as city grapple with climate change , there is a growing need to envision urban future that not only address more frequent and intense severe weather event but also improve day-to-day livability .
here we examine climate risk as function of the local land use with numerical model .
these model leverage a wide array of data source , from satellite imagery to tax assessment and land cover .
we then present a machine-learning cellular automata approach to combine historical land use change with local coproduced urban future scenario .

the cellular automata model uses historical and ancillary data like existing road system and natural feature to develop a set of probabilistic land use change rule , which are then modified according to stakeholder priority .
the resulting land use scenario are evaluated against historical flood hazard , showcasing how they perform against stakeholder expectation .

our work shows that coproduced scenario , when grounded with historical and emerging data , can provide path that increase resilience to weather hazard as well as enhancing ecosystem service provided to citizen .

avi 2020 Workshop on Road Mapping Infrastructures for Artificial Intelligence Supporting Advanced Visual Big Data Analysis , AVI-BDA 2020 and 2nd Italian Workshop on Visualization and Visual Analytics , ITAVIS 2020 .
the proceeding contain 14 paper .
the special focus in this conference is on Road Mapping Infrastructures for Artificial Intelligence Supporting Advanced Visual Big Data Analysis .

the topic include : An Experience on Cooperative Development of Interactive Visualizations for the Analysis of Urban Data ; Explaining AI Through Critical Reflection Artifacts : On the Role of Communication Design Within XAI ; Information Visualization and Visual Analytics at IVU Lab ; visual Analytic for Financial Crime Detection at the University of Perugia ; a Visual Analytics Technique to Compare the Performance of Predictive Models ; affective Analytics and Visualization for Ensemble Event-Driven Stock Market Forecasting ; understanding the Role of ( Advanced ) Machine Learning in Metagenomic Workflows ; intelligent Advanced User Interfaces for Monitoring Mental Health Wellbeing ; Towards Explainable Artificial Intelligence and Explanation User Interfaces to Open the ‘ Black Box ’ of Automated ECG Interpretation ; recognition and Visualization of Facial Expression and Emotion in Healthcare ; machine Learning in Healthcare : Breast Cancer and Diabetes Cases ; AI2VIS4BigData : Qualitative Evaluation of an AI-Based Big Data Analysis and Visualization Reference Model .
from PIace2Vec to Multi-Scale Built-Environment Representation : A General-Purpose Distributional Embedding for Urban Data Analysis .
built environment like city , Road , community are rich source of urban data .

many downstream application require comprehensive analysis like geographic information retrieval , recommender system , geographic knowledge graphs , and in general , understanding urban space [ 28 ] .

point of Interest ( POI ) , as one of the most researched aspect of urban data , has been successfully modeled using concept borrowed from Machine Learning ( ML ) and Natural Language Processing ( NLP ) .
in the work of Place2Vec [ 28 ] , a Word2Vec-like statistical model is proposed to represent spatial adjacency with a continuous embedding space .
this method successfully model the functional semantic of POIs with regard to several human-assessment based evaluation .

however , though the Place2Vec model addresses the distributional heterogeneity within a given spatial context with ITDL augmentation , it does not address the spatial heterogeneity among different region .
to solve this problem , we propose to introduce a hierarchical , density-based , self-adjusting clustering mechanism .
the boundary of relatedness and unrelatedness is learned from the given context , where denser area have tighter bound while sparser area have looser one .
we train our model on both the baseline Yelp hierarchical dataset [ 28 ] and our OpenStreetMap dataset .

we demonstrate that 1 ) our model significantly improves the performance on 2 of the 3 baseline task and the stability of training , and 2 ) our model generalizes excellently across 112 city of radically different scale ( minimum 1725 POIs , maximum 2694070 POIs ) , region ( North America , Europe , Asia , Africa ) and type ( commercial , touristy , industrial , etc . )
without the need of adjusting or tuning any hyperparameter .

we also demonstrate that our model can be used to discover interesting fact about city like inter-city semantic analogy and intra-city connectivity , which can be very useful in urban planning , social computing and public policy making .

on the development of a novel approach for identifying perennial drainage in Southern Brazil : A study case integrating sentinel-2 and high-resolution digital elevation model with machine learning technique .

riparian vegetation plays a key role in maintaining water quality and preserving the ecosystem along riverine system , as they prevent soil erosion , retain water by increased infiltration , and act as a buffer zone between river and their surrounding .
within urban space , these area have also an important role in preventing illegal occupation in area of hydrologic risk , such as in floodplain .

the goal of this research is to propose a framework for identifying area of permanent protection associated with perennial drainage , utilizing satellite imagery and digital elevation model ( DEM ) in association with machine learning technique .

the specific objective include the development of a decision tree to retrieve perennial drainage over high resolution , 1-meter DEM 's , and the development of digital image processing workflow to retrieve surface water bodie from Sentinel-2 imagery .
in-situ information on perennial and ephemeral condition of stream and river were obtained to validate our result , that happened in the first trimester of 2020 .

we propose a minimum of 7 day without precipitation prior to in-situ validation , for more accurate assessment of streamflow condition , in order to minimize impact of surface water runoff in flow regime .

the proposed method will benefit decision maker by providing them with reliable information on drainage network and their buffer zone , as well as yield detailed mapping of the area of permanent protection that are key to urban planning and management .
a deep learning approach to urban street functionality prediction based on centrality measure and stacked denoising autoencoder .
in urban planning and transportation management , the centrality characteristic of urban Street are vital measure to consider .
centrality can help in understanding the structural property of dense traffic network that affect both human life and activity in city .
many city classify urban Street to provide stakeholder with a group of street guideline for possible new rehabilitation such as sidewalk , curb , and setback .
transportation research always considers street network as a connection between different urban area .
the street functionality classification defines the role of each element of the urban street network ( USN ) .
some potential factor such as land use mix , accessible service , design goal , and administrator ' policy can affect the movement pattern of urban traveler .
in this study , nine centrality measure are used to classify the urban Road in four city evaluating the structural importance of street segment .
in our work , a Stacked Denoising Autoencoder ( SDAE ) predicts a street 's functionality , then logistic regression is used as a classifier .

our proposed classifier can differentiate between four different class adopted from the U.S. Department of Transportation ( USDT ) : principal arterial road , minor arterial road , collector road , and local road .

the SDAE-based model showed that regular grid configuration with repeated pattern are more influential in forming the functionality of road network compared to those with less regularity in their spatial structure .
this article is an open access article distributed under the term and condition of the Creative Commons Attribution ( CC BY ) license ( http : //creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/ ) .
bistro : Berkeley Integrated System for Transportation Optimization .
the current trend toward urbanization and adoption of flexible and innovative mobility technology will have complex and difficult-to-predict effect on urban transportation system .
comprehensive methodological framework that account for the increasingly uncertain future state of the urban mobility landscape do not yet exist .
furthermore , few approach have enabled the massive ingestion of urban data in planning tool capable of offering the flexibility of scenario-based design .

this article introduces Berkeley Integrated System for Transportation Optimization ( BISTRO ) , a new open source transportation planning decision support system that uses an agent-based simulation and optimization approach to anticipate and develop adaptive plan for possible technological disruption and growth scenario .
the new framework was evaluated in the context of a machine learning competition hosted within Uber Technologies , Inc. , in which over 400 engineer and data scientist participated .
for the purpose of this competition , a benchmark model , based on the city of Sioux Falls , South Dakota , was adapted to the BISTRO framework .

an important finding of this study was that in spite of rigorous analysis and testing done prior to the competition , the two top-scoring team discovered an unbounded region of the search space , rendering the solution largely uninterpretable for the purpose of decision-support .
on the other hand , a follow-on study aimed to fix the objective function .

it served to demonstrate BISTRO 's utility as a human-in-the-loop cyberphysical system : one that uses scenario-based optimization algorithms as a feedback mechanism to assist urban planner with iteratively refining objective function and constraint specification on intervention strategy .
the portfolio of transportation intervention strategy alternative eventually chosen achieves high-level regional planning goal developed through participatory stakeholder engagement practice .
region2vec : An Approach for Urban Land Use Detection by Fusing multiple Feature .
with the advancement of urbanization , urban land use detection has become a research hotspot .
numerous method have been proposed to identify urban land use , in which point of interest ( POI ) data is widely used , and sometimes other data source like GPS trajectory is incorporated .

however , previous work have hardly fully utilized the global spatial information contained in the POI data , or ignored correlation between feature when integrating multiple data source , so resulting in information loss .
in this study , we propose an integrated framework titled Region2vec to detect urban land use type by combining POI and mobile phone data .
first , POI-based region embedding are generated by applying Glove model and LDA model to mine the global spatial information and land use topic distribution respectively .
the mobile phone data is utilized to generate human activity pattern-based embedding .
then a similarity matrix is constructed according to POI-based and activity pattern-based embedding .
finally , the similarity measure are regarded as clustering feature to extract the urban land use result .
experiment are implemented and compared with other urban land use algorithm based on data in Sanya , China .
the result demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed framework .
this research can provide effective information support for urban planning .
intelligent Unmanned Aerial Vehicle Technology in Urban Environments .
sustainable development of megacitie requires a transition to the new management method and technology , based on the wide use of a large amount of heterogeneous data .
managing the urban economy needs to consider environmental restriction , environmental monitoring task , engineering facility , and transport .

operational control over the urban environment and the surrounding area can be produced using unmanned aerial vehicle ( UAVs ) , and the collected data can be processed using a wide range of software and hardware technology related to the field of artificial intelligence .
however , along with any fairly new technology , intelligent unmanned technology have both advantage and disadvantage .

strength are mobility and efficiency , relative cheapness , the possibility of a high degree of automation , whereas weakness are short flight time , dependence on weather condition , the certain outstanding task of data management and processing .
this paper considers the possibility of using intelligent unmanned technology based on UAVs for solving the problem of monitoring the urban environment of the Kazakhstan megalopolise .

consideration is also being given to the scope for extending possibility of applying these technology to the field of environmental monitoring , monitoring of hazardous geological process , technical construction and vehicle .
furthermore , technological and economic issue , as well as necessary data processing technology , are discussed .
the economic effect of the use of IUVAT is estimated at $ 70-200 million , but it requires solving a set of data processing , control and technical problem .
ai application on LID stormwater management and urban planning in Guam , USA , and Southern China , PRC .
over the last decade , there has been a tremendous increase in the usage of AI technology for hydrological and hydraulic modelling on the application of water resource management .
in early model stage , AI method were used primarily for prediction and forecasting , utilizing quantitative data .

with SCADA and sensor application with internet of thing ( IOT ) , AI technology have increasingly been used for the incorporation of qualitative and subjective information into real time monitoring .

with rapid calculation of model result and decision support system ( the AI process ) , the drainage system can control hydrological device such as pump , valve , or gate to adjust or control the flow rate of a drainage system as well as urban drainage ability to model complex hydrological system in an integrated fashion .
there are three part to the AI application on blockchain water platform ( BWP ) .
from the upstream of BWP , sensor and meter will be able to collect hydrological data such as rain gauge , flowrate , pressure in pipe , and key indicator of water quality .
this information will input into hydrological and hydraulic modelling , many engineering modelling software have been used for predicting flow with the scenario analysis .
the engineer will be able to run the model 24/7 to collect data from the studying watershed .
with continuous updated result , they will be able to obtain real time monitoring .

finally , through the result from the modelling system , operation procedure , drainage analysis , and the decision support system ( DSS ) , control device such as pump , valve , and gate will have the ability to be controlled wirelessly .
the AI process will allow the urban stormwater drainage to optimize their operation and produce the most efficient result for urban drainage .
with this approach , AI will link the sensor data by internet of thing ( IOT ) into the model with model analysis .
the overall benefit of using AI storm water management include an increase of energy efficiency , a decrease in flood risk , and a decrease in cost .
the system is operating in both Guam , U.S. , and southern China , since spring 2018 .
urban street context classification using convolutional neural network and Street imagery .
the classification of Street on road network has been focused on the vehicular transportational feature of Street .
example of street label include arterial , major Road , minor Road and so forth based on their transportational use .
city authority on the other hand have been shifting to more wholistic planning of Street .
the modern approach toward designing and planning Street is more inclusive of the street context , meaning the side use of a street combined with the transportational feature of a street .
several city authority are developing new classification scheme for street context that extends traditional classification method to include the use of land on the side of a street .
in those classification scheme , Street are labeled for example as commercial throughway , residential neighborhood , park etc .
this modern approach to urban planning have been adopted by major city such as the city of San Francisco , the state of Florida and Pennsylvania among many other .
currently , the process of labeling Street according to their contexts is manual and hence is tedious and time consuming .
it will require manual labor to regularly relabel Street as the city develops .
in this paper , we propose an approach to deploy advancement in computer vision toward modern urban planning .
we propose a framework for automatic classification of street context .
using labeled street imagery we train deep convolutional neural network ( CNN ) to perform the classification of street context .
we show that CNN model can perform well achieving accuracy in the 81 % to 87 % range .
we test various CNN architecture and report on their performance .
quantitative relationship model of express service network and service facility in Beijing .
this paper intends to propose a quantitative relationship model in the layout between express service network and other life service facility .
through big data mining technology , we collected GPS location of express service point , residential area , grocery store and transportation station in Beijing .

then , using Multiple linear regression , SVM and random forest machine learning model the quantitative relationship between the number of express service point and other data in urban area , as well as the approach of model stacking get an integration machine learning model .
finally , the model and research idea of this paper provide decision-making basis for the rational construction and planning of logistic service network in first-tier city in China .
object Counting on Low Quality Images : A Case Study of Near Real-Time Traffic Monitoring .
the installation and management of traffic monitoring device can be costly from both a financial and human resource point of view .
it is therefore important to take advantage of available infrastructure to maximize the information extraction for each technology .
here we show how low-quality urban road traffic image from camera , already installed in many city such as Montreal , Vancouver and Toronto can be used as a non-intrusive traffic monitoring .
to this end , we use a pre-trained object detection neural network to count vehicle within image .
we then compare the result with human annotation gathered through crowdsourcing campaign .
we use this comparison to assess performance and calibrate the neural network annotation .
the performance of our system allows us to consider application which can monitor the traffic condition in near real-time , making the counting usable for traffic-related service .

furthermore , the resulting annotation pave the way for building a historical vehicle counting dataset to be used for analysing the impact of road traffic on many city-related issue such as urban planning , security , and pollution .
variational beauty of space : Machine intuition and non-linear neural aggregation .

spatial network have long been known for their internal spatial order or beauty ( Hillier , 2007 ) and in the field spatial computation and analytic we employ a number of graph based methodology in order to understand or extract intrinsic attribute of the urban fabric around us .
in this research we take a complete different approach by looking at urban structure through the use of deep convolutional variational autoencoder with interesting result .
autoencoder are an unsupervised learning technique in which we employ neural network for the task of representation learning .
specifically , a neural network architecture imposes a bottleneck in the network which forces a compressed and generalization of the knowledge representation of the structure of space .
this non-linear compression and subsequent reconstruction creates a unique set of feature that are inherent of urban space .

our network is multiple layer deep in order to be able to encode basic spatial complexity and is build based on a convolutional network architecture which is inspired by biological process similar to the connectivity pattern between neuron that resembles the organization of the animal visual cortex .
artificial neuron respond to real urban network of London in a restricted region of the visual field , which partially overlap such that they cover the entire convolutional visual field .
convolutional layer apply a convolution operation to the input , passing the result to the next layer .
each convolutional neuron processes data only for its receptive field but the cascading nature of our network build a knowledge of more complex spatial relation as data move deeper .
while convolutional neural network are extensively used in supervised image classification the work presented in this paper is completely unsupervised .

in this paper we present the complete architecture of the deep convolutional network that was trained for month using data from the city of London , concluding with two significant outcome extracted from the variational encoding and decoding process .
a non-linear clustering , or neural aggregation , of urban space based on the learned feature and a generative urban network output based on the variational synthesis we call machine intuition .
intelligence augmentation for urban warfare operation planning using deep reinforcement learning .
the density , diversity , connectedness and scale of urban environment make military operation challenging .
this paper shows that different artificial intelligence technique can be combined to provide the commander with various form of intelligence augmentation and to support the decision making process .

a warfare model has been developed where an AI system , representing a red unit , learns how to select the position for a target and for several improvised explosive device ( IEDs ) in order to prevent the blue unit to locate the target .
the blue unit is trained to reach the target by using deep reinforcement learning , while an evolutionary algorithm is used to train the red unit .
these technique do not rely on large amount of historical data .
different approach have been used and discussed to optimise the co-learning of the two agent , showing that optimal behaviour can be learned in an urban environment .

information about the most likely position of the target and the IEDs can be extracted from the policy learned by the system , and used by the commander to provide intelligence augmentation while planning an operation and evaluating different possible course of action .
the reliability of this information depends on the realism of the AI system simulating the red unit , that is strictly dependent on the model used for the blue unit during the training .
