new Impression of Beijing Hutong : A Microscale Urban Emotion Measurement Method .
urban emotion is a critical aspect for the human-centered city in the Smart City context .
as a general approach of public emotion , measuring happiness has is an active focus with great marketing potential since actually , it concerned prominently by the government in recent year .
different author have measured urban emotion in a variety of way .
prior spatial-oriented urban emotion measurement tool practice on the macroscale level for the nation and mesoscale level for community result in a lack of microscale level for the street .

this paper presents a spatial-oriented microscale measurement approach of urban emotion based on the Artificial Intelligence ( AI ) technology , which enables a data collection and visualization from human emotion recognition and object recognition technology .
by comparing the data visualization map , the gradual improvement of urban facility is one of the manifestation element of urban development , but emotion of citizen is mostly neutral .
these result attempt to reveal the structure and interpret a particular connection between urban emotion and facility .
in the sensor-rich future city , various data can be accumulated from the recognized data proposal and then transferred to contribute in a reference or feedback for the process of urban planning .
using particle swarm optimization method to optimize the carbon sequestration potential of agricultural afforestation in Beijing , China .
agricultural afforestation is an important way to mitigate climate change and improve the environmental quality of city system .
the major restriction of planning agricultural afforestation program and optimize the carbon sequestration potential of these program is the decrease of food productivity .
the spatial heterogeneity of both the food productivity and carbon sequestration potential further complicate this problem .
in this article , we demonstrate how the particle swarm optimization ( PSO ) method can be formulated and applied to address this problem .

based on the spatial estimation of food productivity and carbon sequestration potential , we formulated a PSO model to generate the optimal zoning of agricultural afforestation area and optimize the carbon sequestration potential with different scenario of food productivity decrease ratio in Beijing , China .
result show that our method can be used to optimize the carbon sequestration potential of agricultural afforestation under the restriction of decrease in food productivity .
with the application of our method , a significantly higher carbon sequestration potential can be achieved with a small loss of the current food productivity , e.g .
8.80-12.47 Tg C ( 14.82 - 20.93 % of the maximum carbon sequestration potential ) can be sequestrated with 5 % loss of current food productivity .
this research highlights the application of machine learning at the high level of smart city management to improve the efficacy and intelligence of urban planning .
public transportation accessibility : Toward sustainable transit oriented development ( Case study : Depok Baru Station - Jakarta , Indonesia ) .
pedestrian accessibility considered as an important factor in developing a Transit Oriented Development ( TOD ) concept to improve peri-urban development .
depok Baru Station is having a potential value to be expanded as a TOD area in order to support Jabodetabek urban planning .
this paper aims to figure up the pedestrian accessibility level in Depok Baru Station based on time by calculating the pedestrian walking time during transfer mode .

adopting Public Transportation Accessibility Levels ( PTAL ) method , this paper will measure accessibility index ( AI ) using the primary data from direct observation and secondary data from related data document .
research finding deliver accessibility index ( AI ) value from two mode namely commuter line and local public transport as the basic knowledge to be considered as a TOD component .
the technical and commercial increment of the fusion of big data analysis , artificial intelligence and earth observation .
earth observation is one of the most important application in downstream space activity .
it is widely used in environmental monitoring , urban planning , topographic mapping , agricultural census and disaster prevention .
however , traditional satellite remote sensing is subject to high cost and long data acquisition cycle , and it is difficult for user to get the data in time .

these problem result in insufficient data supply capacity of remote sensing satellite , which leads to difficulty in supporting daily business application and establishing a fast-growing business model business model .
the small satellite segment has seen rapid market growth and technological advancement since 2013 following the multiple successful launch , most notably the Planet , Spire and other .
economy of scale during production are one of the core advantage of the small satellite segment , thus allowing for significant cost reduction throughout their development and production cycle .
at the same time , big data analysis and the artificial intelligence ( AI ) industry are booming .
periodically full coverage data from small satellite provides a data source for data mining and periodic statistic for a wide range of target .
it provides huge opportunity and extension channel for the application of big data analysis and artificial intelligence ( AI ) in Earth observation ( EO ) .
the present paper describes research on the technical and commercial increment of the fusion of big data analysis , AI and EO .

in the first section of the paper , a literature review of the common downstream space activity along with identifying the limitation of Earth Observation in term of high cost and long data acquisition cycle is presented .
in the second section , the paper outlines a 4G case study to show that how the improvement of infrastructure brings new application scenario , vertical and consumer .
in the third section , the paper considers the possible new market opportunity of the 5G technology in the fusion of big data analysis , AI and EO .

finally , it concludes by proposing two prototype model in agriculture monitoring and disaster and emergency response , assesses the technical and commercial increment relative to the current business .
designing with citizen : Challenge and evaluation method for crowd-sourced urban layout .
this paper presents analysis tool for evaluating crowdsourced geometry-based design proposal for urban planning .
with the Quick Urban Analysis Kit , an online platform , citizen are able to manipulate object and create a preferred layout over a case study area .
given that our case study is on a meso-cale , our analysis is focused on the layout and plot configuration .
the proposed analysis tool range from simple counting of object type and a buffer analysis to clustering and spatial autocorrelation tool .
besides these form-based criterion , perception-based criterion are also proposed to link the participating subject 's assessment of the design with the layout .
technique deployed include supervised machine learning method , statistical spatial test , and simple calculation of the area size and frequency of object .
localization Decision of Entrepreneur : The Role of Path Dependency and Market Forces .
the purpose of this research is to determine the role of path dependency and market force in the localization decision of entrepreneur from different industry .
we hypothesize that most industry develop new entity based on the number of companie from the same industry that already exist in a region .
we also hypothesize that entrepreneur create new entity based on related industry operating within the same knowledge pool .
to test these hypothesis , we used the machine learning decision tree method .
the input variable are the number of companie from 86 industry located in 2,531 community in Poland in 2009 .
the target value are the number of new companie from these industry created in the year 2009-2015 .
the principal result show that localization decision are mostly based on demand and supply industry , in which manufacturing industry play crucial role .
path dependency appears in less than half of the industry ' model and thus is not the main factor influencing decision regarding the creation of new companie .
the highest share of path-dependent industry is in manufacturing sector , but the degree of the dependence is lower than in the service sector .
the service sector seems to be the least path-dependent , as service usually serve other industry .
competition in industry is a rare factor in new company creation ; however , if it appears , it usually shrinks the industry .
multi-scale modeling of territorial dynamic of geospatial anthropogenic energy consumption .
objective : The development of any region or territory stems from its own dynamic nature .
distribution and consumption of energy resource are varied territorially which in turn is ruled by the number of anthropogenic activity in association with geospatial localization .
such territorial dynamic necessitate considerable modification of the energy infrastructure .

thus , the development of a computational multi-scale unified energy consumption model with the usage of geographic information helps in automating data analysis processes for sustainable urban planning , allocation of energy-saving infrastructure , and strategic deployment of the renewable energy resource to finely regulate the utilization of energy resource for sustainable energy consumption .
method : The integration of city-wide energy system model and geographic information system ( GIS ) is still in its infancy .
the research work is divided into five interrelated work package .
the Modelling problem is achieved with the help of analytical hierarchical process .

thus , we propose a computational infrastructure for modelling city-wide geospatial energy consumption and automating the data analysis process to provide the sustainable environmental policy , which requires artificial intelligence-based geospatial aware comprehensive planning , regarding the modification of the energy supply , consumption , activity , and infrastructure in city .

result and Discussion : Thus , end result of the presented research work is fine-grained energy demand estimation from data source , decentralized storage facility , and automated sustainable planning ; investigation of GIS-based anthropogenic activity or mobility pattern influencing the wastage of energy resource , the transition from purely structural to operational planning , and , finally , the development of a new dynamic-based power market design .
the syntactic signature of starbuck ' location Towards a machine-learning approach to location decision-making .

the space syntax Theory of Natural Movement postulates that everything else being equal , land use selects their location based on the asymmetry of accessibility created by the configuration of the street network .
in this article , I test the hypothesis whether configurational ( syntactic ) property of an urban street network are relevant for the location of land use .
if syntactic feature are relevant , then land use type may have a 'syntactic signature ' .
to identify this blueprint , I apply machine-learning technique to dataset of syntactic measure , for ten business type .
the result are ten model , each with the syntactic blueprint of a type of business .
the model are used to predict the existence , or not , of such business in segment of the map of London .
the performance of the model varie , with fifty per cent reaching statistical significance , including one with 'good ' prediction ability .
the model for Starbucks coffee shop and solicitor 's office have the strongest prediction ability .

the exploratory exercise demonstrates the potential of the machine-learning method Random Forests , when supervised and individually applied to a business activity , to identify the syntactic signature of business type .
such model can be used during planning and design and on location study .
the result strengthen the candidacy of syntactic measurement to location-decision-making .
moreover , they reinforce the theory of Natural Movement .
feature selection and knowledge extraction from buppu 2000 and 2010 census using artificial intelligence .
the census of population and dwelling undertaken by national state institution world over at regular time interval , is a fantastic source of information .
however , there are major challenge to overcome when transforming the census data that usually consists of a vast number of attribute , into useful knowledge .
in this paper , an artificial intelligent approach is investigated to select appropriate attribute feature that indicate interesting pattern in Beppu census ward in 2000 and 2010 .

the result of the SOM ( unsupervised artificial neural network ) based clustering , GIS visualisation and machine learning ( J48 and JRip function of WEKA ) , provide relevant discerning feature , new pattern and new knowledge that can be of use in many application domain , such as urban planning , resource management and transport planning .
study on traditional architectural feature of JIN-ai under the influence of silk road commerce .
the Silk Road is the green commercial thoroughfare between Europe and Asia , and also a cultural front for confrontation as well as coordination between the western and eastern civilization .
the ancient business Town along the Silk Road are like star shining in the great universe .
yuzhong County of Lanzhou City is a market town .
since Han , it began to undertake commercial supply , cargo transit , postal transfer and many other important role in history .
rich in cultural heritage , Jin-ai has formed its traditional architecture and its culture of distinct regional characteristic .

this article is based on field research and concerned with how Jin-ai 's traditional building , adapting farming , commerce , patriarchal relation , reflect its morphology , external space , layout and spatial scale , as well as its traditional cultural characteristic .
understanding townscape through AI approach to the study of human living in space .
spatial environment have been studied by many scholar in different discipline , and the present study aim at contributing to the broader discussion from an urban-planning view .

indoor and outdoor townscape , because of their dynamic complexity , seem to offer ill-structured holds to the typical spatial behaviour of an agent , particularly when spatial behaviours is analyzed in mainstream AI robotic .
therefore , a question arises about the 'fundamental ' of spacescape from the point of view of the need of living agent , having to live in and move through them in resilient and intelligent way .
in this context , the subject of the present paper is the diagnosis and the control of a structured simple space , geometrically intended as the minimum arc of a graph .

condition , situation , element , behaviour are explored and partially analyzed in their spatial-temporal dimension , subsequently aiming at setting up a system architecture to let spatial agent control their de-structuring impact .

the research makes use of text analysis and interpretation , both applied to an in-class questionnaire survey , exploring low level ( movement orientation ) and high level ( memory and fantasy ) behaviours in human interaction with a space .

the experiment is developed by relying on a large class of student from the Technical University of Bari , daily using a long and apparently amorphous corridor to reach lecturer ' office for advice , exam and explanation .
developing methodology of knowledge discovery and data mining to investigate metropolitan land use evolution .
in the urban/territorial planning process , the quality of the evaluation procedure is crucial .

it is necessary to select and implement innovative tool able to handle the huge amount of available data concerning territorial system in order to extract useful information from them to enhance the quality of evaluation procedure for urban/territorial planning .

this paper selects some tool derived from Artificial Intelligence , and incorporated GIS through the elaboration of various type of available data , to extract and build knowledge directly from experimental data and also to represent the extracted knowledge very effectively and communicatively , in the form of set of spatial transformation rule .

it describes the structure of the data mining tool which are most suitable for application in the field of urban planning , aimed at discovering the transformation rule driving the evolution of city in special of metropolitan in analysis .
achieving high irrigation efficiency in public garden : A case study from the RBG Melbourne , Melbourne , Australia .
the development of a centrally controlled Automatic Irrigation System ( AIS ) from the case study the Royal Botanic Gardens Melbourne ( RBG Melbourne ) is discussed .
the RBG Melbourne covers about 35 hectare and is characterized by mature tree , broad expanse of lawn and detailed garden bed .
ais supply water to about 15 ha and 11 ha of garden-a total of 26 ha .
the interception of the sprinkler stream by foliage , branch , and trunk of plant has a pernicious effect on irrigation uniformity .
location , design , and operation of accident investigation site in urban freeway corridor .
in this paper , current recommendation for locating , designing , and operating Accident Investigation Sites ( AISs ) in urban freeway corridor are summarized .
the recommendation are based on ( a ) interview with freeway corridor traffic management team in Texas and ( b ) experience of the author .
the guideline can be summarized as follows : The AIS location must be easily accessible from the freeway .
the most desirable location is within one block of the freeway exit ramp terminal .
local police should be involved in locating and esigning AISs .
an AIS should be paved , illuminated , have a minimum of 1,000 ft2 , and be equipped with some form of telephone communication system .
it is better to install AISs as part of a citywide freeway incident management program involving traffic engineer and law enforcement personnel .
artificial intelligence solution for urban land dynamic : A review .
artificial intelligence ( AI ) system are widely accepted as a technology offering an alternative way to tackle complex and dynamic problem in urban study .
the goal of this article is a review of current literature in the field of planning and AI .

the aim of this review is to increase the understanding of how AI approaches urban and land dynamic modeling process and how , as a result , researcher can structure that knowledge and choose the correct approaches to embed in their model .
for this purpose , the author review the application of AI technique in urban land dynamic domain as well as the emerging challenge they face .
the author discuss hybrid AI system as a need resulting from the trend in planning policy to develop more holistic approach .
the author conclude that , although challenge exist , AI-based approach offer promising solution for urban and land dynamic .
artificial intelligence technology for robot assisted urban search and rescue .

structural collapse disaster routinely inspire sympathy not only for victim and their family , but also for heroic rescue personnel who are faced with a tremendously complex , hazardous and often frustrating task environment .

military operation and rescue activity in the aftermath of recent earthquake and bombing indicate a tremendous need for greater access to denied area within any crisis site involving collapsed structure .
recent development in the remote inspection industry show great potential for employment of small robotic micro-rover system in expanded role for Urban Search and Rescue .

this paper discusses key issue in the application of robotic system to Urban Search and Rescue ( USAR ) activity and discusse ongoing development of a knowledge-based system for efficient management of automated search asset .
usar modeling and `` micro-bot '' employment advantage are addressed first , followed by a discussion of numerical method shortcoming in the context of search asset allocation .

knobsar is then proposed as an initial expert system prototype designed to interact with various structural collapse simulation package and provide advice on search asset allocation to specific entry point within a crisis site .
knobsar structure and design is then illustrated in term of micro-bot allocation scenario to various collapsed structure entry point .

the conclusion drawn from literature review , experimentation and personal experience is that AI technology in the form of robotic platform and decision support tool can have a tremendous impact on overall search efficiency for the USAR community , and represent an important field of study for related military application .
can expert system help with planning ?
the study of urban information system has focused primarily on devising an effective way to integrate data from various source to provide the necessary information for decision making .
recent advance in artificial intelligence ( AI ) technology have raised interest in how existing urban information system might benefit from AI .
artificial intelligence does not solve urban planning problem by itself .
rather , it is a newly emerging and promising technology that can be integrated into existing information system to provide more intelligent and effective solution to urban problem .
we conclude that application of expert system to urban planning are not only desirable but also a means of overcoming the limitation found in current computer-based approach to problem solving .
by integrating the technique of expert system into existing computer-based system , planner will be able to develop more intelligent information system for supporting their various task .
investigation of the likelihood of green infrastructure ( GI ) enhancement along linear waterway or on derelict site ( DS ) using machine learning .

study evaluating the potential for green infrastructure ( GI ) development using traditional Boolean logic-based multi-criteria analysis method are not capable of predicting future GI development in dynamic urbanscape .

this study evaluated both artificial neural network ( ANN ) and adaptive , network-based fuzzy inference system ( ANFIS ) algorithms in conjunction with statistical modelling to predict green or grey transformation likelihood for derelict site ( DS ) and vacant site along waterway corridor ( WWC ) in Manchester based on ecological , environmental , and social criterion .
the soft-computing algorithms had better predictive capacity at 72 % accuracy versus the 65 % of logistic model .
site size , population coverage , and air pollution were identified as the main influencer in the potential for site transformation .
in Manchester , the likelihood of GI transformation was higher for WWC than derelict site at 80 % versus 60 % likelihood , respectively .
furthermore , DS were more likely to transform into grey development based on current trend and urban planning practice .
the promise of expert system for urban planning .

in this Guest Editorial , we present a brief history of Expert Systems ( ES ) , showing how they have emerged from work in Artificial Intelligence ( AI ) which has paralleled the availability of massive computer memory made possible by the development of the microprocessor .

our main concern here , however , is to present a context for the paper which follow , and we attempt this by identifying the sort of planning problem to which expert system can be applied , emphasising characteristic such as the balance between qualitative and quantitative representation , the degree to which such problem are well- or ill-defined and the extent to which their structure can be modelled using the logic of relation and search which lie at the heart of all expert system .
we also point out certain key feature of the paper which comprise this special issue .
in particular , we examine the way in which some of the author use expert system to interface existing computer model , thus developing Decision Support Systems ( DSS ) .

and we also note the concern in these application for developing appropriate characterisation of the `` knowledge base '' and the `` inference engine '' through the generation of appropriate rule-based logic which suitably define the problem in question .
finally , we draw out some of the implication of this stream of research for more effective urban planning .
an AI application to integrated tourism planning .

integrated Tourism can be defined as the kind of tourism which is explicitly linked to the locality in which it takes place and , in practical term , has clear connection with local resource , activity , product , production and service industry , and a participatory local community .
in this paper we report our experience in applying Artificial Intelligence technique to Integrated Tourism planning in urban area .
in particular , we have modeled a domain ontology for Integrated Tourism and developed an Information Extraction tool for populating the ontology with data automatically retrieved from the Web .
also , we have defined several Semantic Web Services on top of the ontology and applied a Machine Learning tool to better adapt the automated composition of these service to user demand .
use case of the resulting service infrastructure are illustrated for the Apulia Region , Italy .
procedural lot generation for evolutionary urban layout optimization in urban regeneration decision support .
decision support in urban regeneration planning involve fulfilment of complex design objective that require a close collaboration between stakeholder , designer and planner .
the objective are to achieve computationally optimized design plan that are environmentally robust and sustainable .
for the purpose of pre-planning analysis and optimization of such design model , the construction framework of the whole system development life cycle is simulated using specialist analysis tool .
in the analysis and design phase of such a construction process , location allocation of built environment structure integrated with AI based urban assessment model remain a cumbersome task .
with the advent of sophisticated computing hardware and 3D modelling technique , it has become viable to visualize and develop simulation outcome with ease over standard computer .
however , creation of simulated outcome with huge urban detail still remains a daunting task .

with the advent of knowledge-based data standard and mining technique , possibility have arisen to integrate procedural urban modelling framework with socio-economic deprivation assessment system to create massive city model in order to improve sustainability and smart growth .

the implementation of a procedural modelling framework offers a promising area of research in location allocation optimization of residential and public service structure for urban regeneration planning and collaboration purpose but is still largely stochastic in nature until now .

the work presented in this article proposes an L-system-based automated urban layout generation module in addition to an evolutionary building placement optimization system for the purpose of urban regeneration decision support .

the location allocation optimization of a highly accessible pedestrian and street network grid still remains a complex process especially with neighbourhood suffering from severe socio-economic deprivation .

using an extension to ' L-systems ' , the module utilizes an 'mBPMOL ' system to recursively subdivide an urban regeneration layout and later encode the layout to a genetic chromosome to iteratively place a range of urban structure to the lot .

moving further , the system implements a distance-based socio-economic deprivation minimization fitness function and assesses subsequent individual genetic solution to search for an optimized layout .

the development of such an online procedural framework is a very first attempt to employ the capability of procedural automation with evolutionary computation to automatically generate and optimize the placement of a large number of building model .
the outcome achieved a set of relatively optimal solution with evaluation based upon a distance-based fitness objective function of various public service structure .
the solution ( layout plan ) thus obtained offered a number of moderate to highly accessible alternative .
development of such a system is meant to facilitate decision support and improve time efficiency among urban designer and planner .
comparison of ANN Classifier to the Neuro-Fuzzy System for Collusion Detection in the Tender Procedures of Road Construction Sector .

as the contract in the road construction sector in Poland are usually of extremely high value and financed from the state budget , the tender procedure should not allow for the non-concurrent behaviours of tender participant .
otherwise , the client ' loss will be of high value too .
a database comprising hundred of bidding procedure in the road construction industry in Poland has been developed .
it includes the tender 's participant , the location of the Road section , bid ' value , the winner , and the type of Road .
every procedure has been evaluated and assigned to the set with a given level of collusion occurrence probability .
the evaluation has required the analysis and the transformation of-described in the literature-collusive type of behaviours to the parameter of procedure that can be shown as number or rank .
four criterion of a collusion threatened contract have been chosen and applied for evaluation .
then , two method of machine learning were applied .
the first method was to train an artificial neural network ( ANN ) to classify the procedure to the aforementioned set .
the other method was to utilize artificial neural network predictive capability enriched by the fuzzy set theory .
the multiple output from ANN was defined as membership function value .
the use of the fuzzy set theory-the process of defuzzification-helps to classify the tender procedure to the set of different level of risk ( of collusion appearance ) .
the result achieved in these two separate process are compared and discussed .
the created tool can be applied for the future tender procedure as a pre-test of a collusion appearance .
an information system for judicial and public administration using artificial intelligence and geospatial data .
the adoption of information technology in judicial and public administration has become a major need nowaday with the rapid growth of information regarding managerial issue .

this paper presents an advanced methodology developed by using Information and Communication Technologies ( ICT ) and artificial intelligence to support decision making in public and judicial administration .

a prototype Management Information System for public administration ( MISPA ) was developed to provide a computerized way of managing geospatial urban , environmental and crime data of an urban area .
this system was developed by using several programming language , a Database Management System ( DBMS ) and other technology and programming tool .

the proposed system was developed aiming at the systemization and modernization of public , judicial and police authority that are associated with issue that have to be dealt by studying urban data regarding crime and environmental data and support decision making based on crime forecasting .
selecting artificial intelligence urban model using wave of complexity .
urban land use change is a complex and dynamic process .
it is therefore important to understand the complexity involved with system dynamic and choose appropriate modelling approach .
for this purpose , this paper firstly reviews how artificial intelligence ( AI ) approaches provide solution to aid urban land dynamic modelling .
the three dimension that are considered pivotal for the understanding of urban dynamic process - urban land dynamic , planning support and AI infrastructure - are defined .

once these three dimension are clarified , it is possible to propose the different solution space provided by AI approach using a graphic representation of a cube and its associated mathematical formulation .
it is therefore possible to understand and define the best data model to represent the complexity of different phenomenon in urban system .
balkanisation of urban planning .
the Maharashtra government does not seem to be serious about urban planning .
the development plan is a meaningless exercise in accordance with a law that is 50 year out of date .

the current situation is a balkanisation of urban planning with a host of different agency looking at land use and transportation planning along with policy intervention by department of the state and central government .
there is an urgent need for a central coordinator of urban plan even if the detailed work is done by different agency .
design of machine learning model for Urban planning and management improvement .
with the aid of artificial intelligence , this paper builds a machine learning model with the KNN algorithm to optimize the traditional method of urban planning and management ( UPM ) .
the optimization is realized through two step .
first , the relevant theory of the updated UPM of livelihood oriented UPM ( LOUPM ) are explored for the later machine learning architecture design .
people 's livelihood has a great influence on UPM .
livelihood orientation makes the complex UPM even more complicated due to diverse living need of citizen .

this paper analyzes the deeper relationship between the people 's livelihood and UPM , systematically study the function and connotation of the people 's livelihood behavior , and profoundly discusses current contradiction and restraining factor .
second , based on a better understanding of LOUPM , this paper further proposes an artificial intelligence approach to select most related factor to optimize UPM from database .
in the first paper of this series , in the analysis of the relevant UPM theory , three scope of LOUPM are concluded to be the evaluation of data set : authority , time , and space .
then , this paper continues to design a software model with the KNN algorithm to evaluate the urban plan and generates optimization advice for the user .
based on this research , it is possible to explore LOUPM .

in order to make every effort to seek way and method to meet the challenge of the LOUPM in the new period , and by introducing a creative computing approach of government management and social governance , this article can contribute to the growing demand of China 's urbanization process .
systematizing heterogeneous expert knowledge , scenario and goal via a goal-reasoning artificial intelligence agent for democratic urban land use planning .

the task of democratic urban land use planning , as subjective-objective combined decision-making effort that require considerable time and energy , have heretofore been accomplished mainly through deep human thought or by voting .

in this paper , we introduce a goal-reasoning artificial intelligence ( AI ) agent that can assist with these task by combining traditional scenario planning , multicriteria decision analysis ( MCDA ) with a novel goal-oriented Monte Carlo tree search ( G-MCTS ) method .
g-mct conduct goal-oriented search to meet the need of heterogeneous goal and provide the best land use solution .

we evaluated this method on a real-world planning case , and the result show that 1 ) the goal-reasoning AI agent is good at performing complex goal reasoning task with many heterogeneous expert knowledge ; 2 ) different human planning manuscript could be integrated into a better solution via a goal-reasoning AI agent ; and 3 ) the goal-reasoning AI agent has the potential to make comprehensive decision during a democratic political agenda .

we conclude that the goal-reasoning AI agent , via an improved reinforcement learning ( RL ) method of G-MCTS , provides vast potential for assisting in subjective-objective combined urban land use planning and many other similar Field by weighing heterogeneous goal , reproducing human inspiration , and acting as a reflexive sociotechnical system .
comparative review of method supporting decision-making in urban development and land management .
this paper discusses how and where technology supporting decision-making can play , or are already playing , a role in both urban development and land management .

the review analyzes and compares three type of technology : cellular automata ( CA ) , artificial intelligence ( AI ) , and operational research ( OR ) , and evaluates to which extent they can be useful when dealing with various land planning objective and phase .

ca is one of the most useful model for simulating urban growth , AI displays great potential as a solution to capture the dynamic of land change , and OR is useful in decision-making , for example to conduct locational analysis .
the evaluation relie on a collection of relevant article , selected on the basis of both content and actuality .
the paper offers new perspective toward innovative method in urban planning and land management and highlight where and when which type of tool can be considered useful and valid .
the existing gap , i.e.
, phases or area in spatial planning or land management where the method have not been applied , are also discussed .
ai Technologies in Green Architecture Field : Statistical Comparative Analysis .

the technique , theory and implementation of the green building issue are the standout amongst the most difficult in architectural design , where these technique are a piece of the design process in architecture , landscape , and urban planning .
there are various parameter which might be interrelated , negating , dubious and of subjective nature are widen to utilize .

this paper presents a comprehensive critical state of art survey of current practice taking into account Artificial Intelligence ( AI ) technique ( such as Fuzzy , ( AHP ) Analytical Hierarchy Process , ( GA ) Genetic Algorithms ) and their blend .
also , a comparative analysis of the strength and weakness of existing knowledge engineering AI tool based on different technique applied to the architecture problem are statistically discussed .

in addition , the paper exhibits how green architecture can be improved using the technology that been used for analysis to look for ideal green solution strategy to assist in making the best possible decision .
knowledge and reasoning in development control and urban design : an expert system approach .
expert system are computer program that use knowledge and expertise in a particular field to solve complex problem .
as such , they are a way of organising , formalising , and disseminating context-specific knowledge and problem-solving technique .

attempt to formalise planning and design method are reviewed and some parallel are proposed in the development of thought between one area of artificial intelligence ( AI ) research and planning theory .

in the final part of the paper there is a discussion of how an expert system approach , based on technique developed in the field of artificial intelligence , can be used to investigate the nature of knowledge and expertise in urban design and development control .

improving intelligent decision making in urban planning : Using machine learning algorithm .
generally , decision making in urban planning has progressively become difficult due to the uncertain , convoluted , and multi-criteria nature of urban issue .
even though there has been a growing interest to this domain , traditional decision support system are no longer able to effectively support the decision process .
this paper aims to elaborate an intelligent decision support system ( IDSS ) that provides relevant assistance to urban planner in urban project .
this research addresses the use of new technique that contribute to intelligent decision making : machine learning classifier , naïve Bayes classifier , and agglomerative clustering .
finally , a prototype is being developed to concretize the proposition .

the art of learnin .

david Wasserman states that with the help of artificial intelligence ( AI ) , planner can now evaluate the potential impact of a safety project in one week rather than having to wait for five year , or develop a sidewalk inventory across an entire county in a short period of time .

he describes how recent advance in AI and particularly its computer-vision subfield , promise to refocus planner ' effort on the work only professional can do and revolutionize the way we understand our community .
ai is the study of algorithm that can sense , reason , adapt , or otherwise simulate human intelligence .
it has had stop and start since the late 1950 , but everything changed in the early 2010s .
the field has experienced a transformation driven by improved hardware , the emergence of big data , and the widespread use of deep learning .

these advance enabled computer to learn by example , which has allowed them to do all sort of new task , from translating speech and increasing the pace of industrial automation to identifying cat picture on the internet .
urban Planning Reform Trend Based on Artificial Intelligence .
artificial intelligence ( AI ) will offer opportunity for comprehensive reform in the urban planning field , including thought , technology , method , and management .
it is inevitable that the urban planning reform throughout the urban planning management process will be optimized by the development and application of AI .
firstly , the development and evolution of AI and its stage feature are consolidated , and several technological breakthrough direction of AI are expounded .
subsequently , the interaction between AI and urban planning are analyzed .

meanwhile , based on the clarification of four basic feature ( uncertain , scientific , democratic and dynamic ) of urban planning reform , the problem of China 's urban planning reform in four aspect of information , technology , subject , and feedback are reviewed .

finally , from the four technical breakthrough direction , that is , big data intelligence , human-computer hybrid enhanced intelligence , Internet group intelligence , and cross-media intelligence , in the AI technology closely related to the above urban planning reform problem , optimization strategy are prosed for the urban planning reform in China .
application of AI in urban design .
due to the complexity of the urban environment , urban planner and designer need to simplify this complex system for the better understanding of the urban change .
the aim of this book is centralized on the use of novel method in recognizing urban phenomenon and the way to deal with them .
nowaday thank to the appearance of the AI technique this aim becomes feasible , up-to-date , and immediate .
therefore we try to introduce AI technique and their application on the process of urban planning and design by the aim of improving the quality of life within city .

a knowledge-based creation of mathematical programming for GIS problem solving .
nowadays the biggest challenge to GIS is the model design of theme analyzing .
many GIS application need more function in analysis and decision-making than in data organization or visualization .

while confronted with an application like planning a new metro line in a city , the typical GIS can not accomplish it by itself , unless some human expert or artificial intelligence technology are involved .
number of GIS application essentially are model of theme analyzing , and they are also example of problem solving in AI .
therefore many theory and technology from AI can be embedded in GIS to strengthen its ability of automatic analysis .
fortunately mathematical programming is a kind of powerful tool to settle problem with a demand of optimization under some constraint condition .
many GIS application happen to be this type , and some mathematical model can usually approximate them accurately .
two new question aroused .
the first is what objective function and constraint condition that constitute a mathematical programming should be , and the second is how to acquire those mathematical expression .
due to the establishment of a mathematical programming is highly knowledge-based , so an AI subsystem is designed to autonomously create a mathematical programming .

this problem has a typical characteristic of multiple domain crossing from perspective of Knowledge Engineering , so some novel knowledge-processing method , like knowledge dependence , knowledge transition and knowledge reference , are studied .
and a knowledge system represented by frame and a reference-based knowledge-using method are presented here .
15th International Conference on Database and Expert Systems Applications , DEXA 2004 .
the proceeding contain 92 paper .
the special focus in this conference is on Deductive DB Aspects , Applications and Multidimensional Indexing .

the topic include : Supporting contract execution through recommended workflow ; ensuring task dependency during workflow recovery ; web service based architecture for workflow management system ; feasibility condition and preference criterion in querying and repairing inconsistent database ; optimal deployment of trigger for detecting event ; a new approach for checking schema validation property ; on evolution of xml workflow schemata ; a framework for selecting workflow tool in the context of composite information system ; evaluation strategy for bitmap indice with binning ; on the automation of similarity information maintenance in flexible query answering system ; an efficient neighbor searching scheme of distributed collaborative filtering on p2p overlay network ; partially ordered preference applied to the site location problem in urban planning ; a flexible fuzzy expert system for fuzzy duplicate elimination in data cleaning ; an intelligent tool for database administration ; interacting with electronic institution ; growing node policy of a main memory index structure for moving object databases ; an enhanced cache conscious multi-dimensional index structure ; classification decision combination for text categorization ; information extraction via automatic pattern discovery in identified region ; an approach for automatically populating semantic web from unstructured text collection ; text categorization by a machine-learning-based term selection ; update conscious inverted indexe for xml query in relational database and a selective key-oriented xml index for the index selection problem in XDBMS .
partial least-square regression for linking land-cover pattern to soil erosion and sediment yield in watershed .
there are strong tie between land cover pattern and soil erosion and sediment yield in watershed .
the spatial configuration of land cover has recently become an important aspect of the study of geomorphological process related to erosion within watershed .
many study have used multivariate regression technique to explore the response of soil erosion and sediment yield to land cover pattern in watershed .

however , many landscape metric are highly correlated and may result in redundancy , which violates the assumption of a traditional least-squares approach , thus leading to singular solution or otherwise biased parameter estimate and confidence interval .

here , we investigated the landscape pattern within watershed in the Upper Du River watershed ( 8973km2 ) in China and examined how the spatial pattern of land cover are related to the soil erosion and sediment yield of watershed using hydrological modeling and partial least-square regression ( PLSR ) .
the result indicate that the watershed soil erosion and sediment yield are closely associated with the land cover pattern .

at the landscape level , landscape characteristic , such as Shannon 's diversity index ( SHDI ) , aggregation index ( AI ) , largest patch index ( LPI ) , contagion ( CONTAG ) , and patch cohesion index ( COHESION ) , were identified as the primary metric controlling the watershed soil erosion and sediment yield .
the landscape characteristic in watershed could account for as much as 65 % and 74 % of the variation in soil erosion and sediment yield , respectively .
greater interspersion and an increased number of patch land cover type may significantly accelerate soilerosion and increase sediment export .

plsr can be used to simply determine the relationship between land-cover pattern and watershed soil erosion and sediment yield , providing quantitative information to allow decision maker to make better choice regarding landscape planning .

with readily available remote sensing data and rapid development in geographic information system ( GIS ) technology , this practical and simple PLSR approach could be applied to a variety of other watershed .
urbanization impact on landscape pattern in Beijing City , China : A spatial heterogeneity perspective .
the temporal and spatial characteristic of landscape pattern change can reflect the spatial impact of urbanization on the ecological environment .
studying the relationship between urbanization and landscape pattern can provide support for urban ecological management .

previous study have examined the quantitative relationship between the social economy and landscape pattern of an entire region , but have not considered the spatial non-stability of this relationship .
in this study , we characterized the landscape pattern in Beijing City , China during 2000 and 2010 using four landscape metric , i.e .
patch density ( PD ) , edge density ( ED ) , Shannon 's diversity index ( SHDI ) and the aggregation index ( AI ) .

geographically weighted regression ( GWR ) was employed to identify the spatial heterogeneity and evolution characteristic of the relationship between the urbanization of population density ( POP ) , gross domestic production ( GDP ) and nighttime lighting ( NTL ) , and landscape pattern .
the evolution of urban landscape pattern indicated a decentralized , aggregated , and fragmented change from the downtown to the suburb and outer suburb .
during the 10-year period , the average PD in the downtown increased by 100.6 % , and the increase of AI in the suburb was the largest .
the PD , ED and SHDI increased by different degree in the outer suburb .
the influence of different urbanization mode on landscape pattern were also different .
infilling mode made the landscape patterns more regular and integrated .
the landscape was more broken and complicated under the edge-expanding mode , and the leapfrog mode made PD and SHDI increase slightly .
in the relationship interpretation , GWR effectively identified the spatial heterogeneity , and improved the explanatory ability compared to ordinary least Square ( OLS ) .
the most intense response to urbanization was the forest landscape and the forest-cultivated land ecotone in the northwest of Beijing City , indicating that this region was ecologically fragile .
the population density in the urbanization index had a direct effect on landscape pattern , while the PD affected by urbanization was greater than the shape , aggregation and diversity index .
affected by development policy , urban planning and other factor , the explanation degree of social economy to landscape pattern decreased in 2010 .

gwr is an effective method for quantifying the spatial differentiation characteristic of urbanization impact on landscape pattern , which can provide more spatial information and decision criterion for the green development of a compact city .
mining urban land-use pattern from volunteered geographic information by mean of genetic algorithm and artificial neural network .
in the context of OpenStreetMap ( OSM ) , spatial data quality , in particular completeness , is an essential aspect of its fitness for use in specific application , such as planning task .

to mitigate the effect of completeness error in OSM , this study proposes a methodological framework for predicting by mean of OSM urban area in Europe that are currently not mapped or only partially mapped .
for this purpose , a machine learning approach consisting of artificial neural network and genetic algorithms is applied .
under the premise of existing OSM data , the model estimates missing urban area with an overall squared correlation coefficient ( R 2 ) of 0.589 .
interregional comparison of European region confirm spatial heterogeneity in the model performance , whereas the R 2 range from 0.129 up to 0.789 .
these result show that the delineation of urban area by mean of the presented methodology depends strongly on location .
building type classification using spatial and landscape attribute derived from LiDAR remote sensing data .
building information is one of the key element for a range of urban planning and management practice .

in this study , an investigation was performed to classify building delineated from light detection and ranging ( LiDAR ) remote sensing data into three type : single-family house , multiple-family house , and non-residential building .
four kind of spatial attribute describing the shape , location , and surrounding environment of building were calculated and subsequently employed in the classification .
experiment were performed in suburban and downtown site in Denver , CO , USA , considering different building component and neighborhood environment .
building type classification result yielded overall accuracy > 70 % and Kappa > 0.5 for both site , demonstrating the feasibility of obtaining building type information from LiDAR data .
the shape attributes , such as width , footprint area , and perimeter , were most useful for identifying building type .
environmental landscape attributes surrounding building , such as the number of road and parking lot pixel , also contributed to obtaining building type information .
combining shape and environmental landscape attribute was necessary to obtain accurate and consistent classification result .
combining Pixel-and Object-Based Machine Learning for Identification of Water-Body Types from Urban High-Resolution Remote-Sensing Imagery .
water is one of the vital component for the ecological environment , which plays an important role in human survival and socioeconomic development .
water resource in urban area are gradually decreasing due to the rapid urbanization , especially in developing countrie .
therefore , the precise extraction and automatic identification of water bodie are of great significance and urgently required for urban planning .
it should be noted that although some study have been reported regarding the water-area extraction , to our knowledge , few paper concern the identification of urban water type ( e.g.
, river , lake , canal , and pond ) .
in this paper , a novel two-level machine-learning framework is proposed for identifying the water type from urban high-resolution remote-sensing image .

the framework consists of two interpretation level : 1 ) water bodie are extracted at the pixel level , where the water/shadow/vegetation indexe are considered and 2 ) water type are further identified at the object level , where a set of geometrical and textural feature are used .
both level employ machine learning for the image interpretation .
the proposed framework is validated using the GeoEye-1 and WorldView-2 image , over two mega city in China , i.e.
, Wuhan and Shenzhen , respectively .

the experimental result show that the proposed method achieved satisfactory accuracy for both water extraction [ 95.4 % ( Shenzhen ) , 96.2 % ( Wuhan ) ] , and water type classification [ 94.1 % ( Shenzhen ) , 95.9 % ( Wuhan ) ] in complex urban area .
from land cover-graphs to urban structure type .
urban structure type ( UST ) are an initial interest and basic instrument for monitoring , controlling and modeling task of urban planner and decision maker during ongoing urbanization process .
this study focuses on a method to classify UST from land cover ( LC ) object , which were derived from high resolution satellite image .
the topology of urban LC object is analyzed by implementing neighborhood LC-graphs .
various graph measure are examined by their potential to distinguish between different UST , using the machine learning classifier random forest .
additionally the influence of different parameter setting of the random forest model , the reduction of training sample , and the graph measure importance is analyzed .
an independent test set is classified and validated , achieving an overall accuracy of 87 % .
it was found that the height of the building with the highest node degree has a strong impact on the classification result .
land-use-change modeling using unbalanced support-vector machine .
modeling land-use change is a prerequisite to understanding the complexity of land-use-change pattern .
this paper presents a novel method to model urban land-use change using support-vector machine ( SVMs ) , a new generation of machine learning algorithm used in classification and regression domain .
an SVM modeling framework has been developed to analyze land-use change in relation to various factor such as population , distance to Road and facility , and surrounding land use .

as land-use data are generally unbalanced , in the sense that the unchanged data overwhelm the changed data , traditional method are incapable of classifying relatively minor land-use change with high accuracy .
to circumvent this problem , an unbalanced SVM has been adopted by enhancing the standard SVMs .
a case study of Calgary land-use change demonstrates that the unbalanced SVMs can achieve high and reliable performance for land-use-change modeling .
building block level urban land-use information retrieval based on Google Street View image .
land-use map are important reference for urban planning and urban study .
given the heterogeneity of urban land-use type , it is difficult to differentiate different land-use type based on overhead remotely sensed data .

google Street View ( GSV ) image , which capture the façade of building block along Street , could be better used to judge the land-use type of different building block based on their façade appearance .

recently developed scene classification algorithms in computer vision community make it possible to categorize different photo semantically based on various image feature descriptor and machine-learning algorithms .
therefore , in this study , we proposed a method to derive detailed land-use information at building block level based on scene classification algorithms and GSV image .
three image feature descriptor ( i.e.
, scale-invariant feature transform-Fisher , histogram of oriented gradient , GIST ) were used to represent GSV image of different building .
existing land-use map were used to create training dataset to train support vector machine ( SVM ) classifier for categorizing GSV image .
the trained SVM classifier were then applied to case study area in New York City , Boston , and Houston , to predict the land-use information at building block level .
accuracy assessment result show that the proposed method is suitable for differentiating residential building and nonresidential building with an accuracy of 85 % or so .
since the GSV image are publicly accessible , this proposed method would provide a new way for building block level land-use mapping in future .
scale- and region-dependence in landscape-PM2.5 correlation : Implication for urban planning .
under rapid urbanization , many city in China suffer from serious fine particulate matter ( PMPM2.5 ) pollution .
as the emission source or adsorption sink , land use and the corresponding landscape pattern unavoidably affect the concentration .
however , the correlation varies with different region and scale , leaving a significant gap for urban planning .
this study clarifies the correlation with the aid of in situ and satellite-based spatial dataset over six urban agglomeration in China .
two coverage and four landscape indice are adopted to represent land use and landscape pattern .
specifically , the coverage indice include the area ratio of forest ( F_PLAND ) and built-up area ( C_PLAND ) .
the landscape indice refer to the perimeter-area fractal dimension index ( PAFRAC ) , interspersion and juxtaposition index ( IJI ) , aggregation index ( AI ) , Shannon 's diversity index ( SHDI ) .
then , the correlation between PMPM2.5 concentration with the selected indice are evaluated from supporting the potential urban planning .
result show that the correlation are weak with the in situ PMPM2.5 concentration , which are significant with the regional value .
it means that land use coverage and landscape pattern affect PMPM2.5 at a relatively large scale .

furthermore , regional PMPM2.5 concentration negatively correlate to F_PLAND and positively to C_PLAND ( significance at p & lt ; 0.05 ) , indicating that forest helps to improve air quality , while built-up area worsen the pollution .
finally , the heterogeneous landscape present positive correlation to the regional PMPM2.5 concentration in most region , except for the urban agglomeration with highly-developed urban ( i.e.
, the Jing-Jin-Ji and Chengdu-Chongqing urban agglomeration ) .
it suggests that centralized urbanization would be helpful for PMPM2.5 pollution controlling by reducing the emission source in most region .
based on the result , the potential urban planning is proposed for controlling PMPM2.5 pollution for each urban agglomeration .
support Vector Machine accuracy assessment for extracting green urban area in Town .
the most commonly used model for analyzing satellite imagery is the Support Vector Machine ( SVM ) .

since there are a large number of possible variable for use in SVM , this paper will provide a combination of parameter that fit best for extracting green urban area from Copernicus mission satellite image .
this paper aims to provide a combination of parameter to extract green urban area with the highest degree of accuracy , in order to speed up urban planning and ultimately improve town environment .

two different Town in Croatia were investigated , and the result provide an optimal combination of parameter for green urban area extraction with an overall kappa index of 0.87 and 0.89 , which demonstrates a very high classification accuracy .
driving force analysis of urban expansion based on boosted regression tree and Logistic regression .
the rapid relentless urban area expansion has led to a series of problem in China .
many research focused on this issue in recent year .
driving force are the core topic in urban expansion , as well as the basic component of modeling and predicting .

it is very useful and meaningful to analyze the driving force of urban expansion , which may provide us with a scientific basis to rationally utilize land resource , determining the law of urban development , researching the evolution process , predicting the urban expansion trend , and also providing guidance for the development of rational control policy .
the Shenyang city was chosen as study area .
eight category of land use type were extracted from remote sensing image ( 1997 and 2010 ) with ArcGIS software .
ten driving force were chosen , including three natural factor , three distance factor , four social and economic factor .
which were calculated based on the land use map , DEM , topographic map , zoning map and the statistical yearbook .
the dependent variable was the change of built-up area of Shenyang from 1997 to 2010 .

boosted regression tree ( BRT ) is an ensemble method and is a combination of technique between statistical and machine learning tradition that has shown to be effective to identify relationship between result and influencing factor .
logistic regression is a method to discover the empirical relationship between a binary dependent and several independent categorical and continuous variable .
boosted Regression Trees and Logistic regression were used to analyze the main driving force of urban expansion synthetically .

the result illustrated the relative influence of driving factor was followed by distance from urban area of 1997 , distance from river , DEM , distance from highway and railway , land use type , development plan , GDP , population density , aspect , and slope based on BRT analysis .

according to Logistic regression analysis , the relative influence of important factor was followed by development zone , distance from urban land of 1997 , DEM , distance from highway and railway , population density , distance from river , rural residential area and slope .
the most important driving force affecting the expansion of Shenyang are distance from urban area of 1997 , DEM , distance from highway and railway .
meanwhile , they were all located in the top four of the main factor .
the result revealed that the distance factor were the most important factor , and the total contribution rate of relative influence was up to 61.4 % .
it is demonstrated distance factor are the main driving force of urban expansion .
natural factorswere less important , but the relative influence of DEM was important , and the contribution rate was 12.5 % .
development zone and rural settlement are the only two factor have much influence in the socio-economic factor .
on the whole , location factor , which refer to the distance from urban land in this study , were the leading factor of urban expansion .
natural factor , such as DEM , river and so on , are the basis of urban development , determining the overall urban spatial form .
the construction of infrastructure , such as Road and railway , are the frame of the city .
the social and economic factor decided the speed of urban expansion .
urban planning and development zone construction provided the direction of urban expansion .
daily accessed street greenery and housing price : Measuring economic performance of human-scale streetscape via new urban data .
the protective effect of street greenery on ecological , psychological , and behavioral phenomenon have been well recognized .
nevertheless , the potential economic effect of daily accessed street greenery , i.e.

, a human-scale and perceptual-oriented quality focusing on exposure to street greenery in people 's daily live , has not been fully studied because a quantitative measuring of this human-scale indicator is hard to achieve .
this study was an attempt in this direction with the help of new urban data and new analytical tool .
shanghai , which has a mature real estate market , was selected for study , and the housing price of 1395 private neighborhood in its city center were collected .

we selected more than forty variable that were classified under five categories-location feature , distance to the closest facility , density of facility within a certain radius , housing and neighborhood feature , and daily accessed street greenery-in a hedonic pricing model .
the distance and density of facility were computed through a massive number of points-of-interest and a geographical information system .
the visible street greenery was collected from Baidu street view image and then measured via a machine-learning algorithm , while accessibility was measured through space syntax .

in addition to the well-recognized effect previously discovered , the result show that visible street greenery and street accessibility at global scale hold significant positive coefficient for housing price .
visible street greenery even obtains the second-highest regression coefficient in the model .
moreover , the combined assessment , the co-presence of local-scale accessibility and eye-level greenery , is significant for housing price as well .

this study provides a scientific and quantitative support for the significance of human-scale street greenery , making it an important issue in urban greening policy for urban planner and decision maker .
regional mapping of essential urban land use category in China : A segmentation-based approach .
understanding distribution of urban land use is of great importance for urban planning , decision support , and resource allocation .
the first mapping result of essential urban land use category ( EULUC ) in China for 2018 have been recently released .
however , such kind of national map may not sufficiently meet the growing demand for regional analysis .
to address this shortcoming , here we proposed a segmentation-based framework named EULUC-seg to improve the mapping result of EULUC at the city scale .
an object-based segmentation approach was first applied to generate the basic mapping unit within urban parcel .
multiple feature derived from high-resolution remotely sensed and social sensing data were updated and then recalculated within each unit .
random forest was adopted as the machine learning algorithm for classifying urban land use into five Level I class and twelve Level II class .
finally , an accuracy assessment was carried out based on a collection of manually interpreted sample .
result showed that our derived map achieved an overall accuracy of 87.58 % for Level I , and 73.53 % for Level II .
the accurate and refined map of EULUC-seg is expected to better support various application in the future .
pattern of historical and future urban expansion in Nepal .
globally , urbanization is increasing at an unprecedented rate at the cost of agricultural and forested land in peri-urban area fringing larger city .

such land-cover change generally entails negative implication for societal and environmental sustainability , particularly in South Asia , where high demographic growth and poor land-use planning combine .
analyzing historical land-use change and predicting the future trends concerning urban expansion may support more effective land-use planning and sustainable outcome .

for Nepal 's Tarai region-a populous area experiencing land-use change due to urbanization and other factors-we draw on Landsat satellite imagery to analyze historical land-use change focusing on urban expansion during 1989-2016 and predict urban expansion by 2026 and 2036 using artificial neural network ( ANN ) and Markov chain ( MC ) spatial model based on historical trend .
urban cover quadrupled since 1989 , expanding by 256 km2 ( 460 % ) , largely as small scattered settlement .
this expansion was almost entirely at the expense of agricultural conversion ( 249 km2 ) .
after 2016 , urban expansion is predicted to increase linearly by a further 199 km2 by 2026 and by another 165 km2 by 2036 , almost all at the expense of agricultural cover .
such unplanned loss of prime agricultural land in Nepal 's fertile Tarai region is of serious concern for food-insecure countrie like Nepal .
impact of community deprivation on urban park access over time : Understanding the relative role of contributor for urban planning .
as an important element of urban landscape , park plays an important role in building environmentally sustainable city .
thus , it is important to examine park accessibility and how it changes over time in relation to community deprivation so as to provide all resident with equitable service .

using the Gaussian-based 2SFCA ( two-step floating catchment area ) method , this paper analyzes dynamic park accessibility from 2016 to 2018 for community within the Hangzhou metropolitan area in China and then quantifies the relative role of local contributor to park accessibility change ( population , park and transport network ) .

a machine learning algorithm , which handles the interdependence of deprivation dimension , is further employed to determine the relationship between community deprivation and park accessibility change .
result show that park accessibility continued to grow during the study period , and most community achieved excellent park accessibility by 2018 .
population decrease and park increase contribute positively to improved park accessibility , while transport network change have had less of an impact .
deprived community have observed a rising trend of park accessibility , while the elderly concentrated community are more likely to experience declined park accessibility .

our study provides a new methodological framework , which integrates the geographical accessibility model , economic chain substitution model and machine learning algorithm , for understanding the dynamic park access and associated social inequality in rapidly urbanizing region .
the lesson learned from this study should be insightful for urban planning .
how does the urban form-PM2.5 concentration relationship change seasonally in Chinese city ?
a comparative analysis between national and urban agglomeration scale .
understanding how urban form affect fine particulate ( PM2.5 ) concentration within different season is important for sustainable urban development .

thus , the purpose of this study was to quantify the relationship between urban form and PM2.5 concentration change seasonally in 279 Chinese city , with the explicit consideration of a comparative analysis between national and urban agglomeration scale .

a comprehensive evaluation index system of urban form was calculated based on six urban form metric ( total urban area ( CA ) , number of patch ( NP ) , landscape shape index ( LSI ) , percentage of like adjacencie ( PLADJ ) , patch cohesion index ( COHESION ) , and aggregation index ( AI ) ) by integrating three control variable ( temperature , NDVI , and nighttime light ) .
the spatial regression model was subsequently adopted to quantify the effect of urban form on PM2.5 concentration .

the result revealed that , during the summer and autumn , only urban form compactness was significantly correlated with the PM2.5 concentration , but more urban form metric were significantly associated with the PM2.5 concentration during the spring and winter in Chinese city .

the scattered urban form could effectively reduce the PM2.5 concentration in the Yangtze River Delta , Pearl River Delta , and Chengdu-Chongqing but not in the Beijing-Tianjin-Hebei during the winter .
the effect of urban form on PM2.5 concentration become increasingly noticeable from the national scale to the urban agglomeration scale with seasonal change .
this study suggests that the urban form-PM2.5 concentration relationship are sensitive to seasonal variation across different region .
thus , it is an important approach to solve PM2.5 pollution problem to construct an ideal urban form through flexible urban planning strategy .
studying spatial and temporal change of aridity in Iran .
optimum use of water in agriculture , drinking , and industry is necessary in arid and semi-arid region like Iran , which face serious water tension .

since studying aridity and its trend of change has a significant role in water resource management and urban planning , this research has investigated spatial and temporal change and trend of aridity change in Iran as an arid country .
to study the issue , 51 weather station of Iran which covered a 30-year statistical period ( 1981–2010 ) were selected .

climatic variable , namely precipitation , vapor pressure , local pressure , temperature , maximum temperature , and relative humidity and required data to calculate the potential evapotranspiration were extracted from Iran meteorology organization data .
in next step by applying Ai , Im , and Iq aridity indice , zoning of the aridity was done after studying the aridity trait and its change .
then the most compatible aridity index was introduced according to the value of correlation between climatic factor of aridity indice and the magnitude of each main climatic area of Iran .
furthermore , in order to recognize aridity change in Iran during the selected 30-year period , Mann-Kendal nonparametric test was used .

correlation analysis result showed that 35.4 and 64.6 % of Iran arid area show more compatibility with Im and Ai , respectively , which means that these indice are more appropriate to study aridity in arid region of Iran .
also , it was revealed that 5.6 and 94.3 % of Caspian south plain region has more compatibility with Ai and Iq indice , respectively .
as a matter of fact , 77.8 , 0.75 , and 21.4 % of the country area can be studied better by Ai , Iq , and Im , respectively .
also , the result of Mann-Kendal nonparametric test confirmed that aridity is developing in Iran .
in other word , 80.4 % of Iran area had increasing trend of aridity during the selected period and in just 19.6 % of the area , aridity trend was not significant or decreasing .
analyzing the spatial factor related to the distribution of building height in urban area : A comparative case study in Guangzhou and Shenzhen .
rapid urbanization has become an increasingly serious issue worldwide .
while most previous study focused on two-dimensional urban development , the spatial characteristic of building height are rarely explored .
such information could provide valuable implication for smart urban planning and management .
however , previous attempt did not systematically investigate the spatial factor that influence building height and their association with urban development .
therefore , this study developed a machine learning-based method to compare the distribution of building height in Guangzhou and Shenzhen , two city with different development pattern .
first , we collected detailed information on the building , such as the location and land value .
second , the height of each building was simulated based on the above information using the well-known random forest , k-nearest neighbor algorithm , and artificial neural network .
the random forests algorithm outperformed the other two in both city .
we also found that the commercial land value is the most important factor associated with building height .

moreover , the building height in Guangzhou are more sensitive to the distance to administrative center , while the distance to transportation network exert stronger influence on the building height in Shenzhen .
overall , these finding could support urban planning and management .
more importantly , the proposed method can be used to predict the height of new building and investigate the distribution of building height in other region .
mapping long-term dynamic of population and dwelling based on a multi-temporal analysis of urban morphology .

information on the distribution and dynamic of dwelling and their inhabitant is essential to support decision-making in various Field such as energy provision , land use planning , risk assessment and disaster management .

however , as various different of approach to estimate the current distribution of population and dwelling exist , further evidence on past dynamic is needed for a better understanding of urban process .

this article therefore addresses the question of whether and how accurately historical distribution of dwelling and inhabitant can be reconstructed with commonly available geodata from national mapping and cadastral agency .
for this purpose , an approach for the automatic derivation of such information is presented .
