the data basis is constituted by a current digital landscape model and a 3D building model combined with historical land use information automatically extracted from historical topographic map .
for this purpose , method of image processing , machine learning , change detection and dasymetric mapping are applied .

the result for a study area in Germany show that it is possible to automatically derive decadal historical pattern of population and dwelling from 1950 to 2011 at the level of a 100 m grid with slight underestimation and acceptable standard deviation .
by a differentiated analysis we were able to quantify the error for different urban structure type .
spatiotemporal modeling of urban growth using machine learning .
this paper presents a general framework for modeling the growth of three important variable for city : population distribution , binary urban footprint , and urban footprint in color .

the framework model the population distribution as a spatiotemporal regression problem using machine learning , and it obtains the binary urban footprint from the population distribution through a binary classifier plus a temporal correction for existing urban region .
the framework estimates the urban footprint in color from its previous value , as well as from past and current value of the binary urban footprint using a semantic inpainting algorithm .
by combining this framework with free data from the Landsat archive and the Global Human Settlement Layer framework , interested user can get approximate growth prediction of any city in the world .
these prediction can be improved with the inclusion in the framework of additional spatially distributed input variable over time subject to availability .
unlike widely used growth model based on cellular automata , there are two main advantage of using the proposed machine learning-based framework .
firstly , it does not require to define rule a priori because the model learns the dynamic of growth directly from the historical data .
secondly , it is very easy to train new machine learning model using different explanatory input variable to assess their impact .

as a proof of concept , we tested the framework in Valledupar and Rionegro , two Latin American city located in Colombia with different geomorphological characteristic , and found that the model prediction were in close agreement with the ground-truth based on performance metric , such as the root-mean-square error , zero-mean normalized cross-correlation , Pearson 's correlation coefficient for continuous variable , and a few other for discrete variable such as the intersection over union , accuracy , and the f1 metric .

in summary , our framework for modeling urban growth is flexible , allows sensitivity analysis , and can help policymaker worldwide to assess different what-if scenario during the planning cycle of sustainable and resilient city .
using GIS and machine learning to classify residential status of urban building in low and middle income setting .
utilising satellite image for planning and development is becoming a common practice as computational power and machine learning capability expand .
in this paper , we explore the use of satellite image derived building footprint data to classify the residential status of urban building in low and middle income countrie .
a recently developed ensemble machine learning building classification model is applied for the first time to the Democratic Republic of the Congo , and to Nigeria .
the model is informed by building footprint and label data of greater completeness and attribute consistency than have previously been available for these countrie .
a GIS workflow is described that semiautomates the preparation of data for input to the model .
the workflow is designed to be particularly useful to those who apply the model to additional countrie and use input data from diverse source .
result show that the ensemble model correctly classifies between 85 % and 93 % of structure as residential and nonresidential across both countrie .

the classification output are likely to be valuable in the modelling of human population distribution , as well as in a range of related application such as urban planning , resource allocation , and service delivery .
population spatialization in Beijing city based on machine learning and multisource remote sensing data .
remote sensing data have been widely used in research on population spatialization .

previous study have generally divided study area into several sub-area with similar feature by artificial or clustering algorithm and then developed model for these sub-areas separately using statistical method .
these approach have drawback due to their subjectivity and uncertainty .
in this paper , we present a study of population spatialization in Beijing City , China based on multisource remote sensing data and town-level population census data .

six predictive algorithm were compared for estimating population using the spatial variable derived from The National Polar-Orbiting Partnership/ Visible Infrared Imaging Radiometer Suite ( NPP/VIIRS ) night-time light and other remote sensing data .
random forest achieved the highest accuracy and therefore was employed for population spatialization .
feature selection was performed to determine the optimal variable combination for population modeling by random forest .
cross-validation result indicated that the developed model achieved a mean absolute error ( MAE ) of 2129.52 people/km2 and a R2 of 0.63 .
the gridded population density in Beijing at a spatial resolution of 500 m produced by the random forest model was also adjusted to be consistent with the census population at the town scale .
by comparison with Google Earth high-resolution image , the remotely-sensed population was qualitatively validated at the intra-town scale .
validation result indicated that remotely sensed result can effectively depict the spatial distribution of population within town-level district .
this study provides a valuable reference for urban planning , public health and disaster prevention in Beijing , and a reference for population mapping in other city .
night on South Korea : Unraveling the relationship between urban development pattern and DMSP-OLS night-time light .
using artificial light data measured from satellite has the potential to change research method in geography and urban planning .
the Defense Meteorological Satellite Program Optical Linescan System ( DMSP-OLS ) night-time light dataset provided consistent and valuable data source for investigating urbanization process .
this study intends to empirically investigate the relationship between night-time light , population , and urban development pattern .
a novel protocol was developed to integrate heterogeneous dataset into a standardized unit of analysis .
multivariate mixed-effect model were applied to detect correlation within and between province in South Korea .
to capture physical variation of urban development , four landscape metric were used and tested in the analysis .
diminishing return of night-time light to population were found in all model .
in single landscape metric model , all coefficient of landscape metric were positively related to night-time light .
in combination model , the aggregation index ( AI ) was no longer statistically significant .
the protocol developed in this study provides an effective way to create analytical unit for integrating heterogeneous form of data .
creating standardized unit of analysis will make it possible for researcher to compare their result with other study .
landscape metric used in this study for capturing the composition and configuration of urban development pattern will enrich the discussion in the future .
remote measurement of building usable floor area – Algorithms fusion .
rapid change that are taking place in the urban environment have significant impact on urban growth .
most city and urban region all over the world compete to increase resident and visitor satisfaction .
the growing requirement and rapidity of introducing new technology to all aspect of resident ’ lives force city and urban region to implement “ smart city ” concept in their activity .

real estate is one of the principal anthropogenic component of urban environment thus become a subject of thorough multidisciplinary analysis in the field of data requiring spatial information system .

recent advance in information technology , combined with the increased availability of high-resolution imagery from Earth observation , create an opportunity to use new source of data that enable to identify , monitor , and solved many of urban environmental problem .
the aim of the paper is to elaborate precise , complete and detailed property information with the use of remote sensing observation in a suitable numerical algorithm .
the author concentrate on providing one of the most important , and probably the most lacking , feature describing property – building usable floor area ( BUFA ) .

the solution is elaborated in the form of an automatic algorithm based on machine learning and computer vision technology related to LiDAR ( big data ) , close range image with respect to spatial information system requirement .

the obtained result related to BUFA estimation in comparison to the state-of-the-art result are satisfactory and may increase the reliability of decision-making in investment , fiscal , registration and planning aspect .
urban land use information retrieval based on scene classification of Google Street View image .
land use map are very important reference for the urban planning and management .
however , it is difficult and time-consuming to get high-resolution urban land use map .
in this study , we propose a new method to derive land use information at building block level based on machine learning and geo-tagged street-level imagery - Google Street View image .
several commonly used generic image feature ( GIST , HoG , and SIFT-Fisher ) are used to represent street-level image of different cityscape in a case study area of New York City .
machine learning is further used to categorize different image based on the calculated image feature of different street-level image .
accuracy assessment result show that the method developed in this study is a promising method for land use mapping at building block level in future .
sensing Mixed Urban Land-Use Patterns Using Municipal Water Consumption Time Series .
the biased population coverage and short temporal length of newly emerged data set ( e.g.
, data set of social media , mobile phone , and smart card ) obstruct the effective analysis of long-term dynamic of landuse pattern , particularly in small and developing city .
this study proposed a framework to delineate and analyze mixed land-use pattern and their evolution using municipal water consumption data .
a two-step classification strategy was designed based on the rotation forest scheme to differentiate the socioeconomic type of customer ( e.g.
, residence , commerce , public facility , manufacturing , and recreation ) using multiple feature extracted from the various form of water consumption time series .
the spatial distribution of the socioeconomic function were then derived , and the mixed land use was measured using a diversity index based on information entropy .
such an approach was applied to Changshu , a typical developing county-level city in China , for the period 2004 to 2013 .
the result showed that the urbanization of Changshu experienced both spatial expansion and intensification , with a slightly declining rate of growth in recent year .
apart from the city center , two subcenter have emerged for industrial development .
the degree of land-use mixture has increased with urban growth , indicating a maturing of urbanization .

this study explored the approach of identifying individual socioeconomic function by the consumption pattern of municipal service and demonstrated that municipal service data set can reveal land-use pattern and dynamic at a fine spatial resolution to evaluate urban planning and management , with the advantage of large population coverage and long-term temporal length .
mapping essential urban land use category with open big data : Result for five metropolitan area in the United States of America .

urban land-use map outlining the distribution , pattern , and composition of various land use type are critically important for urban planning , environmental management , disaster control , health protection , and biodiversity conservation .

recent advance in remote sensing and social sensing data and method have shown great potential in mapping urban land use category , but they are still constrained by mixed land use , limited predictor , non-localized model , and often relatively low accuracy .
to inform these issue , we proposed a robust and cost-effective framework for mapping urban land use category using openly available multi-source geospatial “ big data ” .

with street block generated from OpenStreetMap ( OSM ) data as the minimum classification unit , we integrated an expansive set of multi-scale spatially explicit information on land surface , vertical height , socio-economic attribute , social media , demography , and topography .
we further proposed to apply the automatic ensemble learning that leverages a bunch of machine learning algorithm in deriving optimal urban land use classification map .

result of block-level urban land use classification in five metropolitan area of the United States found the overall accuracy of major-class ( Level-I ) and minor-class ( Level-II ) classification could be high as 91 % and 86 % , respectively .

a multi-model comparison revealed that for urban land use classification with high-dimensional feature , the multi-layer stacking ensemble model achieved better performance than base model such as random forest , extremely randomized tree , LightGBM , CatBoost , and neural network .

we found without very-high-resolution National Agriculture Imagery Program imagery , the classification result derived from Sentinel-1 , Sentinel-2 , and other open big data based feature could achieve plausible overall accuracy of Level-I and Level-II classification at 88 % and 81 % , respectively .
we also found that model transferability depended highly on the heterogeneity in characteristic of different region .

the method and finding in this study systematically elucidate the role of data source , classification method , and feature transferability in block-level land use classification , which have important implication for mapping multi-scale essential urban land use category .
modeling fine-scale residential land price distribution : An experimental study using open data and machine learning .

modeling the fine-scale spatiotemporal distribution of residential land price ( RLPs ) is the basis for scientifically allocating land resource , managing the residential market and improving urban planning .
the accurate mapping of the RLP dynamic require reliable land price prediction model and data with fine spatial and temporal resolution .

with the aid of point of interest ( POI ) data and nighttime light ( NTL ) images , this paper attempts to explore the ability of machine learning algorithms ( MLAs ) to model grid-level RLPs using the case of Wuhan in China .
several land price prediction model were built using five MLAs and various geographic variable .

the experimental result show that the extra-trees regression algorithm and the radial basis function-based support vector regression algorithm perform best in Period Ⅰ ( 2010–2014 ) and Period Ⅱ ( 2015–2019 ) , respectively ; therefore , they were selected to estimate the RLPs of the grid without observation in the corresponding period .

based on the estimated result , we found that the spatial pattern of the RLP in Wuhan transitioned from monocentric to polycentric between the two period , and RLPs grew rapidly near newly formed urban subcenter and waterscape .

the relative importance of the predictor variables shows that commercial and educational facility are important determinant of the RLP distribution in Wuhan ; moreover , the relative importance of natural amenity and education facility increased over time , while that of commercial facility and public transportation decreased slightly .
the case of Wuhan confirms the feasibility of MLAs and openly accessible urban data in modeling fine-scale RLP distribution .

our proposed framework provides a new approach to monitor the urban land price dynamic accurately and closely , which is beneficial for improving the infrastructure layout and achieve smart city growth .
proposing an effective and inexpensive tool to detect urban surface temperature change associated with urbanization process in small city .
a consequence of urbanization is the loss of vegetation cover , replaced by urban area .

this study investigates the evolution of the built-up area and its influence on increasing the surface temperature through methodology applicable to small and medium-sized municipality where urbanization process monitoring is limited .
for the case study , the municipality of Penedo , located in the State of Alagoas , was selected .

landsat-5 and Landsat-8 image were used to evaluate urban landscape through normalized difference vegetation index ( NDVI ) , normalized difference built-up index ( NDBI ) , and the land surface temperature ( LST ) .
a simple tool that summarizes NDBI and LST change was proposed - the Change Detection Index ( CDI ) .
it was possible to highlight area where the increase in temperature is associated with the built area 's intensification .

furthermore , the machine learning k-mean clustering tool was applied to create group and analyze the relationship between urbanization and temperature increase , confirming the CDI value and validating this tool .
an evident increase in the built area was highlighted by CDI and cluster analysis , indicating a heat island 's potential formation at the implantation area of a housing complex in the municipality .

the spatial analysis indicates priority area for intervention by a simple methodology that facilitated dialogue and understanding between stakeholder , associated with a low-cost tool with the potential for reproduction and adaptation , providing indicator to urban study and decision-maker and handle the lack of monitoring data in small and medium-sized municipality .
do land policy make a difference ?
a data-driven approach to trace effect on urban form in France and Germany .
against the backdrop of rapidly expanding urban structure , land policy in many countrie have been adapted to contain and redirect growth to existing urban structure .
however , obstacle remain to measure the effect of policy .
in the meantime , geoinformation technology have given rise to a wide range of approach to measure and describe urban form .
nevertheless , its application for the assessment of land policy has a high , but not yet fully exploited , potential .
it is thus the aim of this research to address and investigate the option of spatial analysis and machine learning in particular to analyse urban form from a land policy perspective .
to do so , we develop urban metric informed by urban planning and land readjustment policy of two countrie describing urban form on different spatial level .
we therefore formulate hypothesis on causal relation between policy and form .
based on the metric , we apply the random forest algorithm to classify the building stock of the region .
we then extract the residential area , those with single-family house , as this is where the effect of the policy are considered most visible .
in a next step , we use random forest to predict the nationality of a building .
through variable importance measure , we identify and discuss urban morphological difference between the two countrie and test the hypothesis on effect of land policy .
we develop and test the approach for the French-German city-region of Strasbourg using OpenStreetMap data .
we identify significant difference in the building coverage ratio , which tend to be higher in Germany .
this can be linked to difference in planning regulation .
furthermore , German residential area appear to be more diverse in urban form .
difference in land readjustment policy have proven to be plausible here , as French policy favour strong actor that develop residential area more uniformly .
in Germany , policy favour fragmented ownership-oriented development of residential area .
the metric and the applied algorithm for building classification have proven to be robust in term of data heterogeneity and have shown high level of accuracy .
they could also be successfully used for tracing causal relation .
classification of Urban Functional Areas from Remote Sensing Images and Time-Series User Behavior Data .
urbanization is accelerating at a rapid rate , which has introduced many challenge , especially in the field of urban planning .
under the backdrop of global urbanization , some city are particularly vulnerable to climate change and natural disaster that are influenced by unplanned urban expansion .
rational planning of urban functional area needs to be strengthened to improve the scientific approach of urban planning and urbanization .
in this study , the classification of urban functional area based on dual-modal data ( i.e.
, remote sensing image and user behavior data ) was implemented using machine learning ( ML ) algorithms .
after the set test , the classification accuracy of urban functional area reached 82.45 % .
through analysis , it could be concluded that the use of data of two modality achieved a higher classification accuracy than that achieved by using data of a single modality .
the data of the two modality complement each other , and the use of ML algorithms to train such data can yield good result .
exploring the dynamic of urban greenness space and their driving factor using geographically weighted regression : A case study in Wuhan Metropolis , China .
urban greenness plays a vital role in supporting the ecosystem service of a city .
exploring the dynamic of urban greenness space and their driving force can provide valuable information for making solid urban planning policy .

this study aims to investigate the dynamic of urban greenness space pattern through landscape indice and to apply geographically weighted regression ( GWR ) to map the spatially varied impact on the indice from economic and environmental factor .
two typical landscape indice , i.e.

, percentage of landscape ( PLAND ) and aggregation index ( AI ) , which measure the abundance and fragmentation of urban greenness coverage , respectively , were taken to map the change in urban greenness .

as a case study , the metropolis of Wuhan , China was selected , where time-serie of urban greenness space were extracted at an annual step from the Landsat collection from Google Earth Engine during 2000–2018 .
the study shows that the urban greenness space not only decreased significantly , but also tended to be more fragmented over the year .
road network density , normalized difference built-up index ( NDBI ) , terrain elevation and slope , and precipitation were found to significantly correlate to the landscape indice .
gwr modeling successfully captures the spatially varied impact from the considered factor and the result from GWR modeling provide a critical reference for making location-specific urban planning .
analysing urban development pattern in a conflict zone : A case study of kabul .
a large part of the population in low-income countrie ( LICs ) lives in fragile and conflict-affected state .
many city in these state show high growth dynamic , but little is known about the relation of conflict and urban growth .
in Afghanistan , the Taliban regime , which lasted from 1996 to 2001 , caused large scale displacement of the population .
people from Afghanistan migrated to neighboring countrie like Iran and Pakistan , and all development came to a halt .
after the US invasion in October 2001 , all the major city in Afghanistan experienced significant population growth , in particular , driven by the influx of internally displaced person .
maximum pressure of this influx was felt by the capital city , Kabul .
this rapid urbanization , combined with very limited capacity of local authority to deal with this growth , led to unplanned urbanization and challenge for urban planning and management .

this study analyses the pattern of growth between 2001 and 2017 , and the factor influencing the growth in the city of Kabul with the help of high-resolution Earth Observation-based data ( EO ) and spatial logistic regression modelling .
we analyze settlement pattern by extracting image feature from high-resolution image ( aerial photographs of 2017 ) and terrain feature as input to a random forest classifier .
the urban growth is analyzed using an available built-up map ( extracted from IKONOS image for the year 2001 ) .
result indicate that unplanned settlement have grown 4.5 time during this period , wherea planned settlement have grown only 1.25 time .
the unplanned settlement expanded mostly towards the west and north west part of the city , and the growth of planned settlement happened mainly in the central and eastern part of the city .
population density and the location of military base are the most important factor that influence the growth , of both planned and unplanned settlement .

the growth of unplanned settlement occurs predominantly in area of steeper slope on the hillside , while planned settlement are on gentle slope and closer to the institutional area ( central and eastern part of the city ) .

we conclude that security and availability of infrastructure were the main driver of growth for planned settlement , wherea unplanned growth , mainly on hillside , was driven by the availability of land with poor infrastructure .
identifying different type of urban land use dynamic using Point-of-interest ( POI ) and Random Forest algorithm : The case of Huizhou , China .
the significant economic development witnessed in China in recent decade has been accompanied by the increasing expansion of urban area .

although a growing literature has analyzed the characteristic and driving force of urban land expansion , less attention has been paid to examining the different expansion determinant driving fine-scale urban land use ( residential land , administration and public service land , commercial land , and industrial land ) change .
this paper aims to identify the difference of multi-mechanisms driving fine-scale urban land use expansion based on big data and machine learning , in the Huizhou downtown area in 2000–2015 .
the Random Forest ( RF ) algorithm is used to identify the natural , transportation , location , social , and POI factor driving land expansion by considering different urban land-use category .

our RF estimation showed that enormous difference existed between various urban land-use type in term of the role they played in this expansion and their relation to potential determinant , during the different urban development stage studied .
transportation , location , and the distribution of actual land use were found to exert a greater influence on urban land expansion than other factor .
all the finding above provide detailed spatiotemporal knowledge and targeted information that can aid in understanding fine-scale urban land use dynamic .
in this way , sound planning strategy for different fine-scale land use can be formulated more scientifically .

the strength of association between these factor and urban land expansion differed greatly depending on the different land-use type involved as well as the urban development stage that it occurred within .
these result cast a new light on the importance of investigating the potential driving force in the expansion of different urban land-use type .
sustainable development scale of housing estate : An economic assessment using machine learning approach .
economic sustainability is often addressed from the perspective of economic growth and at the national level .
in contrast , this research attempts to examine the question of economic sustainability of human settlement at a local project level .
urban planner need to strike a balance between dispersal and over-concentration of population in city .
the existing theory suggest that either excessively low or extremely high level of household concentration is undesirable to a neighborhood .

in this study , an economic assessment using machine learning ( ML ) technique is used to identify the threshold scale of a housing estate , which comprises many privately owned residential unit ( like condos ) with shared amenity .
using two decade of property transaction data in Hong Kong as our evidence , this study has found that a tipping point exists in the development scale of these housing estate .
housing value initially rise with the number of residential unit in a housing estate but gradually fall when it increases beyond a critical limit .

this nonlinear economic relationship is attributed to the per household share of common facility , which does not increase sufficiently to match with the growing population density of the housing estate .

the policy implication is that , to optimize housing supply , urban planning should not just focus on increasing the development bulk of housing but should also pay attention to the possible bottleneck in the provision of shared amenity in the neighborhood .
identifying urban poverty using high-resolution satellite imagery and machine learning approach : Implication for housing inequality .

enriching Asian perspective on the rapid identification of urban poverty and its implication for housing inequality , this paper contributes empirical evidence about the utility of image feature derived from high-resolution satellite imagery and machine learning approach for identifying urban poverty in China at the community level .

for the case of the Jiangxia District and Huangpi District of Wuhan , image feature , including perimeter , line segment detector ( LSD ) , Hough transform , gray-level cooccurrence matrix ( GLCM ) , histogram of oriented gradient ( HoG ) , and local binary pattern ( LBP ) , are calculated , and four machine learning approach and 25 variable are applied to identify urban poverty and relatively important variable .

the result show that image feature and machine learning approach can be used to identify urban poverty with the best model performance with a coefficient of determination , R2 , of 0.5341 and 0.5324 for Jiangxia and Huangpi , respectively , although some difference exist among the approach and study area .
the importance of each variable differ for each approach and study area ; however , the relatively important variable are similar .
in particular , four variable achieved relatively satisfactory prediction result for all model and presented obvious difference in varying community with different poverty level .
housing inequality within low-income neighborhood , which is a response to gap in wealth , income , and housing affordability among social group , is an important manifestation of urban poverty .

policy maker can implement these finding to rapidly identify urban poverty , and the finding have potential application for addressing housing inequality and proving the rationality of urban planning for building a sustainable society .
a glimpse into the future of exposure and vulnerability in city ?
modelling of residential location choice of urban population with random forest .
the most common approach to assessing natural hazard risk is investigating the willingness to pay in the presence or absence of such risk .
in this work , we propose a new , machine-learning-based , indirect approach to the problem , i.e .
through residential-choice modelling .

especially in urban environment , exposure and vulnerability are highly dynamic risk component , both being shaped by a complex and continuous reorganization and redistribution of asset within the urban space , including the ( re- ) location of urban dweller .
by modelling residential-choice behaviour in the city of Leipzig , Germany , we seek to examine how exposure and vulnerability are shaped by the residential-location-choice process .
the proposed approach reveal hot spot and cold spot of residential choice for distinct socioeconomic group exhibiting heterogeneous preference .

we discuss the relationship between observed pattern and disaster risk through the len of exposure and vulnerability , as well as link to urban planning , and explore how the proposed methodology may contribute to predicting future trend in exposure , vulnerability , and risk through this analytical focus .
Avenue for future research include the operational strengthening of these linkage for more effective disaster risk management .
mapping essential urban land use category ( EULUC ) using geospatial big data : Progress , challenge , and opportunity .

urban land use information that reflects socio-economic function and human activity is critically essential for urban planning , landscape design , environmental management , health promotion , and biodiversity conservation .

land-use map outlining the distribution , pattern , and composition of essential urban land use category ( EULUC ) have facilitated a wide spectrum of application and further triggered new opportunity in urban study .

new and improved Earth observation , algorithms , and advanced product for extracting thematic urban information , in association with emerging social sensing big data and auxiliary crowdsourcing dataset , all together offer great potential to mapping fine-resolution EULUC from regional to global scale .
here we review the advance of EULUC mapping research and practice in term of their data , method , and application .

based on the historical retrospect , we summarize the challenge and limitation of current EULUC study regarding sample collection , mixed land use problem , data and model generalization , and large-scale mapping effort .

finally , we propose and discuss future opportunity , including cross-scale mapping , optimal integration of multi-source feature , global sample library from crowdsourcing approach , advanced machine learning and ensembled classification strategy , open portal for data visualization and sharing , multi-temporal mapping of EULUC change , and implication in urban environmental study , to facilitate multi-scale fine-resolution EULUC mapping research .
published by Taylor & Francis Group and Science Press on behalf of the International Society for Digital Earth , supported by the CASEarth Strategic Priority Research Programme .
analysis of built-up area of small polish city with the use of deep learning and geographically weighted regression .
small city are an important part of the settlement system , a link between rural area and large city .

although they perform important function , research focuses on large city and metropolis while marginalizing small city , the study of which is of great importance to progress in social science , geography , and urban planning .
the main goal of this paper was to verify the impact of selected socio-economic factor on the share of built-up area in 665 small Polish city in 2019 .
data from the Database of Topographic Objects ( BDOT ) , Sentinel-2 satellite imagery from 2015 and 2019 , and Local Data Bank by Statistics Poland form 2019 were used in the research .
a machine learning segmentation procedure was used to obtain the data on the occurrence of built-up area .

hot Spot ( Getis-Ord Gi * ) analysis and geographically weighted regression ( GWR ) was applied to explain spatially varying impact of factor related to population , spatial and economic development , and living standard on the share of built-up area in the area of small city .
significant association was found between the population density and the share of built-up area in the area of the city studied .
the influence of the other socio-economic factor examined , related to the spatial and economic development of the city and the quality of life of the inhabitant , showed great regional variation .

the result also indicated that the share of built-up area in the area of the city under study is a result of the condition under which they were established and developed throughout their existence , and not only of the socio-economic factor affecting them at present .
estimating Socio-Economic Parameter via Machine Learning Methods Using Luojia1-01 Nighttime Light Remotely Sensed Image at Multiple Scales of China in 2018 .
mapping socio-economic indicator with a raster format is still a great challenge .
the nighttime light ( NTL ) dataset have been widely utilized to estimate the socio-economic parameter .
however , the precision of the published dataset was too coarse to meet related issue such as flood loss assessment , urban planning , and epidemiological study .

the present study calibrated gross domestic product ( GDP ) , population ( POP ) , electric consumption ( EC ) , and urban build-up area ( B-A ) at 100 m resolution for 45 city of China in 2018 using Luojia1-01 NTL datasets via random forest ( RF ) as well as geographically weighted regression ( GWR ) model .
the linear regression ( LR ) , back propagation neural network ( BPNN ) , and support vector machine ( SVM ) method were selected for comparison with GWR and RF model .
besides , the Suomi National Polar-Orbiting Partnership-Visible Infrared Imaging Radiometer Suite ( NPP-VIIRS ) was chosen for comparison with Luojia1-01 .
the ten-folded cross-validation ( CV ) has been used for evaluating accuracy at county and city scale .
finally , the distribution map of socio-economic parameter were illustrated and some finding were obtained .
first , the validation result revealed that the calibration at the city-scale outperformed the county or district scale .
second , the precision of the Luojia1-01 NTL dataset surpassed the NPP-VIIRS NTL dataset on the same administrative scale except for some specific situation .

third , the precision of the simulation for the gross domestic product ( GDP ) is the highest than the other , followed by electric consumption ( EC ) , build-up area ( B-A ) , and population ( POP ) .
fourth , the optimum model varied according to the socio-economic parameter .
fifth , the distribution of socio-economic parameter exhibited obvious spatial heterogeneity .
this paper can supply scientific support for calibrating socio-economic parameter in other region .
urban population distribution mapping with multisource geospatial data based on zonal strategy .
mapping population distribution at fine resolution with high accuracy is crucial to urban planning and management .

this paper takes Guangzhou city as the study area , illustrates the gridded population distribution map by using machine learning method based on zoning strategy with multisource geospatial data such as night light remote sensing data , point of interest data , land use data , and so on .

the street-level accuracy evaluation result show that the proposed approach achieved good overall accuracy , with determinant coefficient ( R2 ) being 0.713 and root mean square error ( RMSE ) being 5512.9 .
meanwhile , the goodness of fit for single linear regression ( LR ) model and random forest ( RF ) regression model are 0.0039 and 0.605 , respectively .

for dense area , the accuracy of the random forest model is better than the linear regression model , while for sparse area , the accuracy of the linear regression model is better than the random forest model .
the result indicated that the proposed method has great potential in fine-scale population mapping .
therefore , it is advised that the zonal modeling strategy should be the primary choice for solving regional difference in the population distribution mapping research .
mapping Urban Slum Settlements Using Very High-Resolution Imagery and Land Boundary Data .
accurate mapping of slum is crucial for urban planning and management .
this article proposes a machine learning , hierarchical object-based method to map slum settlement using very high-resolution ( VHR ) imagery and land boundary data to support slum upgrading .
the proposed method is tested in Kingston Metropolitan Area , Jamaica .
first , the VHR imagery is classified into major land cover class ( i.e.
, the initial land cover map ) .
second , the VHR imagery and land boundary layer are used to obtain homogenous neighborhood ( HNs ) .
third , the initial land cover map is used to derive multiple context , spectral , and texture image features according to the local physical characteristic of slum settlement .
fourth , a machine-learning classifier , classification and regression tree , is used to classify HNs into slum and nonslum settlement using only the effective image feature .
finally , reference data collected manually are used to assess the accuracy of the classification .
in the training site , an overall accuracy of 0.935 is achieved .
the effective image indicator for slum mapping include the building layout , building density , building roof characteristic , and distance from building to gully .
the classifier and those feature selected from the training site are further used to map slum in two validating site to assess the transferability of our approach .

overall accuracy of the two validating site reached 0.928 and 0.929 , respectively , suggesting that the feature and classification model obtained from one site has the potential to be transferred to other area in Jamaica and possibly other developing Caribbean countrie with similar situation and data availability .
integrating activity-based geographic information and long-term remote sensing to characterize urban land use change .
the land use structure is a key component to understand the complexity of urban system because it provides a snapshot of urban dynamic and how people use space .
this paper integrates socially sensed activity data with a remotely sensed land cover product in order to infer urban land use and its change over time .

we conducted a case study in theWashington D.C.-Baltimore metropolitan area to identify the pattern of land use change from undeveloped to developed land , including residential and non-residential use for a period covering 1986-2008 .
the proposed approach modeled physical and behavioral feature of land parcel from a satellite-based impervious surface cover change product and georeferenced Tweet , respectively .

a model assessment with random forest classifier showed that the proposed classification workflow could classify residential and non-residential land uses at an accuracy of 81 % , 4 % better than modeling the same land use from physical feature alone .
using the timestamp of the impervious surface cover change product , the study also reconstructed the timeline of the identified land use .

the result indicated that the proposed approach was capable of mapping detailed land use and change in an urban region , and represents a new and viable way forward for urban land use surveying that could be especially useful for surveying and tracking change in city where traditional approach and mapping product ( i.e.
, from remote sensing product ) may have a limited capacity to capture change .
exploring different combination of data and method for urban land use analysis : A survey .

modern planning and management of urban space is an essential topic for smart city and depends on up-to-date and reliable information on land use and functional role of the Place that integrate urban area .
in the last year , driven by increased availability of geo-referenced data from social or embedded sensor and remote sensing ( RS ) image , various method become popular for land use analysis .
this paper addresses the various method employed in this context , as well as needed data and respective categorization , best application of each method , and their comparison .
we focus on approach based on data from RS image , open map and various category of crowdsourced data .
we identify and discuss the way these approach use Data Mining ( DM ) and Machine Learning ( ML ) .
from our initial study we concluded that even using the same method and the same kind of data , result depend on spatial configuration of the data , accordingly to the specificity of each region .

the work described in this paper is intended to provide relevant contribution to method selection for knowledge discovery for city planning and management , taking into consideration available data and the pro and con of each technique .
urban sprawl modeling of Lahore , Pakistan using machine learning technique .

population is the fundamental concentration because population is related with all resource and urban sprawl , an effect of socioeconomic improvement in specific condition , has progressively turned into a noteworthy issue confronting numerous metropolitan zone .
this is very essential to understand the significant factor affecting the population .
this research analyzed the spatial and temporal characteristic of metropolitan city Lahore , Pakistan .
supervised classification method is applied to examine the urban expansion and to evaluate signature of Lahore city into four category ( urban , vegetation , bare land and water bodie ) .

for the land cover change analysis and to predict the urban sprawl in future different technique and method can be used and out of numerous , geospatial technique like ( MOLUSCE ) QGIS plug-in , GIS along with remote sensing is used .
in this study , Landsat V and VIII satellite image of 1998 , 2008 and 2017 were used to classify the urban expansion .
the precision appraisal was completed for characterized map .
distinctive image Transition probability matrix and region change were acquired by utilizing plug-in created in QGIS and future year 2036 urban expansion was obtained .
in this study , an attempt was made to develop a relationship between urban sprawl and population of Lahore .
in light of accessible informational index , from 2017 to 2036 the change in urban area is 40 % while a 367.02 sq.km loss in vegetation is chronicled .
the majority of the urban sprawl occurred along primary roadway .
the outcome demonstrates that urban region is relied upon to develop substantially higher in the year 2036 when contrasted with 2017 .
this analysis gives awareness of urban development and support in macro and micro level urban planning , policy making in metropolitan city .
algorithm for modeling agricultural land cover classification and land surface temperature .
the rampant and unintended spread of urban area resulted to the increase artificial component in the land cover type of the countryside bringing forth urban heat island ( UHI ) .
this paved the way to wide range of negative influence on the human health and environment which commonly relates to air pollution , drought , higher energy demand , and water shortage .
the land cover also plays a relevant role in the process of understanding the interaction between ground surface with the local temperature .

at the moment , depiction of the land surface temperature ( LST ) at city/municipality scale particularly in certain area of Misamis Oriental , Philippines is inadequate as support to efficient mitigation and adaptation of the surface urban heat island ( SUHI ) .

thus , this study purposely attempts to provide application on the Landsat 8 satellite data and low density Light Detection and Ranging ( LiDAR ) product in mapping out quality semi-Automated LST model and crop-level land cover classification in a local scale through theoretical and algorithm base approach utilizing the principle of data analysis subjected to object based model .
the paper also aims to explore the relationship between the derived LST and land cover classification .

the result of the presented model showed the ability of comprehensive data analysis , GIS functionality and object based image analysis ( OBIA ) approach with the integration of machine learning intelligence on automating complex map production processes with considerable efficiency and high accuracy .
the finding may potentially lead to expanded investigation of temporal dynamic of land surface UHI .

it is worthwhile to note that the environmental significance of these interaction can provide microclimate perception , awareness and improved decision making for land use planning and characterization at local and neighborhood scale .
as a result , it can aid in facilitating problem identification , support mitigation and adaptation more efficiently .
exploiting foursquare and cellular data to infer user activity in urban environment .

inferring the type of activity in neighborhood of urban center may be helpful in a number of contexts including urban planning , content delivery and activity recommendation for mobile web user or may even yield to a deeper understanding of the geographical evolution of social life in the city .

during the past few year , the analysis of mobile phone usage pattern , or of social media with longitudinal attribute , have aided the automatic characterization of the dynamic of the urban environment .

in this work , we combine a dataset sourced from a telecommunication provider in Spain with a database of million of geo-tagged venue from Foursquare and we formulate the problem of urban activity inference in a supervised learning framework .
in particular , we exploit user communication pattern observed at the base station level in order to predict the activity of Foursquare user who checkin-in at nearby venue .
first , we mine a set of machine learning feature that allow us to encode the input telecommunication signal of a tower .
subsequently , we evaluate a diverse set of supervised learning algorithms using label extracted from Foursquare place category and we consider two application scenario .

initially , we assess how hard it is to predict specific urban activity of an area , showing that Nightlife and Entertainment spot are those easier to infer , whereas College and Shopping area are those featuring the lowest accuracy rate .
then , considering a candidate set of activity type in a geographic area , we aim to elect the most prominent one .

we demonstrate how the difficulty of the problem increases with the number of class incorporated in the prediction task , yet the classifier achieve a considerably better performance compared to a random guess even when the set of candidate class increases .
data-driven Urban Energy Simulation ( DUE-S ) : A framework for integrating engineering simulation and machine learning method in a multi-scale urban energy modeling workflow .
the world is rapidly urbanizing , and the energy intensive built environment is becoming increasingly responsible for the world 's energy consumption and associated environmental emission .
as a result , significant effort have been put forth to develop method that can accurately model and characterize building energy consumption in city .

these model aim to utilize physics-based building energy simulation , reduced-order calculation and statistical learning method to assess the energy performance of building within a dense urban area .

however , current urban building energy model are limited in their ability to account for the inter-building energy dynamic and urban microclimate factor that can have a substantial impact on building energy use .

to overcome these limitation , this paper proposes a novel Data-driven Urban Energy Simulation ( DUE-S ) framework that integrates a network-based machine learning algorithm ( ResNet ) with engineering simulation to better understand how building consume energy on multiple temporal ( hourly , daily , monthly ) and spatial scale in a city ( single building , block , urban ) .
we validate the proposed DUE-S framework on a proof of concept case study of 22 densely located university building in California , USA .
our result indicate that the DUE-S framework is able to accurately predict urban scale energy consumption at hourly , daily and monthly interval .

moreover , our result also demonstrate that the integration of data-driven and engineering simulation approach can partially capture the inter-building energy dynamic and impact of the urban context and merit future work to explore how they can be improved to predict sub-urban scale energy prediction ( single building , block ) .

in the end , successfully predicting and modeling the energy performance of urban building has the potential to inform the decision-making of a wide variety of urban sustainability stakeholder including architect , engineer and policymaker .
beyond Word2vec : An approach for urban functional region extraction and identification by combining Place2vec and POIs .
the actual function of a region may not reflect the intent of the original zoning scheme from planner .
to identify the actual urban functional region , numerous method have been proposed with computational advancement .
specifically , remote sensing by image recognition , geodemographic classification , social sensing with big data and geo-text mining technique have been widely applied .
points-of-interest ( POIs ) are one of the most common open-access data type used to extract information pertaining to functional zone .
however , previous work have either lost sight or did not make full use of the spatial interaction that can be extracted from POIs due to model limitation in the context of geographical space .

in this research , we introduced an approach that detects functional region at the scale of a neighborhood area ( NA ) by combining POI data and a simplified Place2vec model , which is theorized from the first law of geography .
first , the POI-based spatial context is constructed by using the nearest neighbor approach .
then , we can increase the number of training tuple ( tcenter , tcontext ) based on the weight derived from the distance between the POI tcenter and POI tcontext .
next , high-dimensional characteristic vector of the POIs are extracted by using the skip-gram training framework .
by summarizing the POI vector at the NA level , we employ a K-means clustering model to cluster the functional region .

compared with other probabilistic topic model ( PTMs ) and Word2vec , the Place2vec-based approach obtained the highest mean reciprocal rank value ( MRR-SWP=0.356 , MRR-SLC=0.401 , MRR-SJC=0.433 , and MRR-SLin=0.421 ) in term of similarity capturing performance and functional region identification accuracy ( OA=0.7424 ) .
the research has important implication to urban planning and governance .
nested logit model and artificial neural network for predicting household automobile choice : Comparison of performance .
over the past few year , machine-learning technique have expanded enormously .
these approach are increasingly being applied to traffic and transportation problem formerly reserved for formal statistical approach such as discrete choice model .

part of the reason for this has to do with research trend , but there are some potential advantage associated with such technique , including the ability to model nonlinear system ; the ease with which symbolic , nominal , or categorical variable can be included ; and the ability of these method to deal with noisy data .

the use of two modeling technique , the nested logit model and the multilayer perceptron artificial neural network , was investigated in term of their applicability to the household vehicle choice problem .
both method generated strong result , although the multilayer perceptron artificial neural network yielded better predictive potential .
citizen-centered big data analysis-driven governance intelligence framework for smart city .
sensor and system within rapidly expanding smart city produce citizen-centered big data which have potential value to support citizen-centered urban governance decision-making .

there exists a wealth of extant conceptual study , however , further operational study are needed to establish a specific path toward implementation of such data to governance decision-making with analytical algorithms that are appropriate for each step of the path .

this paper proposes a framework for the use of citizen-centered big data analysis to drive governance intelligence in smart city from two perspective : urban governance issue and data-analysis algorithms .

the framework consists of three layer : 1 ) A data-merging layer , which builds a citizen-centered panoramic data set for each citizen by merging citizen-related big data from multiple source in collaborative urban governance via similarity calculation and conflict resolution ; 2 ) a knowledge-discovery layer , which plots the citizen profile and citizen persona at both individual and group level in term of urban public service delivery and citizen participation via simple statistical analysis technique , machine learning , and econometric method ; and 3 ) a decision-making layer , which uses ontology model to standardize urban governance-related attribute , persona , and association to support governance decision-making via data mining and Bayesian Net technique .
finally , the proposed framework is validated in a case study on blood donation governance in China .

this research highlights the value of citizen-centered big data , push data-to-decision research from conceptual to operational , synthesizes previously published framework for citizen-centered big data analysis in smart city , and enhances the mutual supplement cross multiple disciplinarie .
forecasting smog-related health hazard based on social media and physical sensor .
smog disaster are becoming more and more frequent and may cause severe consequence on the environment and public health , especially in urban area .
social media as a real-time urban data source has become an increasingly effective channel to observe people׳s reaction on smog-related health hazard .
it can be used to capture possible smog-related public health disaster in its early stage .
we then propose a predictive analytic approach that utilizes both social media and physical sensor data to forecast the next day smog-related health hazard .
first , we model smog-related health hazard and smog severity through mining raw microblogging text and network information diffusion data .
second , we developed an artificial neural network ( ANN ) -based model to forecast smog-related health hazard with the current health hazard and smog severity observation .
we evaluate the performance of the approach with other alternative machine learning method .
to the best of our knowledge , we are the first to integrate social media and physical sensor data for smog-related health hazard forecasting .
the empirical finding can help researcher to better understand the non-linear relationship between the current smog observation and the next day health hazard .
in addition , this forecasting approach can provide decision support for smog-related health hazard management through function like early warning .
semantic framework of internet of thing for smart city : Case study .
in recent year , the advancement of sensor technology has led to the generation of heterogeneous Internet-of-Thing ( IoT ) data by smart city .
thus , the development and deployment of various aspect of IoT-based application are necessary to mine the potential value of data to the benefit of people and their live .
however , the variety , volume , heterogeneity , and real-time nature of data obtained from smart city pose considerable challenge .
in this paper , we propose a semantic framework that integrates the IoT with machine learning for smart city .
the proposed framework retrieve and model urban data for certain kind of IoT application based on semantic and machine-learning technology .
moreover , we propose two case study : pollution detection from vehicle and traffic pattern detection .
the experimental result show that our system is scalable and capable of accommodating a large number of urban region with different type of IoT application .
impact of land use and amenity on public transport use , urban planning and design .
various land-use configuration are known to have wide-ranging effect on the dynamic of and within other city component including the transportation system .

in this work , we particularly focus on the complex relationship between land-use and transport offering an innovative approach to the problem by using land-use feature at two differing level of granularity ( the more general land-use sector type and the more granular amenity structure ) to evaluate their impact on public transit ridership in both time and space .

to quantify the interdependency , we explored three machine learning model and demonstrate that the decision tree model perform best in term of overall performance-good predictive accuracy , generality , computational efficiency , and `` interpretability '' .

result also reveal that amenity-related feature are better predictor than the more general one , which suggests that high-resolution geo-information can provide more insight into the dependence of transit ridership on land-use .

we then demonstrate how the developed framework can be applied to urban planning for transit-oriented development by exploring practicable scenario based on Singapore 's urban plan toward 2030 , which includes the development of `` regional center '' ( RCs ) across the city-state .
result show an initial increase in transit ridership as the amount of amenity is increased .

this trend , on the other hand , eventually reverses ( particularly during peak hour ) with continued strategic increase in amenity ; a tipping point at 55 % increase is identified where ridership begins to decline and at 110 % , the predicted ridership begins to fall below current level .
our in-silico experiment support one of the medium-term land-use transport goal of stakeholders-to alleviate future strain in the transportation system of Singapore through the development of RCs .

the model put forward can serve as a good foundation in building decision-support tool that can assist planner in better strategizing and planning land-use configuration , in particular the amenity resource distribution , to influence and shape public transportation demand .
upscaling urban data science for global climate solution .
non-technical summary Manhattan , Berlin and New Delhi all need to take action to adapt to climate change and to reduce greenhouse gas emission .
while case study on these city provide valuable insight , comparability and scalability remain sidelined .

it is therefore timely to review the state-of-the-art in data infrastructure , including earth observation , social media data , and how they could be better integrated to advance climate change science in city and urban area .

we present three route for expanding knowledge on global urban area : mainstreaming data collection , amplifying the use of big data and taking further advantage of computational method to analyse qualitative data to gain new insight .
these data-based approach have the potential to upscale urban climate solution and effect change at the global scale .
technical summary Citie have an increasingly integral role in addressing climate change .

to gain a common understanding of solution , we require adequate and representative data of urban area , including data on related greenhouse gas emission , climate threat and of socio-economic contexts .

here , we review the current state of urban data science in the context of climate change , investigating the contribution of urban metabolism study , remote sensing , big data approach , urban economic , urban climate and weather study .

we outline three route for upscaling urban data science for global climate solution : 1 ) Mainstreaming and harmonizing data collection in city worldwide ; 2 ) Exploiting big data and machine learning to scale solution while maintaining privacy ; 3 ) Applying computational technique and data science method to analyse published qualitative information for the systematization and understanding of first-order climate effect and solution .
collaborative effort towards a joint data platform and integrated urban service would provide the quantitative foundation of the emerging global urban sustainability science .
examining threshold effect of built environment element on travel-related carbon-dioxide emission .

understanding how built environment feature are associated with travel-related carbon-dioxide ( CO2 ) emission is essential for planner to encourage environmentally sustainable travel through transportation and land use policy .

applying gradient boosting decision tree to the data from the Minneapolis-St. Paul metropolitan area , this study addresses two gap in the literature by identifying critical built environment determinant of CO2 emission , and more importantly , illustrating threshold effect of built environment element .
the result show that three neighborhood-level built environment factor have the strongest influence on CO2 emission : distance to the nearest transit stop , job density , and land use diversity .
the distance to downtown also has a substantial impact .
this study further confirms that built environment variable are effective only within a certain range .
these threshold effect offer valuable implication for planner to achieve desirable environmental benefit efficiently .
predicting neighborhood ' socioeconomic attribute using restaurant data .

accessing high-resolution timely socioeconomic data such as data on population employment and enterprise activity at the neighborhood level is critical for social scientist and policy maker to design and implement location-based policy .
however in many developing countrie or city reliable local-scale socioeconomic data remain scarce .
here we show an easily accessible and timely updated location attribute-restaurant-can be used to accurately predict a range of socioeconomic attribute of urban neighborhood .
we merge restaurant data from an online platform with 3 microdataset for 9 Chinese city .
using feature extracted from restaurant we train machine-learning model to estimate daytime and nighttime population number of firm and consumption level at various spatial resolution .
the trained model can explain 90 to 95 % of the variation of those attribute across neighborhood in the test dataset .

we analyze the tradeoff between accuracy spatial resolution and number of training sample as well as the heterogeneity of the predicted result across different spatial location demographic and firm industry .
finally we demonstrate the cross-city generality of this method by training the model in one city and then applying it directly to other city .
the transferability of this restaurant model can help bridge data gap between city allowing all city to enjoy big data and algorithm dividend .
cyber Citie : Social Media as a Tool for Understanding Citie .
‘ Big ’ urban data are increasingly becoming accessible for scientific research and policy use .
they may enhance the intelligence that is needed for understanding and mapping out social connectivity phenomena ( in the sense of Jane Jacobs ) in modern smart city .
the present paper aims to highlight and demonstrate the rich potential of information based on digital technology in modern city .
as a case study example of the power of social media data as a support tool in smart city , we consider Twitter data in the municipality of Amsterdam .
we use machine learning technique to identify temporal pattern that we then relate back to their spatial dimension , effectively connecting the digital with physical aspect of city .
we also show that analysis of geo-referenced tweet can shed significant light on physical aspect of the city and on the spatial distribution of urban function .
quantifying place : Analyzing the driver of pedestrian activity in dense urban environment .
understanding pedestrian behavior is critical for many aspect of city planning , design , and management , including transportation , public health , emergency response , and economic development .

this study bridges in-situ observation of pedestrian activity and urban computing by integrating high-resolution , large-scale , and heterogeneous urban dataset and analyzing both fixed attribute of the urban landscape ( e.g .
physical and transit infrastructure ) with dynamic environmental and socio-psychological factor , such as weather , air quality , and perceived crime risk .

we use local pedestrian count data collected by the New York City ( NYC ) Department of Transportation ( DOT ) and an extensive array of open dataset from NYC to test how pedestrian volume relate to land use , building density , streetscape quality , transportation infrastructure , and other factor typically associated with urban walkability .
we quantify , classify , and analyze place dynamic , including contextual and situational factor that influence pedestrian activity at high spatial–temporal resolution .
the quantification process measures the urban context by extracting rich , yet initially fragmented and siloed , urban data for individual geolocation .

based on these feature , we then construct contextual indicator by selecting and combining feature relevant to pedestrian activity , and develop a typology of place to support the generalizability of our analysis .

finally , we use multivariate regression model with panel-corrected standard error to estimate how specific contextual feature and time-varying situational indicator impact pedestrian activity across time of day , day of the week , season , and year .

the result provide insight into the key driver of local pedestrian activity and highlight the importance accounting for the immediate urban environment and socio-spatial dynamic in pedestrian behavior modeling .
structure of 311 service request as a signature of urban location .
while urban system demonstrate high spatial heterogeneity , many urban planning , economic and political decision heavily rely on a deep understanding of local neighborhood contexts .

we show that the structure of 311 Service Requests enables one possible way of building a unique signature of the local urban context , thus being able to serve as a low-cost decision support tool for urban stakeholder .

considering example of New York City , Boston and Chicago , we demonstrate how 311 Service Request recorded and categorized by type in each neighborhood can be utilized to generate a meaningful classification of location across the city , based on distinctive socioeconomic profile .
moreover , the 311-based classification of urban neighborhood can present sufficient information to model various socioeconomic feature .
finally , we show that these characteristic are capable of predicting future trend in comparative local real estate price .
we demonstrate 311 Service Requests data can be used to monitor and predict socioeconomic performance of urban neighborhood , allowing urban stakeholder to quantify the impact of their intervention .

this is an open access article distributed under the term of the Creative Commons Attribution License , which permits unrestricted use , distribution , and reproduction in any medium , provided the original author and source are credited .
strategway : Web solution for building public transportation route using big geodata analysis .
we propose Strategway , a group of web solution for public transportation route planning based on real geo-data obtained from city resident .
the idea behind the solution is to use collected data about city resident ' transportation need ( resident ' preference ) and to build an optimal route network minimizing total cost of ownership .
as transportation preference of people are represented as a large set of geoobject , machine learning algorithm were modified to take geodata specific into account .
strategway includes the analytic core for data gathering , clustering and route design based on machine learning technique .
these feature can be considered as contribution in smart algorithms for urban planning system .
pseudocode of main algorithms with novel addition are represented in the paper as the result of some case study .
future work is declared in the end to highlight the way of contribution to the domain of analytic as a web service .
where to go and what to do : Extracting leisure activity potential from Web data on urban space .
web data is the most prominent source of information for deciding where to go and what to do .
exploiting this source for geographic analysis , however , does not come without difficulty .
first , in recent year , the amount and diversity of available Web information about urban space have exploded , and it is therefore increasingly difficult to overview and exploit .
second , the bulk of information is in an unstructured form which is difficult to process and interpret by computer .

third , semi-structured source , such as Web ranking , geolocated tag , check-in , or mobile sensor data , do not fully reflect the more subtle quality of a place , including the particular function that make it attractive .
in this article , we explore a method to capture leisure activity potential from Web data on urban space using semantic topic model .
we test three supervised multi-label machine learning strategy exploiting geolocated webtexts and place tag to estimate whether a given type of leisure activity is afforded or not .

we train and validate these model on a manually curated dataset labeled with leisure ontology class for the city of Zwolle , and discuss their potential for urban leisure and tourism research and related city policy and planning .
we found that multi-label affordance estimation is not straightforward but can be made to work using both official webtexts and user-generated content on a medium semantic level .
this opens up new opportunity for data-driven approach to urban leisure and tourism study .
transparency in practice : Using visualization to enhance the interpretability of open data .
urban data is gradually being opened to the public .
tool for exploitation , analysis and discovery of new knowledge in large data set are the key to enable citizen to make sense of such large amount of data .
the purpose of this work is to analyze how data analysis associated with visualization technique in different level can lead to the improvement of the interpretability of open data .
with the support of machine learning technique , these visualization may improve pattern identification in urban data set .
to guide our discussion , a case study was conducted analyzing socioeconomic data released by the Chicago city government .
we discussed the use of different visualization in this scenario , tailored for univariate , bivariate and multivariate analysis .
we also performed an evaluation of the different form of visualization proposed in this work .
we could observe that allowing the user to explore open urban data using some specific visualization may lead to more effective data interpretation .
how should urban planner be trained to handle big data ?
historically urban planner have been educated and trained to work in a data poor environment .
urban planning student take course in statistic , survey research and projection and estimation that are designed to fill in the gap in this environment .
for decade they have learned how to use census data , which is comprehensive on several basic variable , but is only conducted once per decade so is almost always out of date .
more detailed population characteristic are based on a sample and are only available in aggregated form for larger geographic area .

but new data source , including distributed sensor , infrastructure monitoring , remote sensing , social media and cell phone tracking record , can provide much more detailed , individual , real time data at disaggregated level that can be used at a variety of scale .

we have entered a data rich environment , where we can have data on system and behavior for more frequent time increment and with a greater number of observation on a greater number of factor ( The Age of Big Data , The New York Times , 2012 ; Now you see it : simple visualization technique for quantitative analysis , Berkeley , 2009 ) .
planner are still being trained in method that are suitable for a data poor environment ( J Plan Educ Res 6:10–21 , 1986 ; Analytic over large-scale multidimensional data : the big data revolution !

in this paper we suggest that visualization , simulation , data mining and machine learning are the appropriate tool to use in this new environment and we discuss how planning education can adapt to this new data rich landscape .
we will discuss how these method can be integrated into the planning curriculum as well as planning practice .
predictive analytic can facilitate proactive property vacancy policy for city .
is it possible for a city to understand , analyze , predict , and therefore prevent vacant property ?

in this paper , we demonstrate the feasibility of using technique from machine learning and data mining to determine the future vacancy risk for individual property and for neighborhood using a variety of structural , demographic , socioeconomic , and city activity features with high accuracy .

within a larger systems-of-systems framework that we develop , these predictive analytic will allow a city to move from decision-making based on 'educated anecdote ' and reactive strategy aimed at the most urgent need , to policy development based on informed , holistic insight and proactive intervention that prevent and reverse decline .
a demonstration of the use of predictive analytic within the sociotechnical system is provided using data from Syracuse , New York .
using data mining technique to detect the personality of player in an educational game .
one of the goal of Educational Data Mining is to develop the method for student modeling based on educational data , such as ; chat conversation , class discussion , etc .
on the other hand , individual behavior and personality play a major role in Intelligent Tutoring Systems ( ITS ) and Educational Data Mining ( EDM ) .
thus , to develop a user adaptable system , the student 's behavior that occurring during interaction has huge impact EDM and ITS .

in this chapter , we introduce a novel data mining technique and natural language processing approach for automated detection student 's personality and behavior in an educational game ( Land Science ) where student act as intern in an urban planning firm and discuss in group their idea .
in order to apply this framework , input excerpt must be classified into one of six possible personality class .
we applied this personality classification method using machine learning algorithm , such as : Naive Bayes , Support Vector Machine ( SVM ) and Decision Tree .
reversed urbanism : Inferring urban performance through behavioral pattern in temporal telecom data .
a fundamental aspect of well performing city is successful public space .
for century , understanding these Place has been limited to sporadic observation and laborious data collection .
